loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a married man with 2 children who  describes himself as humble and ambitious. 

He has operated a retail business to sell soap, rice, sugar for 15 years. His business is located in a viable area and he has all types of customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of  funds. He will use 0,000 KES to buy  soap, rice, sugar and other items. 

sHis business goal is to have a wholesale shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his childrenl. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy  soap, rice, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Maren

texts.en:
Maren is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself as dedicated and has operated a retail business to sells sell jugs, sufurias, small tanks, basins, and other items for 3 years. 

Her business is located in a good area and she has all types of customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation costs. She will use 20,000 KES to buy basins, jugs, and other items. Her business goal is to have a large scale business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy basins, jugs, and other items

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a Kiva borrower with has 5 children. He operates a retail business to sell hides and skins. His primary customers are factories. He describes his biggest business challenge to be fluctuating prices. 

He will use 80,000 KES to buy hides and skins. His business goal is to own a big firm within 5 years. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy  hides and skins.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for  fresh and frozen meat, fish and vegetables

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a Kiva borrower. She has 2 children and describes herself as focused. She operates a retail business to sell torches, caps, cables, and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in an area with potential. 

She will use 40,000 KES to buy caps, cables, torches, and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful business woman. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. A previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy  caps, cables, torches, and other items.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with 4 children who describes herself as determined. She operates a food stall to cook food to sell. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and she has all types of customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of  capital. She will use the 20,000 KES to buy ingredients to prepare food. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Maa Brundabati Group

texts.en:
Sasmita, about 27 years old, is the group leader of an 11-member group from Kamegaon village situated in the Kalahandi district of Odisha state in India. Her family is comprised of four members: her husband and one son about six years old and one daughter about three years old. The member standing at the extreme left in the front line wearing a blue saree is Sasmita. She is a very active lady who wants some extra income from her own efforts. She has been running a grocery shop with the support of her husband for the last eight years.

Sasmita, along with other 10 members of her village, formed a self-help group and it is the first time they availed a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for development of their existing business.  At present, the family income of Sasmita is Rs. 6,500 only per month, which is not sufficient to maintain her family.
 
To improve her living conditions and to earn some extra income, she wants to avail a loan. With the loan, she will purchase a big stock of turmeric, rice, wheat, pulses, washing powder, soaps, tea, sugar, biscuits, oil, salt, onions, potatoes etc for her grocery shop. She has a dream to be a wholesaler of turmeric as well as to provide better education to her children.

Regarding the other 10 members of the group, they also want loans for the development of their existing business like a Paddy business, grocery shop, livestock business, seasonal business and vegetable vending.

loans.use: to purchase turmeric, rice, wheat, pulses, washing powder, soaps, tea, sugar, biscuits, oil, salt, onions, and potatoes

loans.name: Shiva Shakti Group

texts.en:
Pratima, aged about 36 years, is the group leader of a ten-member group from Kerandikhandi village, situated in Kalahandi district of Odisha, India. Her family comprises four members: her husband, and one son and one daughter aged about 10 and 6 years. The member standing third from right in the front line with a blue saree is Pratima.

At present, she is doing vegetable cultivation as well as vegetable vending, with the help of her husband for the last seven years. Pratima is a very active lady who wants some extra income from her own efforts.

At present, her family’s income is Rs. 7,500 per month, which is not sufficient to maintain her family. To improve her living condition and to earn some extra income, she wants to avail herself of a loan. From the loan, she will purchase good-quality seeds and fertilizer for vegetable cultivation. It will be the first cycle loan for the group from Mahashakti.

Pratima has a dream to be a wholesaler of vegetables in her locality.

The other nine members of the group also want loans for the development of their existing businesses such as – goatery, tailoring, daily laborer, vegetable vending, and seasonal business.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality seeds and fertilizer for vegetable cultivation.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 29 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Jovelyn has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from a bakeshop. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Alita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell shrimp business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Alita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more boxes of shrimp to sell for her buy-and-sell shrimp business.

Alita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of shrimp to sell

loans.name: Pep's Group

texts.en: Pep’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh city in Cambodia. Pep makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Ith's Group

texts.en: Ith’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Ith makes a living cultivating rice and planting watermelon and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en: Heng’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Heng makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Saren's Group

texts.en: Saren’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Saren makes a living cultivating rice and planting watermelon and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Phy's Group

texts.en:
Phy’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Phy grows  rice for a living and  works as tailor to support her family. 

Their village has no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water and they wish to have a water filter at home  to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Setkobor Tuiyobet Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Grace, a member of Setkobor Tuiyobet women group. She is fifty-four years old, married and blessed with five children.

Grace is a  farmer who grows maize, peas and potatoes. Having undergone Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management, she learnt how to draw her budget and plan the business well. She is borrowing a loan from Kiva, which she intends to use in boosting her peas farming business by buying manure and fertilizer. She plans to use the profit generated from the enterprise to pay school fees for her children.

Grace is very grateful to Kiva for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Fanis

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Fanis, a single mother and blessed with five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HIH EA) in December 2013.  Fanis runs a grocery shop where she sells vegetables and fruits such as kale, cabbages, carrots, mangoes, and bananas. 

Having gone through HIH EA enterprise training, she is now able to manage her business well, keep correct farm records, and manage the business cash flow. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to add more stock to meet her customers’ needs, thus maximizing her profits. Anticipated income increments will help support her children’s education and other basic family needs.  She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock of kale, cabbages, carrots, mangoes, and bananas.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Jacinta, fifty-six  years old, married and blessed with two children. Jacinta’s economic activity is maize and beans farming. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in August 2013 and she has received training on enterprise development and financial planning which have equipped her with skills to manage her enterprise. 

She is borrowing a loan from Kiva so that she can purchase farm inputs such as manure and fertilizer. She hopes this will help boost her business and increase her income. This will enable her to support her family by providing food and clothing.

Jacinta is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Joyce, 23 years old and blessed with two children. Joyce earns a living through farming potatoes and maize. She is happy for the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa enterprise training she received, which equipped her with skills to manage her business. 

The high demand in the market has made Joyce to apply for a loan to boost the potato farming by buying manure and fertilizer that will improve on productivity. This will improve her business and also increase her income. Thus, she will be able to meet her objective of educating the children. Joyce is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kisab Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Leah, a member of Kisab Women Group. She is fifty-five years old, married and blessed with six children. Leah farms maize, beans and potatoes. She is happy for the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training she received which equipped her with the knowledge that has assisted her in financial management. She is borrowing from Kiva to boost her potato farming business by buying farm inputs such as fertilizer and manure. This will help improve productivity from the projected bountiful harvest. She intends to use part of the profit to provide food to the family and pay school fees.

Leah is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as manure and fertilizer that will help improve the harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ducklings and high quality feed.

loans.name: Cristhian

texts.es:
Crsthian es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, esta estudiando a la vez que trabaja, es una persona que se esfuerza para poder salir adelante y poder realizarse como persona y como profesional.
Esta estudiando la carrera de ingeniería agrónoma, y quiere poder aplicar el día de mañana todo ese conocimiento en ayudar a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda para poder seguir creciendo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Cristhian is from the city of Caaguazú. He is studying and also works. He is a person who works very hard to succeed personally and professionally. He is studying agricultural engineering and wants to later apply this knowledge to help others.
He is requesting this loan to pay his university tuition. This will be a great help for him in continuing to grow.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Thành

texts.en:
Mrs. Thành works in agriculture farming food.

Thành is 48 years old, and she is married with 4 children. Thành lives in the Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thành's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thành has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thành faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Thành hopes for her children to find a good job, to build a new house, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Tâm

texts.en:
Tâm works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle.

Tâm is 39 years old, and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in the Hau Loc district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Tâm's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tâm has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Tâm hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es una señora que trabaja incansablemente para contribuir al desarrollo de su amada familia; la cual se compone de 4 hijos y su esposo. Ella tiene 32 años de edad, está casado. 

Ella se dedica con mucha satisfacción y entusiasmo a la elaboración de ropa típica en la comunidad donde vive; la labor lo realiza en su casa de habitación; ella empezó a ejercer esta actividad desde muy joven porque le gustaba tejer y lo aprendió de sus padres; lleva a cabo esta actividad porque es el medio que le ayuda a generar los ingresos económicos necesarios para el sustento de su familia; en estos años se ha dado cuenta que esta actividad tiene mucha demanda, principalmente en su comunidad porque todas las personas que viven cerca de ella utilizan este tipo de vestimenta.
 
El uso respectivo que le dará al préstamo que solicita es la compra de hilo.

Uno de sus principales anhelos o sueños es que en un futuro sus ganancias incrementen y con ello construir otra casa y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca is a woman who works tirelessly to contribute to the well-being of her beloved family. It is made up of her 4 children and her husband. She is 32 years old and married.

With great satisfaction and enthusiasm, she makes her living by making traditional clothing in her community. She does this in her home. She started this occupation very young because she liked to weave, something she learned from her parents.

She performs this occupation because it is the way in which she helps generate the necessary income to support her family. Recently, she has realized that it is in high demand, mainly in her community, because everyone who lives near her wears this type of clothing.

She will use this loan to purchase thread.

One of her greatest desires or dreams is that in the future, her income will increase, and that with it, she will be able to build another house to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy thread

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal SIEMPRE UNIDOS, el socio tiene 42 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es conviviente, él socio alterna sus  actividades diarias dedicándose  a la carpinteria,el socio elabora camanas,muebles entre otros, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio a la vez trabaja en una empresa privada, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de madera.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Felipe belongs to the Siempre Unidos communal bank. He is 42 and has two children and a partner. He is a carpenter. He makes furniture and other items. He has had this business for some time and it is going well for him thanks to his daily hard work. He also works for a private company. 
Felipe wants to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting his family.
He will use this loan for the purchase of wood.
He is grateful to have this loan and promises to repay his quotas as established.

loans.use: to purchase wood.

loans.name: Tâm

texts.en:
Mrs. Tâm works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle.

Tâm is 37 years old, and she is married with 3 children. Tâm has her business in the Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Tâm's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tâm has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that Tâm faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Tâm hopes to build a new house, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan works in agriculture, farming food.

Lan is 43 years old, and she is married with 2 children. Lan lives in the Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Lan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Lan hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan operates a food stall/restaurant selling snacks.

Lan is 32 years old, and she is married with 2 children. Lan lives in the Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Lan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lan has been involved in this business for 2 years. The main hardship that Lan faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Lan hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung, a 58-year-old married mother of four, lives in Hau Loc district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. For three years now, she has been operating a retail business selling general items such as sugar, salt, and dry food.

One of the critical difficulties that concerns Dung is not having a hygienic latrine. She is therefore requesting her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profits, Dung hopes to build a new house, for her family be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married woman with 7 children between the ages of 5 and 16 . She describes herself as committed. She has operated a retail business to sells jaggery (cane sugar) for 10 years. 

Her business is located in a marketable area and she has all types of customers. She will use 90,000 KES to buy more stock of jaggery. Her business goal is to have a large scale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy jaggery.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a married man with 2 children who are 1 and 5. He describes himself ass hardworking. He has operated a retail business to sell  soap, sugar, flour, and other household items for 4 years.

His business is located in a busy market and he has regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge is a lack of finances. He will use  40,000 KES to buy  soap, flour, sugar, and other items. 

His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a better life. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy soap, flour, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself as intelligent. She  grows crops and her primary customers are local people. 

She describes her biggest business challenge is water. She will use 20,000 KES to buy seeds. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en: Sheila is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a restaurant where she cooks food for sale. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. She will use this loan to buy  ingredients for preparing the food she sells. Her business goal is to have a bigger restaurant within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy stock of ingredients.

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy is grateful that she was granted a 25,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. She is glad that through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses.

She would now like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and canned goods, which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and to pay for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. She wishes everyone a Blessed New Year!

Ludy dreams of having a bigger grocery store someday. She aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her fellowship group* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 56 years old and married with nine children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Leonila is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to pay laborers' salaries for land preparation.

Leonila has been farming rice for two years and earns additional income from furniture making.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay laborers' salaries for land preparation

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es una mujer de 37 años vive en una comunidad de Sololá, tiene dos hijas uno de 16 años y la segunda de 10 años, ellas estudian en una escuela de su comunidad. 
Antonia es una mujer muy trabajadora y le gusta apoyar a su esposo para genera ingresos para su familia, ella desde ya hace varios años se dedica a la venta de pilones  o almácigos de café, esta actividad lo realiza desde su casa, es muy reconocida por la comunidad y la llegan a buscar para las compras. De esta manera ella complementa los gastos de la casa. 
Antonia para el progreso de su familia tiene otro segundo ingreso, ella en su comunidad cultiva también banano y café, y lo vende al menudeo y al por mayor ya que ella siembra alrededor de 25 cuerdas entre banano y café. 
Antonia siempre quiere dar lo mejor para sus hijas, ella tiene muchos sueños para el progreso de su familia, el anhelo de ella, es que sus hijas sigan estudiando hasta llegar hacer profesionales, pero para la comodidad de sus hijas ella necesita comprar un terreno para construirles una casa más  cómoda, y tener un lugar más digno para descansar, La meta de Antonia es conseguir el préstamo para poder comprar el terreno.
texts.en:
Antonia is a 37 year old woman who lives in a community of Sololá. She has two daughters aged 16 and 10 years old. They study at a school in their community.

Antonia is a very hardworking woman. She likes to help her husband to generate income for their family. She has several years experience working with the sale of coffee seedlings. This activity is done from home and it is widely recognized by the community. They come to look and purchase. In this way, she adds to the income of the house.

Additionally, Antonia has a second income to support the progress of her family. Her community grows bananas and coffee and she sells them retail and wholesale. She sows around 25 acres between bananas and coffee.

Antonia always wants to give the best to her daughters. She has many dreams for the progress of her family. Her desire is for her daughters to keep studying until they are professionals. For the comfort of her daughters she needs to buy land to build them a more comfortable home and to have a decent place to sleep. Antonia's goal is to get a loan to buy the land.

loans.use: to purchase land.

loans.name: Vitendo Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Martha of Vitendo Self Help Group. She is a 46-year-old widow who takes care of her six children and three grandchildren. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in August 2014.

Martha is a maize and dairy farmer. She is happy with Hand in Hand Eastern Africa for the training she received on record keeping and enterprise development that helped her commercialize her farming. She is borrowing from Kiva in order to buy fertilizer and hybrid seeds to boost her farming and thus increase her income, which she plans to use in meeting schooling expenses for her children and food for the entire family. 

Martha is so grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and planting seeds to help boost her farming.

loans.name: Binodini's Group

texts.en:
Manjubala, aged about 36 years, is the leader of a group of twelve members and hails from Pourkela village of Kalahandi district of Odisha, India. She is living with her husband and two sons of 8 and 5 years age. The member seated second from the left in the front row and showing her hand is Manjubala.

Manjubala has been managing a grocery shop in her locality for the last seven years. Her family’s income per month is Rs. 8,000 only. It is not at all sufficient to lead a better life.

Manjubala, along with the other eleven members from her locality, formed a self-help group and applied for a loan from Mahashakti for the development of their businesses. It is their first-cycle loan.

From the loan, Manjubala will purchase rice, wheat, pulses, washing powder, soaps, tea, sugar, biscuits, oil, salt, onions, potatoes, and other grocery items to increase the stock for the growth of the business.

She has a dream to be a wholesaler for grocery shops at her locality.

The other eleven members of the group also want loans for the development of their existing businesses such as – grocery shop, seasonal business, vegetable vending, paddy business, and fancy store.

loans.use: to purchase rice, wheat, pulses, washing powder, soaps, tea, sugar, biscuits, oil, salt, onions, and potatoes.

loans.name: Barut Young Mothers Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Evaryne, a member of Barut young mothers group. She is twenty-nine years old, married and a mother of one. Evaryne joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 (HIH EA).

She does vegetable farming and also operates a grocery shop where she has been selling vegetables and fruits for the last year. Having gone through HiH EA enterprise training, she is now able to successfully manage her enterprise and earn profit. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds in order to increase her vegetable yield and satisfy the demand of her customers. This will increase her business income and enable her to educate her child. 

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their help and support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and planting seeds

loans.name: Kiletien Women Group

texts.en:
Milka, raising her hand in the photo, is a member of kiletien Women Group. She is forty-five years old and blessed with six children. Three of her children are in primary school, one in secondary while the other two are in college. Milka is married and lives with her six children. 

She runs a kiosk selling foodstuffs such as flour and sugar. She also works in maize farming. She is taking a loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers .She hopes that her business will go well, so that she is in a position to increase her level of income. This will enable her be in position to provide food and pay school fees for her children. 

Milka is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Caren. She is married and a mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013.

Caren works in maize and bean farming. She also keeps dairy goats and sells milk in the local dairy. She is grateful to HiH EA for instilling in her a culture of saving, business management skills and prudent money management through the trainings. She is taking a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds, animal feeds and fertilizers for the upcoming planting season. She hopes this will in return lead to better crop yields and goat productivity, so that she can generate a higher income that is sufficient to cater for her family needs of food, Medicare and children's education.

Caren is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support. She promises to repay this loan promptly

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds, animal feeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Chanuka Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Alphana, a member of Chanuka Women Group. She is 41 years old, married and a mother of four. Two of her children are in school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.

She does maize and beans farming as her main business. She has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa's training on enterprise and financial management that has assisted her in budgeting and record keeping. She is borrowing from Kiva to expand her business by buying fertilizer and manure so that she can increase her income. This will assist her to provide the family's needs and pay school fees. 

Alphana is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and manure that will help improve her crop yield.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Nancy, 30 years old, married and a mother of three. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.

She does maize and beans farming as her main business. She has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa's training on enterprise and financial management, which has enabled her to manage the business well. She is borrowing from Kiva to expand her business by buying farm inputs such as manure and fertilizer so that she can increase her income. This will assist her to provide the family's needs and pay school fees. 

Nancy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as manure and fertilizer that will help improve productivity.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
This is Hannah, 37 years old and blessed with three children. She does maize and bean farming in Nakuru, Kenya. She has over ten years experience in this business. Hannah has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to boost her farming business by buying farm inputs such as manure and fertilizer. 

She looks forward to a bounty harvest, and thus more income. She plans to use the anticipated income to cater for her family’s basic needs such as food, to save money for future use, and to plough back some profits to help expand the business. Hannah is grateful for the Kiva loan and promises to make payments promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure that will boost her farming.

loans.name: Maida

texts.es:
aida es estudiante y a la vez también está trabajando, es una persona que se está esforzando por poder ser alguien en la vida, y por medio de ello ir abriéndose camino en el mercado laboral.
Está estudiando la carrera de derecho, y comenta que de aquí a un tiempo se ve ya como una abogada recibida, ayudando en su profesión.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar los gastos de titulación que tiene, ya que debe cubrir ese gasto y con ello cubrir su titulación.
texts.en:
Maida is a student, and at the same time she is working. She is a person who is making an effort to be someone in life, and in that way be prepared to enter the labor market.

She is studying law, and she comments that in a while, she already sees herself as a graduate lawyer, helping in her profession.

She is asking for this loan to be able to pay for the costs of earning a degree, now that she needs to pay for that cost and then pay for her degree.

loans.use: To pay the costs of earning a degree

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy gourds.

loans.name: Nậu

texts.en:
Nậu works in agriculture farming food.

Nậu is 63 years old and she is married with two children.
Nậu lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nậu's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Nậu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Nậu faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Nậu hopes to build a new house, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Phượng

texts.en:
Phượng works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle.

Phượng is 59 years old, and she is married with four children.
Phượng lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2006, Phượng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Phượng has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Phượng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Phượng faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine.She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profits, Phượng hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Ánh

texts.en:
Ánh works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle.

Ánh is 37 years old, and he is married with three children.
Ánh lives with three dependents in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Ánh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Ánh has been involved in this business for four years.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns him is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

With his business profits, Ánh hopes for his children to do well in school, for his family to be healthy and happy, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle.

Lan is 53 years old, and she is married with three children.
Lan lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lan has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Lan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Lan faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profits, Lan hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Jose Elmer

texts.es: José tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 13 años de edad. José trabaja como albañil independiente desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la mejora del techo y de la paredes de la vivienda. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, cemento, arena y hierro para cambiar el techo y repellar las paredes de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Jose, 35 years old, lives in his own home with his life partner and 13-year-old daughter.

He's been working independently as a construction worker for many years now. This is how he earns a living and puts the food on the family table.

He wants to improve the condition of his home, and is requesting this loan from FUSAI to repair the roof and the walls.

With the requested loan amount, he will buy galvanized metal sheeting, cement, sand and iron, to replace the roof and plaster the walls of the home.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting, cement, sand and iron, to replace the roof and plaster the walls of his home.

loans.name: Lạnh

texts.en:
Lạnh works in agriculture farming food.

Lạnh is 60 years old, and she is married with six children.
Lạnh lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Lạnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Lạnh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Lạnh faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profits, Lạnh hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Panfilo

texts.es:
Panfilo es un hombre de 52 años de edad, casado, tiene 1 hijo de 17 años y su negocio es la elaboración y venta de empanadas.
Él es independiente, cuidadoso, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’, un área rural que se mantiene como granero de la ciudad, por la producción de cereales, verduras y frutas, maíz, trigo, cebada, hortalizas, frutilla, plátanos, papayas, naranjas, manzanas, duraznos y hasta plantas de tumbo. Las construcciones del lugar son mayormente antiguas y no cuentan con servicios básicos.
Panfilo es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y también habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. la casa donde vive casi toda su vida perteneciente a su familia, cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo, la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al comercio de fruta y su hijo que estudia en la escuela; “vengo tratando de terminar mi casa desde hace mucho tiempo, quisiera tener agua potable…” comenta. Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa, el desea realizar la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene construyendo su casa. 
Es por esos motivos que Panfilo solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para darle a su familia un lugar seguro donde vivir.
texts.en:
Panfilo, age 52, is married and has a 17 year old son.  His business is making and selling empanadas.

He is independent, conscientious, responsible, and hard-working.  He works in the ‘Sacaba’ area.  It is a rural area that is maintained as a granary for the city for the production of cereals, vegetables and fruits, corn, wheat, barley, greens, strawberries, bananas, papayas, oranges, apples, peaches, and even passion fruit.  The buildings in this place are mostly ancient, and they do not have basic services.

Panfilo has a dark complexion, is short, and has short black hair.  His mother language is Quechua, which is spoken in this area.  He also speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for the business that he does.  The house where he lives has belonged to his family almost his entire life.  It has electricity and well water.  He shares the house with his life partner, who sells fruit, and his son, who goes to school.

“I have been trying to finish my house for a long time.  I would like to have potable water,” he says.  His dream is to finish building his house.  He wants to install potable water in his kitchen, bathroom, and laundry area.  This is his second loan cycle with this institution in the five years that he has been building his house.

It is for these reasons that Panfilo is requesting a loan to install potable water in the kitchen, bathroom, and laundry area in order to give his family a safe place to live.

loans.use: to install potable water in the kitchen, bathroom, and laundry area in order to give his family a safe place to live.

loans.name: Đoàn

texts.en:
Đoàn works in agriculture laying bricks.

Đoàn is 43 years old, and he is married with three children.
Đoàn lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Đoàn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Đoàn has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Đoàn faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

With his business profits, Đoàn hopes for his business to do well, for his children to find a good job, and for his family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Liên

texts.en:
Liên works in agriculture laying bricks.

Liên is 38 years old, and she is married with two children. Lien lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Liên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Liên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Liên hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa has a service business laying bricks.

Hoa is 52 years old, and she is married with three children.
Hoa Lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Hoa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Hoa faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Hoa hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly works in agriculture farming food.

Ly is 42 years old, and she is married with two children.
Ly lives with two dependents in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Ly joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Ly has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Ly has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Ly faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Ly hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa is a Kiva borrower. She has six children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are large scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the loan to buy farm inputs. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as honest. 

Esther operates a farm where she grows coffee and other crops. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a strategic place, and her primary customers are large scale. 

Esther says her biggest business challenge is lack of finances. She will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for six years. 

Her business is located in a fertile area, and her primary customers are large scale. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of finances. 

Alice will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she grows maize and other crops. She has been involved in this business for six years. 

Charity's business is located in a fertile area, and her primary customers are large scale. She says her biggest business challenge is lack of finances. 

Charity will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Celine

texts.en: Celine is a married woman. She has two children who are 2 and 6 years old. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business selling clothes. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a populated area, and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more inventory of clothes. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy inventory of clothes

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en: Belinda is a married woman. She has three children between the ages of 1 and 5. She describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more inventory of clothes. Her business goal is to open a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better life.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be promising. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient capital. She will use the loan to buy more stock. Her business goal is to expand within five years.

loans.use: buy more stock.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows crops and keeps animals. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will expand. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is a Kiva borrower. He has three children between the ages of 1 and 6. He describes himself to be creative. He operates a transportation business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to own a taxi within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have better living standards.

loans.use: to buy another motorycle

loans.name: Norcamar

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Norcamar works hard to support her family.

She has a farming of vegetables business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling clothing. Norcamar is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her farming of vegetables business.

Norcamar has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Hmaw Bi Village Group 1

texts.en:
Located in Mawbi Village in Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region, the community consists of 30 village customers (12 Male, 18 Female), including five CBOs (Community Based Organization), leading the loans in certain areas. This loan will help Mawbi Group 1 purchase good quality feed ($22 for a packet, 5 days feeds for 100 ducks) and to rebuild the whole duck farms (cost $100) that need to be changed every three years. Some village customers will only change the stage of the duck farm (cost $15).

The villagers mostly are farmers and raise ducks, pigs and hens as livestock. The housewives mostly open small grocery stores at home and fishing isn't very wide in the village. 

In the above picture are the CBOs from Mawbi Group 1: U Aung, U Hlaing, U Aye and U San. Two of the CBOs, U Hlaing and U Aung (in the middle) aren’t taking the loan. Instead they are helping the group. 

U Aye (first from right) is 47 years old and is married with four children. His two sons are working as cycle carriers in town and the others are at school. He takes care of their 180 ducks while his wife looks after their small grocery store. He thinks that there are sufficient ducks for the moment and so with the loan, he will only buy high quality feed.

loans.use: To purchase high quality feed for ducks and rebuild the duck farms.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
This is Teresa, 59 years old, married and a mother of 11 children. She does maize and beans farming as her economic activity. Having undergone the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise creation and management, she is now equipped with skills to manage her enterprise. She is borrowing from Kiva to purchase farm inputs such as seeds, storage sacks and manure. She hopes her farming will flourish with increased profits that she plans to use in supporting her children's education.
 
Teresa is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds, storage sacks and manure to improve the crop yield.

loans.name: Amelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Amelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling sea shells in the Philippines, and also earns income from her general store.  Amelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sea shells to sell.

Amelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of sea shells to sell

loans.name: Sergio Andres

texts.es:
Él es Sergio, un hombre dedicado a la venta de alimentos, los cuales vende frescos pues desde tempranas horas de la madrugada se levanta a hacerlos.
Es joven tan solo con 24 años, sin hijos y un futuro por delante, le apasiona trabajar y a pesar de que por un accidente ya no puede ejercer algunos trabajos hace lo posible por rebuscarse su sustento diario.
Sergio solicita un crédito para la compra de masa y queso y una freidora industrial que es más grande para freír más productos.
Su objetivo es salir adelante y no dejarse vencer por su incapacidad
texts.en:
He is Sergio, a man who makes a living selling food which he sells fresh; he gets up in the early morning hours to make it. 

He is young, only 24 years old, without children and a future ahead of him. He is passionate about working and even though because of an accident now he cannot perform some jobs, he does what is possible to search for his daily sustenance.

Sergio is asking for a loan to buy masa and cheese and an industrial deep-fryer that is bigger in order to fry more products. 

His goal is to get ahead and not be defeated by his disability.

loans.use: To buy an industrial deep-fryer for faster cooking

loans.name: Yamile

texts.es:
Yamile una humilde y trabajadora joven de 25 años de edad, madre de una hija que tiene 8 años de edad, se dedica a prestar servicios de sala de belleza y entre su portafolio se encuentra el arreglo de uñas, cabello y masajes. 
Esta mujer poco a poco con trabajo y con esfuerzo ha ido consiguiendo sus implementos para trabajar.
Yamile aprendió del oficio gracias a clases, capacitaciones y cursos de actualización en el tema y quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de una máquina para realizar masajes e implementos para realizar el arreglo de uñas, sabe que ella es baja de recursos pero el trabajo será su carta de victoria para salir de la pobreza.
texts.en:
Yamile is a humble and hardworking young woman who is 25 years old.  She is the mother of an 8 year-old child and makes a living providing beauty salon services.  Her portfolio includes nails, hair, and massages.

With work and with effort, this woman has been able to gradually obtain her tools to work.  Yamile learned this trade thanks to classes, training, and refresher courses in this field.  She wants to request a loan to buy a machine to give massages and tools to do nails.  She knows that she is has a low level of resources, but this work will be her ticket to escape poverty.

loans.use: to buy tools to give massages and to do nails

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer soltera de 56 años de edad, carismática, amable, muy devota que le gustaría iniciar su negocio de restaurante para el cual necesita mucha ayuda.
Como se puede observar en la foto tiene un buen espacio, donde quizás no sea el más hermoso pero es muy aseado, con la ayuda prestataria que se encuentra solicitando comprara mesas, sillas y surtido para iniciar su negocio, ya que con los ahorros que ha juntado ha ido comprando los implementos que se pueden ver en la foto.
Ayuda a esta empresaria que solo necesita un pequeño monto para iniciar su negocio, un apoyo significara mucho para esta mujer que no tiene en quien apoyarse.
texts.en:
Gloria is a 56 year old single woman. She is charismatic, friendly and very devoted. She would like to start a restaurant business for which she needs a lot of help. As you can see in the photo, she has a good space, while perhaps it isn't the most beautiful but it is very clean. With help from the loan she is seeking she will buy tables, chairs, and stock to start her business, as with the savings she has gathered she has been buying the implements that you can see in the photo.

Help this young businesswoman who only needs a small loan to start a business. Your support will mean a lot to this woman who doesn't have anyone to support her.

loans.use: to start her own restaurants, buying chairs, tables, stock, tablecloths, equipment; everything needed to get the business started.

loans.name: Amparo Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ella es Amparo una humilde, trabajadora agricultora madre cabeza de familia, su capacidad y su incansable espíritu hace que esta mujer trabaje hasta 15 horas por día, la apoyan sus hijos pero Amparo quiere trabajar y trabajar, su tierra es todo para ella, la cuida y trata de sacarle el mayor provecho sin dañar sus cultivos.
Apoyar esta mujer es apoyar a las madres del campo que dedican todo su vida a cuidar y velar por el bienestar de su familia y lo impresionante es ver a una mujer desempeñar el trabajo duro y pesado que comúnmente es realizado por hombres, debido a las pesadas cargas y el cansancio físico que este genera.
Amparo solicita un crédito para la compre de postes, enredaderas, insumos como pesticidas, fungicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, semillas, abono.
texts.en:
Amparo is a humble, hard-working farmer. She is a mother and head of the family. Her talents and tireless spirit enables this woman to work 15 hours per day. Her children support her but Amparo wants to work and work. Her farmland is everything to her. She takes care of it and tries to take the best advantage of it possible without damaging her crops.

Supporting this woman is supporting mothers from the countryside who dedicate all their life to taking care of and watching over the well-being of their families. The impressive part is seeing a woman successful in the hard and heavy work that is typically done by men, due to the difficult chores and physical demands that this work generates.

Amparo seeks a loan to buy pesticides, fungicides, insecticides, seeds, fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fungicides, insecticides, seeds, fertilizers.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows crops and keeps animals. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a strategic place, and her primary customers are large scale. 

Sabina says her biggest business challenge is lack of finances. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins is a married man. He has four children with ages ranging from three years to sixteen years. He describes himself as determined. He operates a retail business where he sells juices, flour, cooking fat, sugar and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a rural area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as theft. 

Collins will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, juices, flour and other items. He hopes that in the future he will have a supermarket. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, juices, flour and other items

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Lucas is a married man. He has two children who are four and seven years old. He describes himself as determined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are the general public. 

Lucas says his biggest business challenge is the lack of finances. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a new motorcycle. His business goal is to have more motorcycles within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be financially stable. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as disciplined. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, rice, bread and other items. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. 

Mary says her biggest business challenge to be insufficient stock. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, bread, flour and other items. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her second  loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, bread, flour and other items

loans.name: Maria Lucila

texts.es:
Maria Lucila tiene 32 años, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge y su menor hijo en el distrito de Cayaltí, en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. Los pobladores de esta zona se dedican al comercio, agricultura y ganadería como actividades económicas principales.

Ella se dedica a la venta de comida preparada desde aproximadamente 03 años, cuenta con clientes fijos en la zona quienes brindan muy buenas referencias comerciales y laborales de ella. El destino del préstamo será para la compra de ollas, utensilios de cocina, mesas y sillas para implementar su negocio, con esto Maria Lucila espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes brindandoles mayor comodidad, esto le permitirá incrementar su volumen de ventas y aumentar sus ingresos lo que le generará una mayor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Lucila, age 32, lives in her own house with her husband and her minor son in the Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.  The inhabitants of this area devote themselves to commerce, farming, and livestock as their primary business activities.

She has been selling prepared food for approximately three years.  She has fixed customers in the area, and they give her very good commercial and work references.

The loan will be used to buy pots, kitchen utensils, tables, and chairs to use in her business.  With this, Maria Lucila hopes to provide better service to her customers, and she hopes to make them more comfortable.  This will allow her to increase her volume of sales and to increase her income.  This will generate a better quality of life for her.

loans.use: to buy pots, kitchen utensils, tables, and chairs to use in her business.

loans.name: Bilma De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Bilma tiene 48 años de edad, vive en una comunidad de Trojes al Oriente de Honduras, vive con su esposo y sus hijas en casa propia, su esposo trabaja una empresa privada y ella se dedica a la elaboración de pan.
Doña Bilma cuenta con más de 15 años de dedicarse a esta labor y tiene una muy buena clientela, vende sus productos en los negocios de la zona los cuales le prefieren por su calidad y buen precio. 
Doña Bilma está solicitando el préstamo para comprar: maíz, aceite, azúcar, huevos, etc. productos necesarios para le elaboración de estos de los panes que elabora como ser rosquillas, hojaldras y quesadillas.
Doña Bilma espera esta inversión le permita salir adelante con su negocio y a su vez que le genere las ganancias necesarias para salir adelante con su familia. 

 Trojes, Honduras - Diciembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Bilma is 48 years old and lives in a community called Trojes al Oriente in Honduras.  She lives with her spouse and her children in her own house.  Her husband works for a private business, and she makes a living preparing bread.  Bilma has made a living with this work for more than 15 years and has a very good client base.  She sells her products to businesses in the area that prefer them for their quality and good price.

Bilma is requesting this loan to buy: corn, oil, sugar, eggs, etc, all of which are necessary products to make her breads, including donuts, pastries, and quesadillas.  Bilma hopes that this investment will allow her to move forward with her business and in turn, generate the necessary income to move forward with her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, sugar, eggs, etc. for her business

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more ingredients to sell like shrimp, canned goods, meat and more for her food vending business.

Geraldine earns additional income from farming rice. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she is requesting another loan to further build her businesses.

Geraldine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to sell like shrimp, canned goods, and meat

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Gilda works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Gilda is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Gilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Dina works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling gasoline.  Dina is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Dina has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of three children, Nilda works hard to support her family. She has a frozen foods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and pig fattening.  Nilda is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more frozen foods to sell to customers.

Nilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Ernida

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ernida works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell bananas business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Ernida is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of bananas to sell for her business.

Ernida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Lelita

texts.en:
Lelita is 58 years old and a widow with four children. Lelita works very hard to provide for them.

Lelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lelita has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack food, noodles and other groceries.

In the future Lelita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer con la mente muy positiva y lo que busca cada dia es progreso para su familia, ella tiene 51 años y vive en una comunidad muy bonita. 

Juana es una señora muy optimista, busca los medios como generar ingresos económicos para ajustar los gastos en su hogar, para que su familia tenga lo necesario, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes, la tienda lo tiene en su casa, eso le da ventaja para ella porque se evita de pagar local, y la otra ventaja es que paralelo a su negocio  puede realizar los oficios de su casa y cuidar a sus hijos  

Juana con la amabilidad que atiende su tienda y con los años de experiencia siempre vende y genera sus ganancias, pero con las ganancias que genera  no es  suficiente para la meta  y el sueño  de Juana. Ella para satisfacer sus necesidades, busca otras opciones de como adquirirlo, Ella ahora necesita un préstamo para comprar un lote de terreno, para aprovechar esta oportunidad que se le está presentando, El sueño de Juana más grande es que en un futuro, cada uno de sus hijos tenga su propio terreno donde poder construir.
texts.en:
Juana is a woman with a very positive mindset who strives every day to help her family progress. She is 51 years old and lives in a very nice community.
Juana is a very optimistic lady and is always looking for ways to make income to pay the household expenses so that her family has everything they need. She makes her living selling groceries. The store is in her house, which gives her an advantage because she doesn’t have to pay for a retail space. The other advantage is that while she tends her business, she can do household chores and take care of her children.
Because of her friendliness and many years of experience, Juana always has success selling her products and generating profits, but these profits are not sufficient for her goal and dream. So she is looking for other options to achieve her dream. She needs a loan to buy a plot of land to seize an opportunity that has presented itself. Juana’s biggest dream is that in the future, each of her children will have their own land to build on.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fishing net, bamboo, plastic rope, etc. for her fishing business.

Imelda has been in this business for 14 years. She also earns more income from buying and selling live fish. Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, bamboo, plastic rope, etc.

loans.name: Yamile

texts.es:
Una sala de belleza represento para Yamile un luz de esperanza ante los graves problemas de desempleo que afronta la zona, no solo le permitió ocuparse en algo si no velar por el cuidado de sus dos hijos menores de edad de 11 y 6 años de edad y que hora ve la posibilidad de implementar una venta de cosméticos y productos capilares. 
Queriendo impulsar su nueva entrada de dinero Yamile solicita un crédito para la compra de variedad de insumos no solo de belleza, de cuidado de cuerpo, cuidado capilar, tratamientos etc.
texts.en:
For Yamile, a beauty salon represented a light of hope in the face of the serious problem of unemployment that faces her area.  Not only did it permit her to be busy, but also to look after the care of her two young children, ages 11 and 6.  Now she sees the possibility of implementing the sale of cosmetics as well as hair products.  

Wanting to promote the new influx of money, Yamile is asking for a loan for the purchase of a variety of products not only for beauty, but for body care, hair care and treatments.

loans.use: To purchase hair products and beauty products.

loans.name: Dilmer

texts.es:
Dilmer tiene 29 años de edad, vive junto a su cónyuge y dos menores hijos en casa de material rústico en el Caserío Las Juntas, una comunidad de dificil acceso, el camino de herradura que conduce a la vivienda de Dilmer pasa por el cerro Andamarca conocido por la forma atractiva del relieve y las historias de encantamiento que posee el cerro según los moradores más antiguos, su población se dedica a la agricultura en especial al cultivo de café, piñas, caña de azúcar, yuca y plátanos, crianza de animales menores y comercio de los mismos, esta ubicado a 3 horas del Distrito de Santo Tomás, que pertenece a la Provincia de Cutervo, Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Él se dedica a la agricultura cultiva cafeto desde hace 04 años, también tiene sembrado una pequeña parcela de piñas y en tiempo de cosecha que son en los meses de noviembre y diciembre su esposa lo comercializa los días domingos en el mercado del Distrito de Santo Tomás. Dilmer ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de fertilizantes órganicos para el abono su cultivo de café y el pago a los joranleros que le dan mantenimiento a su cultivo mediante la deshierba. Es un padre emprendedor que se esfuerza por dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, con el préstamo podrá tener una mejor producción y calidad de café, que al venderlo le generarán mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Dilmer is 29 years old. He lives with his wife and two young children in a home made of traditional materials in Caserío Las Juntas, a community that is difficult to access. The road to Dilmer’s home passes through the Andamarca mountains known for its beautiful vistas and stories of enchantment that the mountains have according to the oldest inhabitants of this region. Its population works in agriculture, specializing in coffee, pineapple, sugar cane, yucca, bananas, raising and selling small animals. It is located 3 hours from Santo Tomás district in Cutervo province, Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

Dilmer has been growing coffee for 4 years. He also planted a small parcel of pineapples and at harvest time in November and December his wife sells them on Sundays in the Santo Tomás district market. Dilmer seeks a loan from Edpyme Alternative for 1000 nuevos soles to buy organic fertilizer to fertilize his coffee crop and pay the day laborers who provide maintenance by weeding the crops. He is an enterprising father who strives to give a better quality of life to his family. With the loan he will have a better harvest and quality of coffee, so at the time of selling the harvest it will generate greater income.

.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers to fertilize his coffee crops and pay the day laborers.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
La señora María Angélica  tiene 43 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos vive con su esposo y su actividad es la venta de productos de la canasta básica familiar cómo ser: azúcar, arroz, manteca, espagueti, pollo, escobas, refresco, etc.  cuenta con más de 6 años de dedicarse  a este tipo de actividad económica.
Doña María Angélica tiene una buena clientela siendo estos vecinos de la misma aldea y comunidades aledañas está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de arroz, huevos, café, aguas, azúcar, pan, harina, frijoles, etc. Para surtir más su negocio para la temporada navideña.
