Doña María Angélica espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante en su negocio y poder obtener las ganancias necesarias para apoyar a su familia en el hogar, uno de sus sueños es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.


Trojes, Honduras - Noviembre 2014
texts.en:
María Angélica is 43 years old. She is the mother of two children, and she lives with her husband. Her work is selling basic everyday products such as sugar, rice, shortening, spaghetti, chicken, soft drinks, brooms, etc. She has dedicated herself to this type of economic activity for more than 6 years. 

María Angélica has a good customer base, consisting of some neighbors in the same town as well as people from more distant communities. She is requesting the loan to buy rice, eggs, coffee, bottled water, sugar, bread, flour, beans, etc. With this, she will expand her store's stock for the Christmas season. 

María Angélica hopes that this investment will allow her to get ahead with her business and obtain the earnings she needs to support her family and household. One of her dreams is that her children will finish their studies. 

Trojes, Honduras - November 2014

loans.use: to buy rice, eggs, coffee, bottled water, sugar, bread, flour, beans, etc. to stock her business.

loans.name: Benito Antonio

texts.es:
Benito es un hombre de 51 años de edad, de esos que dieron cuerpo y alma por sus familiares soportando trabajos difíciles, mal pagos pero que los ejercían porque no había nada más, pero el mayor inconveniente radica en que no cotizaron para una pensión ni tenían ahorros y cuando alcanza una edad ya es muy difícil emplearse.
Por ello Benito quiere solicitar formalmente un crédito para iniciar su propia empresa y generar los recursos para su familia que la conforman su pareja y dos hijos, con el crédito comercializara productos de consumo como lo son vitaminas y suplementos alimenticios 100% naturales.
texts.en:
Benito is a 51 year-old man who gave his heart and soul for his family, bearing difficult jobs with poor income because there was nothing more.  The main problem is that these jobs neither contributed to a pension, nor provided him with savings.  Now that he has reached this age, it is very difficult to be employed.

This is why Benito wants to formally request a loan to start his own business and generate the resources for his family, formed by his wife and two children.  With the loan, he will sell consumer products like vitamins and 100% natural supplements.

loans.use: to start to sell vitamins, supplements, etc

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy Wax fabric.

loans.name: Oyquz

texts.ru:
Ойкиз добрая и отзывчивая женщина из не большого района под названием Яван. Яван отличается своей необычной природой и приятной атмосферой от других мест Республики. Ойкиз замужняя женщина в возрасте 47 лет. Она мать четверых детей (сын и три дочки). Сын после окончания школы уехал на заработки в Российскую Федерацию. Старшая дочка вышла замуж и живет отдельно. Ойкиз живет с мужем и двумя дочками. Дочки являются ученицами средней школы. 
  Ойкиз уже 11 лет занимается растениеводством. На данный момент она готова посеять новый урожай овощей, но есть финансовые проблемы, по которым Ойкиз не может купить семена, минеральные удобрения и горючего для трактора. Она видит выход из этой ситуации в получение кредита. Ойкиз надеется, что ей не откажут в кредите, и она не останется без урожая весной.
texts.en:
Oyquz is a kind and responsive woman from a small district called Yavan. Yavan is known for its unique nature and pleasant climate, compared to other places in the Republic. Oyquz is a married 47-year-old woman. She is a mother of four children (a son and three daughters). Her son left to work in the Russian Federation after graduating from school. The oldest daughter got married and lives separately. Oyquz lives with her husband and two daughters. Her daughters are secondary school students.

Oyquz has been involved in agriculture for 11 years. At the present time, she is is ready to plant a new crop of vegetables, but has financial problems, due to which Oyquz cannot buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel for a tractor. She sees obtaining a loan as the solution to this problem. Oyquz hopes that she will not be refused the loan, leaving her without a harvest in the spring.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel for a tractor

loans.name: Martha Edita

texts.es:
Martha Edita tiene 64 años de edad, vive junto con su hijo en el distrito de Nueva Arica, una comunidad de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Martha Edita se dedica a la venta de verduras en el exterior del mercado de cayalti, desde hace mas de 03 años, de manera continua. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como patos, cuyes, pollos y conejos, este negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Necesita préstamo para invertir en compra mercaderia para puesto de mercado(verduras frescas) y para la compra de una cantidad mayor de animales menores para poder diversificar y aumentar su stock de animales, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Martha Edita is 64 years old and lives with her son in the Nueva Arica district of the Chiclayo province (Lambeyeque region) on Peru's northern coast. Here the climate is varied and the people work in farming, cattle raising and trade.

Martha has been making a living selling vegetables in Cayalti's outdoor market for three years. She also raises and sells young animals, including ducks, guinea pigs, chickens and rabbits. She runs this business from the back of her home.

Martha needs this loan in order to buy merchandise for her market stall (fresh vegetables) and to buy a larger number of animals so as to diversify her business and increase her stock. In the short term, this loan will allow Martha to increase her income and profits and thus improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (animals and vegetables).

loans.name: Maximo Augusto

texts.es:
El señor Máximo tiene 33 años de edad vive con su esposa y es padre de un  hijo.  Su actividad es la venta de productos de la canasta básica familiar y también cuenta con una zapatería en la cual ofrece reparación de todos tipos de zapato.
Don Máximo cuenta con más de 2 años de dedicarse  a este tipo de actividad tiene una buena clientela ya que su negocio esta ubicado en un lugar muy estratégico de alto comercio, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, huevos, café, aguas, pan, harina, aceite, papel higiénico, etc. y así tener un muy buen surtido para satisfacer la demanda de su clientela.
Don Máximo espera que sus ingresos mejoraren y poder satisfacer las necesidades de su familia,  uno sueños es ver su negocio prospero y bien surtido su negocio y también que su hijo logre terminar sus estudios para que logre salir adelante.


Trojes, Honduras - Noviembre 2014
texts.en:
Máximo is 33 years old. He lives with his wife and is the father of one son. His work is selling basic everyday products, and he also has a shoe workshop where he offers repair services for all types of shoes. 

Máximo has dedicated himself to this type of work for more than two years. He has a good customer base, because his business is located in a very strategic place with high levels of commerce. He is requesting the loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, eggs, coffee, bottled water, bread, flour, cooking oil, toilet paper, and other items. In this way he will have his store very well-stocked in order to satisfy his customers' needs. 

Máximo hopes that his income will improve and he will be able to satisfy his family's needs. Among his dreams are to see his business prosperous and well-stocked, and also to see his son finish his studies so that he can get ahead in life. 

Trojes, Honduras - November 2014

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, eggs, coffee, bottled water, bread, flour, cooking oil, toilet paper, etc. to stock his store.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she grows crops and keeps animals. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are large scale. 

Margaret describes her biggest business challenge as lack of finances. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Singging

texts.en:
Singging is 47 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, etc.

Singging has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried coconut meat.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Jose Ronnie

texts.en:
Jose Ronnie is a hard working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

He is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy a new engine for his fishing boat.

NWTF is presenting Jose Ronnie's business profile again in support of his efforts to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his fishing boat.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 34 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Susana has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She successfully repaid her previous loans and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from fishing and selling fish.

Susana aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Angiely

texts.en:
Angiely is 24 years old and married with one kid. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Angiely has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. Angiely requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Angiely would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Maria Luisa con esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio de pulpería y gracias también al préstamo anterior que obtuvo con MiCrédito. Siempre la han apoyado sus hijos para que juntos logren salir adelante y mantener la vivienda. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar Frijoles, Maíz, Arroz, Azúcar y Aceite. Maria Luisa piensa seguir trabajando de esta manera para obtener mejores ganancias y poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en: Maria Luisa has managed to move forward with her general store business, with effort and thanks to the previous loan that she obtained through MiCredito.  Her children have always supported her so that they can move forward together and maintain the home.  She is requesting a new loan to buy beans, corn, rice, sugar, and oil.  Maria Luisa plans to continue this work to obtain a better income and to improve her home little by little.

loans.use: to buy beans, corn, rice, sugar and oil

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Florenda works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Florenda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional bundles of fishing net for her fishing business.

Florenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of  fishing net.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Cueros, herrajes, cierres, hilos, son los insumos que llevaron a Beatriz a solicitar un crédito para impulsar su negocio de marroquinería artesanal. Bellos productos realizados a mano. 
Beatriz es una madre de tres hijos felizmente casada que con la ayuda de su negocio ha logrado sacar su familia adelante. 
Un apoyo será muy importante para Beatriz pues impulsara su negocio en este inicio de año en el que espera poder consolidar un almacén para exhibir sus hermosos bolsos.
texts.en: Leather, hardware, zippers, thread are the products that brought Beatriz to ask for a loan in order to propel her artisanal  leather goods business.  Beautiful products, made by hand.  Beatriz is a mother of three children, happily married who, with the help of her business, has managed to help her family do well.  This support will be very important for Beatriz because it will propel her business in this new year.  This year she hopes to be able to exhibit her beautiful bags in a store.

loans.use: To purchase products for leather goods production.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José, de 31 años de edad,  no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, debido la situación económica de sus padres no asistió a la escuela, está casado  y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.- David, tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales 2 están estudiando y los demás pasan en casa con la mamá.

José, se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 14 años de edad, este trabajo se lo enseño su papá.- La distancia que José recorre en su motocicleta, para llegar a su lugar de trabajo es de 5 minutos.  

José, también se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, esto lo aprendió desde hace 5 años.- Cuando José identifica que una vaca es buena para dar leche, recoge la leche y la vende.

José, se levanta temprano todos los días a ordeñar sus vacas, luego sale en su motocicleta a dejar la leche a sus clientes, para posteriormente incorporarse al trabajo agrícola.

José solicita el préstamo para comprar bueyes, ya que por el momento solo vacas tiene y necesita de un par de bueyes para preparar la tierra en donde siembra, con los bueyes se ahorraría tiempo y dinero, ya que actualmente, él tiene que buscar quien le ayude a hacer estas labores y eso le implica mayores gastos y menos ingresos para la familia. 

El sueño de José para el futuro es, darles a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar, ya que él no la tuvo.
texts.en:
José is 31 years old and did not have the opportunity to go to school owing to his parents financial situation. José is married; his wife looks after the household chores. José has five children, two of whom are in school while the rest stay at home with their mum.

After being taught this trade by his father, José has been working in farming since he was 14 years old. José arrives at his work on motorcycle after just a five-minute ride from his home.

José also makes a living buying and selling cattle, work that he learned five years ago. When José realises that a cow produces good milk, he collects and sells it.

José wakes up early every day in order to milk his cows. He then goes out on his motorbike to drop milk off to his customers and then go to his farming work.

José is applying for this loan in order to buy oxen. Just now he has only cows but needs a couple of oxen to prepare the land where he sows crops. With oxen, José will save time and money, while, at the moment, he has to look for somebody to help him, which costs more money and results in a lower income for José's family.

José's dream for the future is to give his children the opportunity - that he did not have - to study.

loans.use: to buy oxen.

loans.name: Thủy

texts.en:
Thủy works in agriculture, farming food. She is 50 years old and she is married with three children. Thủy lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thủy successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thủy has been involved in business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thủy faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine .She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Thủy hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
Don Luis es una persona muy responsable vive con su esposa las cual sale con él la fotografía ya que los manejan el negocio que es una pulpería la cual es una de sus fuentes principales de ingreso, tienen un hijo que depende de los dos.

Don Luis vive en una comunidad de Santa Cruz de Yojoa al norte de Honduras está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de arroz, azúcar, café, huevos, pan, harina, etc. Para tener más mercadería para la temporada navideña que es cuando se vende más, espera que esta inversión le permita mejorar su negocio y sus ingresos para poder salir adelante junto con su familia. 

Don Luis uno de sus sueños es mejorar su negocio para poder seguir apoyando a su hijo en los estudios y que puede salir  adelante.

                      


Santa Cruz De Yojoa,  Honduras- Noviembre 2014.
texts.en:
Luis is a responsible person who lives with his wife, who is seen in the photograph, because they manage their business together.  The business is a grocery store, and is one of their main sources of income.  They have one dependent child.

Luis lives in the community of Santa Cruz de Yojoa, in northern Honduras.  He is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, coffee, eggs, bread, flour, etc., so that he can have more merchandise for the Christmas season, when he sells more.  He hopes that this investment will enable him to improve his business and his income so that he and his family can get ahead.

Santa Cruz De Yojoa,  Honduras- November 2014.

loans.use: to buy groceries for his store

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lucia es una joven entusiasta, alegre, responsable, entre otras cualidades que la caracterizan y que la impulsaron a estudiar Química y Farmacia ya que es una de las carreras que ayuda a mantener la salud en la población, desde pequeña jugaba a ser doctora con sus amigos ahora está llevando ese sueño a la realidad. Lucia cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres quienes tienen una venta de derivados de la leche, como queso, cuajadas, crema y también ofrecen el servicio de video juegos, además de que su mamá recibe remesas de parte de su padre quien se encuentra fuera del país. 
Lucia solicita el crédito para el financiamiento del pago de módulos que le ayudara a crecer como profesional y también como persona de esa manera podrá obtener oportunidades de trabajo donde podrá emplear y poner en práctica sus conocimientos adquiridos en algún laboratorio y como metas futuras Lucia podrá poner su propia farmacia. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento que le proporcionara un mejor futuro para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Lucia is an enthusiastic, happy, and responsible young woman, among other qualities that characterize her and have motivated her to study Chemistry and Pharmacology, as it is one of the careers that helps keep the population healthy.  When she was little, she played doctor with her friends; now she is carrying out this dream in reality.  

Lucia has the support of her parents, who sell milk products like cheese, cottage cheese, and cream, and also offer a video game service.  Her mother also receives payments from her father, who is outside of the country.

Lucia is requesting this loan to finance the payment for courses that would help her grow as a professional and also as a person, and therefore be able to obtain work opportunities where she will be able to be employed and to put her acquired knowledge to practice in any lab.  As a future goal, Lucia wants to be able to have her own pharmacy.  She places her confidence in the financing that will provide her a better future for herself and her family.

loans.use: to finance the payment for courses

loans.name: Hương

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương works in agriculture farming food.

She is 42 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Hương  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Hương faces in her life is not having a water tank and water filter. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and equipment to repair her clean water system.

With her business profit, she hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and equipment to repair her clean water system

loans.name: Hợi

texts.en:
Hợi works in agriculture, farming food. Hợi  is 31 years old and he is married with two children. He lives with two dependents in the Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hợi's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. He has been involved in business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hợi faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With his business profit, Hợi hopes for his business to do well, for his children to do well in school, and for his family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Hồng

texts.en:
Hồng has a brick-laying business. She has been involved in this business for seven years.

Hồng is 31 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in the Dong Son district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hồng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main hardship that Hồng faces in her life is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Hồng hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Rosaura Idalia

texts.es: Rosaura es una mujer de 46 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su sobrina de 14 años, su hija ya mayor de edad y otro hijo que ya tiene su propio hogar, sus dos hijos le apoya con los gastos económicos de su hogar. Ella gracias a su esfuerzo ha sacado adelante a sus hijos como madre soltera, apoyada en su negocio de elaboración de prendas de vestir el cual realiza en su casa de habitación desde hace 6 años. Rosaura desea reparar el portón de su vivienda y terminar de construir el corredor de su vivienda, ya que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, hierro y un portón para terminar de construir el corredor e instalar el portón de su vivienda.
texts.en: Rosaura is a 46 year old woman who lives in her own home with a 14 year old niece, her grown daughter, and another son who already has his own home. Her two children support her with the household expenses. Thanks to her hard work she has been able to raise her children as a single mother, supported by her business making clothing which she does in her home. She has had her business for 6 years. Rosaura wishes to repair the gate of her home and finish building a hallway in her home, as today it is deteriorating. So she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, iron, and a gate to finish building the hallway and install a gate on her home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, iron, and a gate to finish building the hallway and install a gate on her home.

loans.name: Nelson De Jesus

texts.es:
Nelson es un hombre soltero de 49 años de edad sin hijos sin una persona que lo apoye, desde el año 2000 inicio con su negocio de salón de belleza, motivado por el gusto a la estética capilar, y embellecer personas.
La peluquería es un arte que para triunfar en este no solo se necesita tener buena mano para realizar un corte, también influye mucho la estética y como miran los posibles clientes  local.
Pensando en hacer ver el mejor el local para traer un mayor número de clientes, Nelson quiere solicitar un crédito para realizar remodelaciones a su Salón de belleza, comprara muebles, pinturas y dará una mejor distribución a sus activos.
El sueño de Nelson es perdurar junto con su peluquería ya que es su único sustento y acompañante.
texts.en: Nelson is a single 49 year old man without children or a person who supports him. In 2000 he opened his beauty salon business, inspired by his enjoyment of hair aesthetics and making others beautiful. Doing hair is an art and in order to be successful he not only needs talent to do a good cut, but also the aesthetics of the place are influential and how the place is seen by potential customers.  He is thinking of making improvements to attract a greater number of customers. Nelson wants a loan to remodel his beauty salon by buying furniture and paint in order to improve his services. Nelson dreams of having a long-lasting business as it is his own form of support and income.

loans.use: to remodel his beauty salon by buying furniture and paint in order to improve his services and with any leftover funds purchase salon supplies.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Dung is 44 years old and she is married with two children. She lives with two dependents in the Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Dung's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Dung hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Libardo Antonio

texts.es:
Libardo es un campesino, que gracias a sus padres aprendió todo del campo, se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado porcino, actividad que ha realizado su familia generación por generación.
Libardo es un hombre casado y fruto de su matrimonio nació su hija que hoy tiene 15 años de edad, esta actividad es de lo único que puede apoyarse, por eso la cuida y trabaja las horas que sean necesarias para generar algún recursos para comprar un plato de comida para su familia.
Como persona del pueblo, la ayuda es muy escasa y quiere aprovechar las pocas oportunidades que le da la vida, una de esas es el apoyo que le brinda interactuar para invertir en su negocio y con la ayuda de un crédito comprara cerdos y cuido para alimentarlos.
Este crédito el permitirá seguir desarrollando la actividad que representa la única entrada de dinero para su familia.
texts.en:
Libardo is a farmer who learned all about the land from his parents. He works raising and selling pigs, as has been done by his family through the generations.

Libardo is married, and from this union his daughter was born who is now 15 years old.

His work activity is the only available means of support that Libardo can rely on, this is why he cares and works as many hours as necessary to generate some income so that he can put food on the family table.

As a peasant, there is very little help available and he wants to make the most of the few opportunities that life brings him,  one of these being the support offered by Interactuar to invest in his business. 

With the help of a loan, he will buy pigs as well as feed for their care. This loan will allow him to keep the business that is the only source of income for his family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for their care.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.es:
Jennifer una joven con en el entusiasmo y las ganas de salir adelante en alto, a sus 23 años de edad tiene la mentalidad de empresaria, no quiere ser empelada quiere proporcionar empleo, y con el crédito que solicita iniciara su vida y hará todo lo posible para triunfar y en un corto periodo ser proveedora de empleo. 
Jennifer con el préstamo iniciara su negocio de venta de frutas y legumbres, comprara estanterías, basculas digitales, surtido de toda clase de verduras y frutas comerciales en pocas palabras lo único que tiene es el local que pueden ver en la foto lo demás falta pro comprar. 
Con la ayuda de este crédito aspira a generar empleo, a estudiar y ser una profesional integra que beneficie a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Jennifer is a young woman with the right enthusiasm and determination to get ahead in life and be successful. At 23 years of age, she already thinks like an entrepreneur: she does not want to be an employee, she wants to create jobs, and with the loan she is requesting she will start her professional life, doing everything she can to succeed and to create jobs in a short time.
With the loan she is requesting, Jennifer will start her activity, selling fruits and vegetables. She will buy shelves, digital scales, and supplies of every kind of fruits and vegetables. In other words, the only thing she owns is the shop you can see in the picture, and she will have to buy all the rest.
She wishes to create jobs thanks to this loan, as well as to be able to study and to become an upright professional that will have a positive impact on the community.

loans.use: To buy shelves, digital scales, and supplies of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 47 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elvira has been pig fattening for five years and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Silvia Milena

texts.es:
Silvia es una responsable, trabajadora, orgullosa madre cabeza de familia, a sus 34 años de edad no le ha quedado grande la tarea de ejercer como padre y madre de sus dos hijos, generando los ingresos gracias a su negocio de   moto-taxi muy popular en los pueblos por su bajo costo. 
Silvia quiere mejorar, decirle si a su hijo de su deseo de entrar a la universidad y esto lo lleva a solicitar un crédito para la compra de una moto, de segunda mano para emplear a su hijo mayor de edad para que juntos saquen su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Silvia is a responsible, hardworking, and proud mother and head of household. At 34 years of age, acting as both mother and father to her two children hasn't been too much for her to handle. She earns a living thanks to her motorcycle taxi business, which is very popular due to its low cost. 

Silvia wants to improve, and to be able to entertain her son's wish of going to college; this has led her to request a loan to purchase a second-hand motorcycle so that her oldest son can work, and together, they can provide for their family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to transport passengers

loans.name: Sokhun's Group

texts.en:
A resident from Kampong Cham province, Sokhun is 54 years old and a mother of three children. To improve her family’s living, she grows cassava as her single source of income. She has been involved in this business for ages. It earns her about 33,300 KHR per day.

This is her second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loan wisely to improve her living condition at a gradual pace.

In this group of two members, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed to support her farmland. She hopes that she can improve her family's living conditions to be better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Lonh's Group

texts.en:
Lonh, 54, lives with his family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. He is a father of four children.

To support his living condition, he grows rice on one hectare area as the main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement his income. He has been involved in this business for ages and it earns him about 35,500 KHR per day.

For Lonh, this is his first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed to support his rice farm. He hopes that he can get increased yields compared to last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to support his rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Orn's Group

texts.en:
Orn, 27, lives with her family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of two children, one is in school and one is too young.

Orn can earn income to support her family via cassava growing on a one hectare area. Moreover, she can earn additional income via working for others for a fee.

For Orn, this is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She fully repaid her past loan completely. In this group of two members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to pay for labour fees to support her farmland.

She hopes that she can get increased yields compared to last year.

loans.use: to pay for labour fees to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy calabashes (gourds)

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu works in agriculture farming food.

She is 41 years old and married with three children. Thu lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thu's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Thu faces in her life is not having a good clean water system. She is applying for a loan to purchase sand, cement, and equipment to repair her clean water system.

With her business profit, Thu hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and equipment to repair her clean water system

loans.name: Hằng

texts.en:
Hằng operates a food stall/restaurant selling beverages. She has been involved in this business for one year.

Hằng is 27 years old and she is married with one child. She lives with one dependent in the Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hằng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet. 

With her business profit, Hằng hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron so he can build his home.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José tiene 66 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hija de 16 años de edad. José es pequeño comerciante de variedad de ropa desde hace mucho tiempo. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante y es así como se gana la vida y mantiene la economía del hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus ingresos ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea invertir en su negocio comprando mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir como: pantalones, faldas, vestidos, tela para toallas, etc. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así aprovechar esta temporada navideña para aumentar sus ventas y ingresos.
texts.en: José is 66 years old and lives in his own home with his 16 year old daughter. Jose is a small businessman selling a variety of clothing, a business he has had for a long time. He is a street vendor and in this way earns his living and supports his home. With the desire to increase his income, he has made the decision to seek a loan from FUSAI as his wishes to buy a large quantity of clothing items such as pants, skirts, dresses, fabric for towels, etc.  He hopes to be able to count on this financing and in this way take advantage of the Christmas season to increase his sales and income.

loans.use: to buy pants, skirts, dresses, fabric for towels, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson es un comerciante de 50 años de edad, que camina por diferentes calles de colegios y barrios empujando su carrito de mercado que el mismo adecuo para vender mangos, dicha actividad representa el sustento de su familia conformada por su esposa y sus dos hijos adolescentes que dependen completamente de Wilson.
Sus sueños es hacer de su negocio algo más significativo, poder tener un local para operar tranquilamente y que sus ganancias se incrementen para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, aunque por su esfuerzo y empeño nunca les ha faltado un bocado de comida.
Wilson solicita un crédito para la compra de un coche más amplio donde puede almacenar un mayor número de mangos para tratar de incrementar sus ventas diarias
texts.en:
Wilson is a 50 year old businessman who walks through the different streets of schools and neighborhoods pushing his little market cart that he built, selling mangoes. He has supported his family with this business. His family consists of his wife and two teenage children who depend completely upon Wilson. His dreams are to make his business something more significant, to be able to have a locale to peacefully operate and that his earning increase in order to give his family a better quality of life, even though through his efforts and hard work they have never missed a meal.

Wilson seeks a loan to buy a bigger car in order to stock up a large number of mangoes in an attempt to increase his daily sales.

loans.use: to buy a car in order to stock up a large number of mangoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Cuông

texts.en:
Mr. Cuông works in agriculture raising marine aquaculture.

Cuông is 61 years old and he is married with six children. Cuông lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Cuông's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cuông has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns him is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With his business profit, Cuông hopes to build a new house, for his family to be healthy and happy, and for his business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Marlyn is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more ingredients like sugar, flour, milk, cooking oil, etc. for her food vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Marlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients like sugar, flour, milk, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Las Caseritas Group

texts.es: María de 25 años de edad es casada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella pertenece al grupo “Las Caseritas” constituido por 09 socios responsables y emprendedores. María se dedica a la venta de tubérculos. Hace más de 02 años que viene desempeñándose en dicho negocio y le va bien. Gracias a su esfuerzo puede cubrir con los gastos del hogar. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de papa, camote y zanahorias. Su mayor deseo es poner su propio restaurante y de esta manera ofrecer distintas variedades de potajes. El grupo “Las Caseritas” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada. María es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste casaca plomo.
texts.en:
Maria, 25, is married with two grown-up children who live independently.  She belongs to the group called 'Las Caseritas' which is made up of nine members who are all responsible and enterprising people.

Maria sells tuber vegetables, an activity she has been involved in for more than two years.  Her business is going well and thanks to her efforts, she can cover the household expenses.  

She is asking for a loan to buy potatoes, yams and carrots.  

Her biggest desire is to open her own restaurant so she can offer different types of stews.  

The group are grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help they offer.  Maria is the first on the left in the photo and is wearing the grey fleece.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, yams and carrots.

loans.name: David Alexander

texts.es:
David tiene 32 años de edad, es casado, vive con su familia en la parte rural del distrito de Oyotún, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, las actividades económicas principales son la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como pollos, gallos, cerdos, patos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, cerdos, patos, entre otros para aumentar el stock de su negocio, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, lo que tendrá gran influencia en su nivel de ingresos y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
David, 32, is married and lives with his family in the rural part of the district of Oyotun, Chiclayo, which is in Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.  The area is quiet and the main industries are agriculture, livestock and commerce.

He raises and sells animals such as chickens, hens, pigs, ducks and others.  He runs his business from his home.  He has been doing it for more than ten years and he is successful.  He is well thought of, both professionally and personally.  

He is asking for a loan to buy more animals such as hens, pigs, ducks and others so that he has more to sell.  This investment will allow him to offer a wider range of animals and will have a positive effect on his income which will allow him to improve living conditions for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy a wider range of animals to raise and sell.

loans.name: Dúo Yolanda De San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Yolanda de San Bartolo
Este dúo esta formado por doña Maria Azucena, ella tiene 45 años de edad, es originaria San Bartolo, y se dedica a la venta de ropa para dama,  caballeros ,niños, venta de cosméticos en general, en su tienda ubicada en la calle principal del municipio, ella esta solicitando el crédito para la inversión de  compra de blusas para dama y niña, compra de sudaderos, compra de trajecitos para  bebe , ya que su deseo es surtir su tienda para esta temporada, y su deseo es incrementar sus ingresos en Ganancias,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa nueva para la venta.
texts.en:
Maria Azucena, 45, forms half of the partnership called 'San Bartolo Este'.  She comes from San Bartolo and sells clothes for women, men and children.  She also sells cosmetics.  Her store is located in the main street in her town.  

She is asking for a loan to buy new clothes to sell, such as blouses for women and girls, sweaters, and baby clothes.  She would like to stock her business for this season and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Efremu

texts.en:
Efremu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Efremu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Alpha, Sunday and Grace.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Efremu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Efremu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Efremu spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, thus eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jesus Maria

texts.es:
El sueño de Jesús se encuentra a sus espaldas, después de estar un tiempo recogiendo y comprando envases y cajas para empacar cervezas por fin puede darle inicio  a su sueño de tener una comercializadora de bebidas alcohólicas y es que lo puede lograr gracias a los frutos y sui perseverancia.
Jesús solicita formalmente un crédito para comprar surtido de bebidas alcohólicas y puede comprarlos en grandes cantidades ya que tiene los envases retornables. 
Con la ayuda de este crédito puede iniciar su empresa y velar por el sostenimiento de su familia
texts.en: Jesus's dream is at hand after having spent time picking up and buying bottles and cases in which to pack beer, at last he can start his dream of having a business distributing alcohol. He can accomplish this thanks to his work and perseverance. Jesus formally seeks a loan to buy a stock of alcoholic beverages and he can buy them in large quantities as he has the returnable bottles. With the help from this loan he can start his business and keep watch to take care to support his family.

loans.use: start a beverage distribution business, specially beer.

loans.name: Melly

texts.en:
Melly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to purchase yeast, milk, sugar, flour, margarine, etc. for her bakery business.

Melly has been in this business for four years. She also earns more income from a general store. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Melly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase yeast, milk, sugar, flour, margarine, etc.

loans.name: Aina

texts.en:
Aina is 22 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell.

Aina has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell dry goods business for ten years and also earns an income from buying and selling clothing.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Albertinha

texts.en:
A USD 600 loan is offered to Albertinha to improve her business. She has a second-hand clothing business where many people come to buy every day. 

Albertinha will buy some additional supplies, such as shorts, pants, skirts, jackets, long sleeve shirts, and short sleeve shirts. 

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2010. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Albertinha independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. 

She hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Albertinha is happy with her loan because it can help improve her living conditions in the future. Her husband is a teacher.

loans.use: to buy shorts, pants, skirts, jackets, long sleeve shirts, and short sleeve shirts.

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en:
A farmer living in Kampong Speu province, Thoeurn is 38 years old and a mother of three children. For making a living, she earns income via rice cropping on a two-hectare area.

This is the first time for Thoeurn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan portion to pay the tuition fee for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor’s degree.

She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree.

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Samrong Torng district

loans.name: Diana Albertina

texts.es:
Diana es una joven, madre de 22 años de edad, responsable de una pequeña de ya 5 años, desde el año 2012 inicio un negocio de confección directa por necesidad económica ya que ser madre no solo es una tarea llena de sonrisas y alegrías requiere un gasto grande y como su pareja no daba abasto para pagar todas las deudas decidió emprender en dicho negocio.
Diana para seguir creciendo, para obtener más clientes, sacar nuevos diseños, optimizar sus tiempo necesita una maquinaria una maquina fileteadora, máquina de coser, telas e hilos por ello solicita un crédito para comprar este equipo e insumos para sorprender en este nuevo año con diseños que desafían la cotidianidad de la moda Antioqueña.
texts.en:
Diana is a young, 22-year-old mother who is responsible for a little girl who is already 5 years old. In 2012 she began a sewing business out of financial necessity, because being a mother is not only a job that is filled with smiles and happiness - it also requires a lot of money. Since her life partner was not providing enough to cover all their expenses, she decided to start up the above-mentioned business. 

In order to continue to grow and obtain more customers, come up with new styles and optimize her time, Diana needs an overlock machine and a regular sewing machine, fabrics, and thread. She is asking for a loan to buy these machines and supplies. In this new year she will introduce designs that will shake up Antioquian everyday fashion.

loans.use: to buy an overlock and a regular sewing machine, fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan es un joven soltero de 22 años de edad, que gusta del trabajo independiente, de esa libertad de ser tu propio jefe y manejar tu propio horario, sus sueño es poder seguir estudiando y aspirar a iniciar un negocio más formal y bien constituido pero gracias a su  venta de ropa para hombre y dama, zapatillas, gorras, accesorios ha podido generar no solo para pagar sus gastos universitarios si no para apoyar en su hogar con un mercado, o pagando alguna cuenta.
Juan quiere solicitar el apoyo de todos ustedes para comprar mercancía de ropa para hombre y dama, tennis, zapatos, accesorios, gorras entre otros. 
Con tu apoyo seguirá llevando alimento a su hogar y pagando sus gastos universitarios.
texts.en:
Juan is a young single man, 22 years of age, who likes to work independently, being his own boss, and managing his own schedule. He dreams of being able to continue studying and he aspires to initiate a more formal and well constituted business. Thanks to selling clothing  for men and women, slippers, caps, and accessories, he has been able to generate not only money to pay for his university studies, but, also, to help at home with market expenses or paying off accounts.

Juan wishes to solicit your help in purchasing merchandise – men's and women's clothing, tennis shoes, regular shoes, accessories, and caps, among other things.

With your help, he can continue bringing food to his table and paying his university expenses.

loans.use: buy clothing merchandise for men and women, tennis shoes, accessories, and caps, among other items.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy rice

loans.name: Dania Lisseth

texts.es:
La señora Dania vive en una colonia de Santa Cruz de Yojoa, al norte de Honduras, se dedica desde más de 10 años al negocio de la pulpería, vive  con su esposo y sus 4 hijos,  esposo tiene una pequeña granja de pollos de engorde.

Doña Dania se dedica al comercio tiene una pulpería la cual la atiende de lunes a domingo está solicitando el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, frijoles, café, aguas, pan, harina, aceite, etc. Porque se acerca la época navideña y quiere poder bríndales una mejor atención a sus clientes. 
Doña Dania espera que al surtir su negocio las ventas mejoren y también sus ganancias para poder mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia, uno de sus sueños es poder mejor su casa ya que es de madera y quiere hacerla de bloques.





Santa Cruz De Yojoa, Honduras - Diciembre  del 2014
texts.en:
Dania lives in a community in Santa Cruz de Yojoa, in the north of Honduras.  She lives with her husband and her four children.  Her husband has a small farm where he fattens chickens.

Dania has earned a living with her grocery store business for more than ten years.  She tends to her store Monday through Sunday.

She's requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, coffee, water, bread, flour, oil, etc.  The Christmas season is approaching and she wants to be able to give her customers better service.

Dania hopes that stocking her business will improve her sales and her profits so she can improve her family's quality of life.  One of her dreams is to be able to improve her house because it's made of wood and she wants to build it with cinder blocks.

Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras, December 2014

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, coffee, water, bread, flour, oil, etc. for her business

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of six children, Belinda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Belinda is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice grains to sell through her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Belinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice grains to sell through her business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 45 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marilyn has been farming rice for 6 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and a new variety of rice seeds.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and a new variety of rice seeds.

loans.name: Juan Ricardo

texts.es:
Juan es un joven que trabaja con mucho esfuerzo y optimismo para generar el sustento diario para su familia; que se compone de 1 hija y su pareja. Juan tiene 23 años de edad.

Él trabaja como agente de seguridad en uno de los municipios más concurridos de Suchitepéquez; él expresa que se dedica a esta actividad porque es una forma honesta de ganarse la vida y generar los ingresos económicos para brindarle los servicios básicos a su pequeña familia. Tiene más de dos años de dedicarse a esta labor y está muy contento con ello.  

Juan ama a su familia y desea darle lo mejor, es por ello que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción para su vivienda.

Su mayor sueño es construir su vivienda y así darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is a young man who works with a great deal of effort and optimism to generate income for the daily support of his family, which consists of his daughter and wife.  Juan is 23-years-old.

He works as a security agent for Suchitepéquez, one of the busiest towns.  He says he's in this job because it's an honest way to earn a living and make income to provide his small family with basic services.  He's been in the job for more than two years and is very happy with it.

Juan loves his family and wants to give them the best.  It's for them that he is seeking a loan to buy construction materials for his house.  

His greatest dream is to build is house and provide his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Isiyaku Mamman

texts.en:
Isiyaku Mamman is a maize farmer from Chino village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku Mamman would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isiyaku Mamman can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Isiyaku Mamman, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Dahiru

texts.en:
Dahiru is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Dahiru joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Hadiza, Sadik and Yusuf.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Dahiru would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Dahiru can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Dahiru spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to expand his farmland in the long term.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, thus eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Usman Ya'u

texts.en:
Usman Ya'u is a maize farmer from Maigadi village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Usman Ya'u would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Usman Ya'u can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Usman Ya'u, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Emmanuel would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Emmanuel can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Emmanuel is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Malumbo Group

texts.en:
Said, who is in his late 30’s, is married with three kids. One of them is still in school and the other two are still small.  He has been running a genge business for three years now.  He works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Said's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to increase on the genge stock and has paid back his loan successfully.  He used the profits to pay school fees and household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy the out of stock items for the genge.  He dreams taking his kids to good schools and to make his business big.

Said will share this loan with his loan group "MALUMBO," which consist of six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the out of stock items for the genge.

loans.name: Remberto

texts.es:
Remberto es un hombre de 29 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo de 5 años, y trabaja como transportista.
Él es independiente, emprendedor, ágil, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’, un área rural que se mantiene como granero de la ciudad, por la producción de cereales, verduras y frutas, maíz, trigo, cebada, hortalizas, frutilla, plátanos, papayas, naranjas, manzanas, duraznos y hasta plantas de tumbo. Las construcciones del lugar son mayormente antiguas y no cuentan con servicios básicos.
Remberto es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y también habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. la casa donde vive perteneciente a su familia, cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo, la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la  venta de comida y su hijo que estudia en la escuela; “en este lugar siempre fue difícil el acceso al agua, quisiera que mi hijo crezca con agua potable…” comenta. Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa, el desea realizar la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 8 años que viene construyendo su casa. 
Es por esos motivos que Remberto solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para que su hijo crezca con agua potable.
texts.en:
Remberto, 29, lives with his partner who he has one five-year-old son with.  He works in transport.  He is independent, enterprising, clever, responsible and hard-working.  

He carries out his work in an area called Sacaba, which is a rural part of the town which supplies the population with cereals, vegetables, fruit, wheat, barley, bananas, papayas, oranges, apples, peaches and passion fruit.  

Most of the buildings in the area are very old and do not have basic amenities.  Remberto is dark-skinned, of short height, and has short black hair.  His native language is Quechua which is spoken at home, but he also speaks Spanish for business and as part of his culture.  

The house where he lives belongs to his family and has an electricity supply and water from a well.  He shares the home with his partner who sells food.  Their son studies at school.  

He tells us that drinking water is difficult to get access to in this area and he wanted his son to be able to have it.  For this reason, he dreams of finishing building his home and installing drinking water in his kitchen, bathroom and washroom.  

This is the second sequence of loans with this institution in the eight years he has been completing his home.  

So, the loan he is asking for will be used to install drinking water as mentioned so that his son can grow up with this service.

loans.use: to install drinking water in his home.

loans.name: Hạnh

texts.en:
Mrs. Hạnh operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit.

Hạnh is 38 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Hạnh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business.  Hạnh has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hạnh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Hạnh faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hạnh hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy rice and groundnuts

loans.name: Ley

texts.en:
Ley, 64 years old, is living in a community of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She has two married children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. She has been in business for almost 40 years. On average, she is able to earn USD $5.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL at a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Elvin David

texts.es:
Desde su infancia Elvin soñó con enseñar, lo cual no es solo transferir conocimiento, enseñar exige alegría y esperanza. El maestro que intenta enseñar sin inspirar en el alumno está tratando de forjar un hierro frío, por esas razones Elvin decidió estudiar para enseñar pero también para aprender de los alumnos. Elvin quien cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres y familia, se está formando profesionalmente para después ser el quién forme a jóvenes de bien. 
Elvin solicita el crédito para el pago de aranceles, gastos educativos, equipo tecnológico y gastos de titulacion, todos estos materiales le ayudaran a crecer profesionalmente y como persona de esta manera le podrá ofrecer un mejor futuro a sus dos hijos así como una mejor educación y seguridad. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento que le ayudara a cubrir los gastos educativos de esa manera podrá impartir clases de manera eficaz, implementando un mejor proceso de aprendizaje para sus alumnos.
texts.en:
From a young age Elvin dreamed of teaching, which is not only transferring knowledge, but teaching how to exude happiness and hope. The teacher who tries to teach without inspiring the student is trying to forge cold iron. Therefore Elvin decided to study teaching but also to learn about students. Elvin has the support of his parents and family, and is attending school to become a teacher who can then be the person who shapes young people in positive ways.

Elvin seeks a loan to pay duties, education expenses, technological equipment, and credential expenses. All these items will help him grow professional and in this way he will be able to offer a better future to his two children such as a better education and security. He is placing his confidence in the financing that will help him cover his expenses and in this way he will be able to give classes efficiently, implementing a better learning process for his students.

loans.use: to pay duties, education expenses, technological equipment, and credential expenses.

loans.name: Dan'asabe

texts.en:
Dan'asabe is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Dan'asabe would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Dan'asabe can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Dan'asabe is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing  for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Willian Alexander

texts.es:
Willian, de 23 años de edad, actualmente está estudiando técnico en inglés, está soltero, vive con su mamá y su hermano.

Willian, tiene 4 años de trabajar en una institución en donde es el encargado de archivo, su lugar de trabajo está ubicado a 5 kilómetros de su casa, su horario de trabajo es de 8:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m.

Willian, necesita el crédito para comprar 1000 ladrillos y 5 bolsas de cemento, para construir un cuarto en su casa, porque tiene planes de casarse y necesita adecuar la casa con anticipación, para llevar a su esposa a un lugar digno y seguro.

Willian, sueña con seguir trabando en esa institución de gobierno, para asegurar los ingresos necesarios para el sustento de su familia y cuando ya se case, poder darle a su esposa las comodidades necesarias.- Además, sueña con graduarse y ser un profesional de éxito.
texts.en:
Willian, 23, is currently studying technical English.  He is single and lives with his mother and his brother.

Willian has been working for 4 years in an institution where he works as a file clerk.  His place of work is located 5 kilometers from his house, and he works on a schedule from 8am until 4pm.

Willian needs this loan to buy 1,000 bricks and 5 sacks of cement to add a room to his house, because he has plans to marry, and he needs to adapt the house in advance so that he can bring his bride to a decent and secure place.

Willian dreams of continuing to work in this government institution, so that he can be sure to have the income he needs to support his family, and when he marries, to give his wife all of the necessary comforts.  Also, his greatest dream is to graduate and become a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy 1,000 bricks and 5 sacks of cement

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Samaila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Yossiya and Amos.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Samaila would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Samaila spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, thus eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ayuba Jalawa

texts.en: Ayuba Jalawa is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Ayuba Jalawa joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Rahama, Kabiru and Ra'uf.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ayuba Jalawa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ayuba Jalawa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Ayuba Jalawa spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alvaro De Jesus

texts.es:
Álvaro un hombre de 44 años de edad, felizmente  casado y con 3 hijos ha logrado mantenerlos a todos ellos gracias a un negocio que fundo en el año 1998, el cual es ser acordeonero, para las personas que no están relacionadas con el termino son aquellos que usan el instrumento musical acordeón muy popular en la música vallenato y el toca esas sintonías que alegan al pueblo y despiertan sentimientos en los corazones de todo aquel que escucha sus interpretaciones.
Como todo instrumento musical este se deteriora y es costoso y ahora para seguir dando serenatas solicita una ayuda crediticia para la compra de un nuevo acordeón.
texts.en:
Álvaro is a 44-year-old man who is happily married and has three children. He has been able to take care of all of them thanks to a business that he started in 1998 - accordionist. For those who are not familiar with this term, it is someone who plays the accordion, a very popular instrument in Vallenato music (folk music of Colombia, literally - born in the valley).  He plays these tunes, bringing happiness to the people and stirring the hearts of all who listen to his performances.

Like any musical instrument, his is showing signs of wear and tear, and it is expensive. So that he can continue giving his serenades, Álvaro is asking for a loan to buy a new accordion.

loans.use: to buy a new accordion so he can continue playing his music.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz una mujer soltera de 58 años de edad, que gracias a su negocio de confección a terceros logro levantar una familia conformada por ella y dos hijos, la confección es su única entrada de dinero gracias a este trabajo come, paga sus cuentas, se viste, etc., esto solo para entender la dimensión de la importancia de su negocio.
Ella quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos y repuesto para su maquinaria, que lo pide a gritos.
texts.en:
Luz is a single woman of 48, who, thanks to her third-party sewing business, managed to raise a family consisting of herself and two children. Sewing is her only source of income. Thanks to this work, she eats, pays her bills, clothes herself, etc., this is only to understand the extent of the importance of her business.

She wants to apply for a loan to purchase supplies and parts for her machinery, which is crying for them.

loans.use: to buy supplies and parts for her machines.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials like fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc. for her fishing business.

Yolanda has been in this business for 42 years. She also earns more income from a general store. Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials like fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 56 years old and married with eight children, one of whom is in school. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Shirley has been farming rice for ten years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en: Sorn, 52, is the mother of five dependent children living in Kampong Speu province. She struggles to earn a living by growing rice on one hectare and by working for others for a fee. Nowadays, she can earn about 25,000 KHR per day to support her family. This is her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can update her family's living conditions by improving sanitation.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Yeredon Group

texts.fr:
Yeredon  est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Medina-coura de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et ont au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, Habillement, produits cosmétiques et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur quatorzième prêt de groupe.
Sadjatou qui est un membre du groupe Yeredon, assise au bout vers la droite est une vendeuse d’Habillement et produits cosmétiques. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter d’Habillement et produits cosmétiques (déodorant, lotion, crème et vernis) en quantité et en qualité au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au marché.    
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Yeredon comptent  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 200 000CFA  chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Sadjatou compte réaliser  250 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Yeredon is a group of women from the Medina-Coura district of Koutiala who know each other well and who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They are on average 39 years old and have at least three children.

This group of women retails various articles such as clothing, cosmetics and other products. To increase the size of their activities, the members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their fourteenth group loan.

Sadjatou, who is a member of the Yeredon group sitting at the far right, is a seller of clothing and cosmetics. She plans to use her loan to buy clothing and cosmetics (deodorants, skin lotions, beauty creams and nail polish) in quantity and quality while she retails her products to a diverse clientele. She resupplies at the market.

Whereas other members of the Yeredon group expect average profits of 200,000 CFA francs each during this loan cycle, Mrs. Sadjatou is hoping for 250,000 CFA francs.

In addition to repaying the loan, she will use some of the profits to meet personal expenses and increase her working capital. She would like to strengthen this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to avoid stock shortages.

loans.use: buy clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Ixa Alexandra

texts.es:
Ixa escogió estudiar derecho de acuerdo a lo que pensaba, para ella era en la carrera que mejor se podía desempeñar y poder mejorar sus habilidades que en un futuro le ayudarían a ser una mejor abogada. Ixa se caracteriza por ser una joven estudiosa y emprendedora actualmente además de terminar su curso de titulación para obtener su título, también estudia su segunda carrera la cual cursa el segundo año con buenas notas. Ixa cuenta con el apoyo de su familia así como el de su hermana y su mama, quienes la han apoyado en todas sus decisiones.
