Ixa solicita el crédito para la cancelación de su curso de titulación, estima que será de mucha ayuda porque le ayudara a obtener su título y de esa manera contribuirá  a la sociedad desempeñando su carrera. Ixa tiene muchas metas quien a sus 22 años está tratando de cumplir, una de ellas es desempeñarse como abogada, finalizar su otra carrera y en un futuro poder tener un departamento legal, deposita su confianza en el financiamiento que le ayudara a convertirse en una profesional.
texts.en:
Ixa  chose to study law as she thought that for her she was in the program that she could work in and improve her skills that would help her be a better lawyer in the future. Ixa is characterized as a young, studious, entrepreneur currently completing her course to earn her degree. Also, she is studying her second course with good grades the second year. Ixa has the support of her family such as her sister and mother, who have supported her in all her decisions.

Ixa is asking for a loan in order to pay for her degree. She thinks that it will be a big help because it will help her obtain her degree and in this way she can contribute to society carrying out her profession. Ixa has many goals, who at 22 years of age she is trying to meet. One of them is working as a lawyer, finishing her second degree, and in the future to be able to have a legal office. She places her confidence on the funding that will help her become a professional.

loans.use: to pay for her university degree program

loans.name: Loice's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Loice, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. She is 34 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 8 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She is married and has 2 children.

Loice is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Loice says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2014, she has had more profits from each harvest, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Loice will use the profits from this season to invest in a business.

The group will use this loan to purchase fertilizer to plant a total of 5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Eunice's Group

texts.en:
Eunice is 31 years old and is often described as a very experienced farmer. She has 3 children and is married. As a group leader, Eunice is representing her group of 12 farmers in Kakamega South District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Eunice's desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

Eunice and her group will receive a total of 5 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Thương

texts.en:
Mrs. Thương has a manufacturing business making wood furniture. Thương is 29 years old and she is married with two children. Thương lives with two dependents in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Thương faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Thương hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es una mujer de 58 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos de 28, 25, 21 y 19 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es independiente, buena madre, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘mutualista’ un área comercial ubicada en el centro de la ciudad caracterizada por agrupar a la mayor parte de oficinas comerciales y de empresas. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo a una temperatura que varía durante el día entre aproximadamente 21-35 grados centígrados.
Silvia es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello gris, ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica a la construcción y con su hijo que estudia en la universidad, sus hijos mayores son independientes. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, como; pantalones, poleras, camisas, camisetas, jeans, etc., labor que realiza de forma ambulante durante todos los días de la semana. “la ropa de segunda mano es más accesible y se vende constantemente, tengo clientes constantes y mi negocio prospera…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda de ropa. Ella desea aumentar sus ventas realizando la compra de ropa por mayor para satisfacer la demanda de temporada. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Silvia solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para satisfacer la demanda de temporada.
texts.en:
Silvia is a 58-year-old woman. She has four children who are 28, 25, 21, and 19 years old, and her business is the sale of second-hand clothes. She is independent, perseverant, responsible, and hardworking and a good mother. She runs her business in the "Mutualista" zone, a commercial area that is located in the center of the city and is known for being home to most of the commercial offices and businesses. The city has a warm, tropical, humid climate with temperatures that vary during the day from approximately 21 to 35 degrees Celsius.

Silvia has brown skin, short stature, gray hair, and dark eyes. Here mother tongue is Guaraní, and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and the business she does. She shares her life with her husband, who works in construction, and her son, who is studying in the university. Her older children are independent. 

Her business is the sale of second-hand clothing like pants, t-shirts, shirts, jerseys, jeans, etc., work that she performs as a street vendor every day of the week. "Second-hand clothing is more accessible and it sells constantly. I have regular customers and my business is prospering," she says. Her dream is to have a clothing store. She would like to increase her sales by making a purchase of clothing at wholesale in order to satisfy the seasonal demand. This is her first loan with the institution in the year that she has been doing this work.

For those reasons, Silvia is requesting a loan for the purchase of second-hand clothing at wholesale in order to satisfy seasonal demand.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing at wholesale in order to satisfy seasonal demand

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela is a 36-year-old married woman from Rustavi city. She has a little daughter and son and has no source of income for her family's well-being. Natela has a great desire to start a retail business and make the only source of income to lead the financial difficulties and cover even her basic needs. 

She requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for starting a trading business but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because the creditors did not find the existing family income to be sufficient to approve the loan. Natela requested a loan from Credo to start a trading business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides start-up credit soft conditions for the country's poor people, who, regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income, do not have access to credit products. With the received credit, Natela will purchase refrigerators and a stock of products for her local trading. She has already found a place at a good location in a local central market and will rent it with the requested amount.
 
The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the family's income and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions. Natela and her children rely on the good will of lenders and highly appreciate it.

loans.use: To open a store and get a source of income

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es: Olga se encuentra muy feliz y muy satisfecha ya que gracias a KIVA en alianza con la cooperativa COMIXMUL ella invirtió su financiamiento en la compra de insumos agrícolas para poder abonar y foliar sus cultivos de café ya existentes y las plantas de café que están pequeñas donde el café esta verde fue necesario para que el producto saliera sólido y de buena calidad. Gracias a este financiamiento ella considera fue una puerta que se abrió en el momento justo, porque estaba en condiciones preocupantes para darle el ultimo retoque de mantenimiento a su plantación de café lo cual permitió fortalecerla aún más, dándole una última abonada porque sus cultivos necesitaban este último mantenimiento y por falta de capital no lo había hecho. Muy agradecida con Dios primeramente por permitirle acceder a dichos fondos pues ella pudo salir con su compromiso y nuevamente ella solicita un segundo financiamiento el cual le permitirá invertir en el pago de la mano de obra la cual será utilizada para limpiar de maleza y quitar sombra de las plantas lo cual es necesario para que las plantas puedan crecer y rendir frutos, comprar abono nuevamente los mismos abonos, foliares, y de más que dieron una gran ayuda a sus cultivos esperando en esta nueva ocasión ser apoyada por diferentes inversionistas para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Olga is very happy and satisfied thanks to Kiva and COMIXMUL. She invested her financing in buying farming supplies in order to fertilize her existing plants and her young coffee plants where the coffee is green. It was necessary that the product be solid and of good quality. Thanks to this financing she believes that a door was opened at just the right moment, because she was worried at being able to provide the last of the maintenance to her coffee crops which enabled them to be even stronger, giving them one last fertilizing as her crops needed this maintenance and because of a lack of capital she hadn’t yet done so.

She is very thankful to God first for enabling her to access those funds so she could meet her loan payments, and now she seeks a second loan which will enable her to pay for labor to clean the weeds and remove the shade from the plants, which is necessary so that her plants can grow and generate fruits. She will buy the same manures and fertilizers again as they were a great help to her crops. She is hoping in this new loan to be supported by various investors in order to be successful.

loans.use: to pay for farming supplies and labor that is qualified to assist with her crops.

loans.name: Rithy

texts.en: Rithy is a 38-year-old married car mechanic who is from the Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. He has four children and three of them attend school. Rithy has been a car mechanic since 2012, making around USD 17 per day. His wife is a 38-year-old homemaker. To generate more income to improve his family’s living, he has decided to take a loan to buy lumber to produce closets to sell. In the future, he is going to help all his children to earn bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to buy lumber to produce closets to sell.

loans.name: Ada Lizeth

texts.es:
La joven Ada vive en un barrio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa, al sur de Honduras, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 2 añitos. El esposo trabaja en un depósito de refrescos en esta misma ciudad.
Ada es una persona muy dinámica y trabajadora de muy temprano de la mañana sale a repartir su mercadería a las aldea de aledañas a Santa Cruz y barrios vecinos, tiene su clientela la cual le hacen encargo de mercadería. 

Ada su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y ropa usada, zapatos de mujer y accesorios  de dama, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de pantalones, vestidos, blusas, faldas, camisas, sandalia, zapatillas, etc. espera que con este préstamo poder surtir para esta temporada navideña ya que tiene varios encargos y no tiene el dinero para poder surtir y con las ganancias obtenidas poder seguir surtiendo su negocio y así extenderse más.

Ada uno de sus sueños es comprar un solar en esta ciudad y poder hacer su vivienda la cual ha anhelado.     




Santa Cruz De Yojoa, Honduras - Noviembre  del 2014
texts.en:
Ada lives in a neighborhood of Santa Cruz de Yojoa, in southern Honduras.  She lives with her husband and her little 2 year-old daughter.  Her husband works in a beverage warehouse in the same city.

Ada is a very dynamic and hardworking person who goes out early in the morning to distribute her products to the village of Santa Cruz and the surrounding neighborhoods.  Her customers make orders for her merchandise.

Ada has a business selling new and used clothing, women's shoes, and women's accessories.  She is requesting a loan to buy pants, dresses, blouses, skirts, shirts, sandals, slippers, etc.  She hopes that with this loan, she will be able to stock up for the Christmas season, because she has a number of orders that she doesn't have the money to fill.  With the earnings she obtains, she will be able to continue to stock her business and thereby grow the business.

One of Ada's dreams is to buy a plot of land in this city, so that she could build the house she has always wanted.  

Santa Cruz De Yojoa, Honduras - November 2014

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Doña Yolanda a sus 53 años de edad ha logrado salir adelante con su negocio. Está soltera y tiene tres hijos pero solamente dos a su cargo. Su profesión es contadora pública pero se dedica a la venta de diferentes artículos para uso personal. Solicita el crédito para comprar productos de la época navideña tales como: ropa, cremas de mano, ropa interior, prendas de plata entre otros. El crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá surtir la demanda de sus clientes y así obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Yolanda, 53, has managed to get ahead with her business.  She is single and has 3 children, but only two are still in her care.  She works as a public accountant, but she also has a business selling a variety of personal products.  She is requesting a loan to buy products for the Christmas season, such as: clothing, hand creams, underwear, silver jewelry, and other items.  This loan will be a great help to her, because she can stock up to meet the demands of her customers, and thereby obtain greater earnings.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Masaka Group

texts.en:
Salama, who is in her mid-50's, is married with two children who are grown up and are working.  She has been running a grocery store for three years now.  She works from 8 AM to 4 PM daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Salama's 18th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to keep on increasing on the grocery inventory. She is doing fine and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She managed to pay back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to cover household expenses and reinvest in the business.  She will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock drinks and will start selling spirits in the grocery store.  She dreams of having a better life.

Salama will share this loan with her loan group, Masaka, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock drinks and start selling spirits in the grocery store.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
Making and selling silver and gold jewelry is how Alpha spends her time. She makes various types of rings, earrings, bracelets, and necklaces. She also offers to make jewelry ordered by those customers who want personalized jewelry. 

Alpha is a wise woman who has managed her jewelry shop in the past years, and now she also sells slippers and sandals in her shop. Yet, she still wants to expand her business to have enough stable earnings for her family. Alpha wanted to borrow a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy broken jewels and other items needed in making jewelry. She will also use the loan to buy more slippers, and sandals to sell. She hopes to have more customers to serve, and more earnings as well.

loans.use: to buy broken jewels and other items needed in making jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy in bulk glutinous rice and other ingredients for making native cakes.

loans.name: Joy Grace

texts.en: Joy Grace is a 39-year-old married mother of four children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 15 years now. This is the source of their income. Joy Grace would like a loan to buy new fishing nets and materials for the repair of the boat like plywood, nails, epoxy adhesives and paints. Joy Grace believes that a loan will help improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Joy Grace hopes of making her business more sustainable and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and materials for the repair of the boat like plywood, nails, epoxy adhesives and paints

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites aims to earn more income from her business to meet her children's needs in school. Marites has a clothing stall where she sells shirts, pants, underwear, and jackets. At present, Marites is also selling sandals, shoes, and slippers for an additional source of income. She needs to manage her time and space at her stall to recover her rent paid for the stall. Marites is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy more clothes and shoes to sell. She hopes to encourage more customers and increase sales. Marites believes that the loan will help her increase her sales by selling more goods in her stall. She will look toward the success of her business soon.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Ellaine

texts.en: Ma. Ellaine is a 33 year old married woman and a mother of six children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 13 years now. This is their main source of income. Ma. Ellaine is requesting to take a loan to buy a new boat engine for their fishing boat. This loan will help Ma. Ellaine and her husband in improving their fishing business as well as their income. In the future, Ma. Ellaine hopes to make their fishing venture more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy new boat engine for their fishing boat.

loans.name: J'carol

texts.en:
J’Carol is 30 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one school-aged child. 
J’Carol earns a living from allotment of her husband who is an overseas seaman. She earns approximately PHP 15,000.00 each month. This amount is so helpful to support her family needs. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials for their house renovation.
J’Carol has been a member of PMPC since this year. In the future, J’Carol hopes to finish her new house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Josepert's Group

texts.en:
Jospert is a 68-year-old proud father of 6 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 15 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Jospert has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Jospert described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Jospert’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Violet's Group

texts.en:
Violet, featured in the above picture, is representing her farming group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She is 35 years old and a married mother of 6 children, often described as a very hardworking individual. 

Although Violet has been a farmer for 20 years, she is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because she really wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Even though she is new to the program, Violet wanted to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Violet hopes to be able to send her children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Haruna joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Musa, Shitu and Yushau.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Haruna would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Haruna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Haruna spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Roda's Group

texts.en:
Roda is the group leader of her group in Kakamega South District, and she is representing 10 farmers, including herself. She is married and a proud mother of 3 children. Roda joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but she has been a farmer for 10 years.

Like many other farmers, Roda decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. She hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer she will get with this loan, she can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She plans to use the profits she earns from this year’s harvest to invest in a business.

Roda's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 5.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 3 solar lights, as some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package (even though Roda decided not to).

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is selling onion, garlic, and ginger in the market. She has her children but all are already married. Loida’s husband is a farmer. 

To provide their needs, she is doing her best to encourage more customers and to assist her regular customers. Through her earnings from the business, Loida is able to afford their daily food. 

Loida wants to have savings so that there is already a certain amount in case of emergency. For this, Loida is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy more ginger, onions, and garlic to sell. 

She hopes to sell more than her usual sales daily to increase her income as well. She is confidence to have savings soon if she gets a higher income from her business.

loans.use: to buy more ginger, onions, and garlic to sell.

loans.name: Phylis Group

texts.en:
Phylis is a 34-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very reliable person, and is representing her group of eight farmers in Teso District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Phylis has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Phylis described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Phylis Group will be able to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land and purchase a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice is 50 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 14 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Alice has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Alice also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Alice's Group will be able to receive a total of 10 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 73 years old and lives in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with one child who is now at her adult age. 

Nena is a retired teacher by profession and has been receiving a monthly pension for almost 34 years already. She earns approximately PHP12, 500 each month as her regular monthly pension. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing her maintenance medicines. Nena has been a member of PMPC for almost ten years. In the future, Nena hopes that all her relatives will become a member of this cooperative.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing her maintenance medicines

loans.name: Patman

texts.en: Patman is 35 years old. She is married and has two school-aged daughters. The family lives in Kutaisi district. Patman is unemployed at the moment. The only source of income of her family is her husband's income, working as a taxi driver in Kutaisi. Patman is a very hardworking woman and she wants to start her own business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1,200 GEL to start a trading business. With the received credit she will purchase clothes to resell in Kutaisi at a higher price. She will gain income and will be able to improve the living conditions of her family. Patman awaits your support.

loans.use: to start a clothes trading business and generate her own income

loans.name: Rabbeca's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Rabbeca, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by seven farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She is a married mother of three children and known in her community as a very hard-working individual.

Initially, Rabbeca joined One Acre Fund in 2013 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has been able to consistently feed her family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Rabbeca plans to save more money for the future.

Among the seven farmers in Rabbeca's Group, a total of 3.5 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Jena

texts.en:
Jena is 40 years old and married with three children, who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Jena has been in this business for two years.

In the future Jena would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Savoeurn's Group

texts.en: Savoeurn’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Savoeurn makes a living cultivating rice and planting watermelon and she also does extra work as construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Felisidade

texts.en:
Felisidade is applying for a loan of $800.00 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin}. She is married and has two children. She is 29 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as  eggs, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk ,fish, water, oil, sugar and biscuits. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 
Felisidade is living in a town near the school. Her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: To buy egg noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, fish, water, oil and biscuits

loans.name: Thoeun's Group

texts.en: Thoeun’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Thoeun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Roeurn's Group

texts.en: Roeurn’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Roeurn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Noé Rigoberto

texts.es:
Noé es un hombre muy  comprometido con su familia que lucha cada día para darles lo necesario él tiene un hijo pequeño, Noé tiene 32 años de edad y vive junta a su esposa.
Para Noé luchar todos los días con el trabajo es lograr prosperidad, pues él desde hace diez años desempeña la labor de cerrajería, le gusta hacer este trabajo ya que con eso aporta a los gastos de su hogar para el sustento de su familia, Noé por la labor que desempeña es reconocida por su comunidad.
A parte de ser cerrajero, Noé también repara calzado de segunda mano, para él todo oficio es digno  si a uno le gusta hacer, este trabajo lo realiza desde su hogar. La necesidad que se le presenta ahora a Noé es  ampliar su negocio, por tal razón él está buscando un préstamo para la compra de materia prima.
El sueño más grande de Noé es que con las ganancias de su negocio pueda darle un mejor futuro  a su hijo, comprando todo lo necesario para equipar su casa.
texts.en:
Noé  is a man who is very committed to his family, and fights every day to give them what they need. He has a small son. Noé is 32 years old and loves with his wife.

For Noé, fighting the good fight every day at work means achieving prosperity. He has worked as a locksmith for 10 years, and he likes this work since he can put the money toward household expenses to sustain his family. Noé is recognized in his community for the work he does. Aside from being a locksmith, Noé also repairs second-hand shoes. To him, all work is dignified if one likes doing it. He does this work from home. The need he has now is to expand his business, for which reason he is seeking a loan to buy raw materials.

Noé's biggest dream is that, with the profits from his business, he will be able to offer his son a better future, buying everything he needs to outfit his house.

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy onions, garlic, papayas, noodles, cigarettes and bread.

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en: Sreymom’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sreymom makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Meerimai

texts.en:
Meerimai is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Business Administration. Here is her story:

“I know that there are a lot of students,who apply for Kiva loans and wait for the lenders’ support. Having financial problems in my family, I am also happy to take an advantage of a Kiva loan. If I get the Kiva loan, I will pay my university fee and I will be able to continue my studies just as before.

I live with my father, grandmother and two sisters in Batken region, far from Bishkek. Last year, I won a full scholarship for a one-year study program at New Generation Academy and I moved to Bishkek. The program provided me with free studies, housing and a meal plan. It was the first time I left my home and I felt sorry for my family, but I was eager to study and now I am happy to be a freshman at AUCA.

My father is 53 years old and has health problems but still works to provide for our family. My grandmother is a pensioner and my younger sister takes care of her. My elder sister studies at one of the local universities. We have livestock, we work in the field, grow vegetables and fruits then sell them at the markets. Our work is typical for villagers.

When I was a school-girl I couldn’t even dream about attending AUCA. Thanks to New Generation Academy, I could enter AUCA and now kindly ask Kiva lenders to help me with the tuition fee. I promise to do my best, to study hard and I will try to make my way on my own.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Roly

texts.es:
Roly es un hombre de 27 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es la sastrería.
Él es emprendedor, independiente, constante, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘Cachilaya’ caracterizado por su cercanía al lago sagrado Titicaca, área agrícola dónde se cría ganado; vacuno, ovino y camélido, se vive de la pesca y también de vegetales del lugar, como la quinua, el chuño, la haba, la papa, etc. caracterizada por el clima frío, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 1-12 grados centígrados y donde los rayos solares golpean con mucha fuerza la superficie.
Roly es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres, que está construida de adobe y techo de paja, cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo. Su negocio es la sastrería; dónde su creatividad y experiencia se ajustan a la medida de los clientes. Entre paños, linos, agujas y moldes han transcurrido los últimos 3 años, él confecciona pantalones y chaquetas a medida y también modifica todo tipo de prendas según el capricho de sus clientes. En la mesa de corte es donde comienza la aventura; con agilidad, precisión, rapidez, esmero y dedicación, el resultado: una prenda de vestir hecha a la medida. “en el corto tiempo que vengo trabajando en sastrería ya tengo contratos para uniformes de colegio…” comenta. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y vestir a todos los colegios de la zona. Él desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de una máquina de coser industrial. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Roly solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser industrial y confeccionar todos los uniformes de la zona.
texts.en:
Roly is a 27-year-old single man with no children.  He's a tailor.  He's enterprising, independent, persevering, responsible, and hardworking.  He works in the community of Cachilaya, which is known for its proximity to the sacred lake Titicaca.  It's an agricultural area where they raise livestock: cattle, sheep, and llamas.  They live off fish and local vegetables like quinoa, freeze-dried potatoes, beans, potatoes, etc.  The area is characterized by its cold climate, with daily temperature variations of 1 to 12 degrees C, and where the sun's rays beat hard.  

Roly is dark-skinned, short of stature, with short black hair.  His native language is Aymará which they speak where he lives; the people in general speak Spanish.  He lives in his parents' house, which is made of adobe with a straw roof and has electricity and well water.   Roly works as a tailor, where his creativity and experience meet the needs of his clientele.  He's spent the past three years among cloth, linen, needles and patterns.  He tailor-makes pants and jackets and alters all types of garments as his clients desire.  The adventure starts out on the cutting board, and with agility, precision, speed, great care, and dedication comes the result: a tailor-made garment.  "During the short time I've been a tailor I've already got contracts for school uniforms," Roly says.  

Roly's dream is to improve his business and outfit all the schools in the area.  He wants to expand his business by buying an industrial sewing machine.  This is his second loan cycle with this institution in the three years he's been working independently.  His objective is to buy the sewing machine and make all the uniforms in the area.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine and make all the uniforms in the area.

loans.name: Hernanie

texts.en:
Hernanie is a 52-year-old married man and a father of ten children from Iloilo, Philippines. Hernanie is a fisherman, and has been in the fishing business for more than 20 years now. Fishing is a very profitable venture. 

Hernanie is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like nets, hooks, lead weights and floaters. With this, he will be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Hernanie has hopes of improving his fishing business. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like nets, hooks, lead weights and floaters.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a 36-year-old married woman and the mother of six children from Iloilo, Philippines. She has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than ten years now. Fishing is their main source of income. Judith is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like lead weights, fishing nets, hooks and floaters. With this, she and her husband will be able to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Judith hopes to make their fishing business more profitable and sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money to pay for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like lead weights, fishing nets, hooks and floaters

loans.name: Ana Melva

texts.es:
Ana Melva tiene 26 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia junto a su cónyuge e hijos en el distrito La Matanza, provincia de Morropon, departamente de Piura, en la costa norte del Perú. Los pobladores del distrito se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales.

Ana Melva se dedica a la crianza y comercio de animales menores (aves), la actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años. El destino del crédito será para realizar mejoras en su vivienda, comprará materiales de construcción como son ladrillo, cemento , fierro, etc. Ana Melva utilizará el credito para construir una habitacion mas en su vivienda, dandole mayor comodidad y seguridad a su familia, lo que le permitira mejorar la calidad de vida de todos ellos.
texts.en:
Ana Melva is 26 years old and is in a common-law marriage.  She lives in her own home with her husband and their children in the La Matanza district in Morropon province, in the department of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.  The residents of this district work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Ana Melva works raising and selling small animals (birds).  She's been doing this work for 2 years.  She will use this loan to make some improvements to her home, buying construction materials such as bricks, cement, steel, etc.   Ana Melva will use this loan to add another room to her house.  This will give her family greater comfort and security, which will improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to make some improvements to her house

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Iloilo, Philipppines. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. This has been the source of her ncome for the past 12 years now. Luzviminda is asking to take a loan to buy more stocks to sell like rice, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, bread and biscuits, eggs and other items. With a loan, she will be able to improve her stocks, thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Luzvimida hopes of to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like rice, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, bread and biscuits, eggs and other items

loans.name: Jenibeth

texts.en:
Jenibeth is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Iloilo, Philippines. She owns a small truck for her transportation business. Jenibeth also runs a small sari-sari or retail store business, selling various goods and food items to the people in her area

Jenibeth is asking to take a loan to buy gasoline for the truck and stocks for her store, like rice, canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments and snack foods.  With a loan, she will be able to improve her stocks, thus attracting more buyers in her store. 

In the future, Jenibeth has hopes of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy gasoline for the truck and stocks for her store, like rice, canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments and snack foods.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rosanna works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish and farming rice. Rosanna is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fishing net for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rosanna has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing net for her business

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Doña Maria gracias a su primer financiamiento logro dar una excelente asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café, por lo que se encuentra muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado por la cooperativa COMIXMUL en alianza con los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de KIVA. Ella logro comprar urea, formula cafetalera, fórmula 18-26-0 y con otra parte pudo pagar la mano de obra calificada la cual fue necesaria para dar una mayor y mejor asistencia a sus cultivo de café. Gracias a ello, ella logro obtener una buena cosecha sobre sus cultivos de café la cual vendió a muy buen precio mejorando los ingresos en este año y con ello saliendo de cada uno de sus compromisos. Por lo que nuevamente ella está solicitando un nuevo apoyo económico de los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de Kiva para salir adelante nuevamente con la compra y mejora de su propiedad para esta nueva temporada.
texts.en:
Thanks to the first loan Maria was successful in giving excellent help and maintenance to her coffee crops, which is why she is very grateful for the help provided by the Comixmul cooperative and Kiva loaners. She was able to buy urea, coffee formula, 18-26-0 formula, and with the rest she could pay the competent manual labor which was needed to give more and better assistance to her coffee plants. As a result, she managed to get a good harvest from her coffee plants which she sold at a good price improving her income this year and was able to meet all her commitments. 

So she is applying for another loan for new financial help from the various Kiva loaners to again move forward with the purchase and improvement of her property for the new season.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to assist in the cultivation of her coffee plants

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 34 years old and married with five children.

Marife earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins.

Marife has been pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Iloilo, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than ten years now. Jenelyn also raises pigs for additional income.

Jenelyn is asking to take a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and feeds for the pigs. With a loan, Jenelyn and her husband will be able to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Moreover, she can also improve her hog raising business. 

In the future, Jenelyn has hopes of making her business a success.  She also wants to save money to pay for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Ronamie

texts.en: Ronamie, 46 years old, lives in Carles, Iloilo with her family. She is married with three children with her youngest 17 years old. Ronamie is engaged in hog raising and buying and selling dried fish in her community. Her business has been thriving for 10 years now. She is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy piglets, feed and additional capital for dried fish. Ronamie is determined to make her business a success for her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and additional capital for dried fish

loans.name: Cherryl

texts.en:
Cherryl is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She runs a fishing business with her husband. Fishing provides them the income that they need to sustain and support the needs of the family. Cherryl is standing next to crab cages. 

Cherryl is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters, and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat. This loan will enable Cherryl and her husband to improve their catch thus allowing them to sell more fish and crabs to the market. 

In the future, Cherryl dreams of making their business more stable and profitable. She also wants to save money for the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters, and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is a 48-year-old married mother of three children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She works with her husband in their fishing business. This has been the source of their income for more than 20 years now. Marilyn wants a loan to buy materials for fishing like nets, lead weights, propeller, and a boat engine. A loan will help Marilyn and her husband improve their fishing business as well as increase their income. In the future, Marilyn dreams of expanding their fishing business so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing like nets, lead weights, propeller, and a boat engine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of nine children. She works in crab fishing with her husband. This is the source of their income. Emelia is standing next to crab cages which will be used to catch crabs. 

Emelia is asking for a loan to buy nets and nylon for fishing. A loan will help Emelia and her husband in improving their catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Emelia hopes to make their fishing business a success. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy nets and nylon for fishing.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 76 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five siblings who are now at their adult age. 

Editha is a retired employee and presently receiving a monthly pension from one of the government’s Social Security Agencies in the country.  She is also engaged in managing a little parcel of agricultural land, particularly used for coconuts and riceland. 

She earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month that supports their family needs. She has requested a loan to be used in paying for labor costs and other farm inputs for their existing agricultural farm.

Editha has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to engage in the charcoal-processing business.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs and other farm inputs

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en:
Nelda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like soap, soft drinks, canned goods, etc. for her general store business.

Nelda has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from buying and selling dry goods.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Nelda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like soap, soft drinks, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en: Clarita joined PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari (convenience) store business. She is thankful for the capital extended to a small time borrower like her. Clarita is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she requested a loan to restock er store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a descent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

loans.name: Elpidio

texts.en:
Elpidio is 61 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is single with three siblings. 
Elpidio earns income from a pig-fattening business. He’s been engaged in this business for almost four years. He is also receiving support from his son and daughters. He earns approximately PHP 2,500 each month from his business to support his family's needs. He has requested a loan to buy four sacks of feed and vitamins for the pigs. 
Elpidio has been a member of PMPC for almost three years. In the future, Elpidio hopes to build a small piggery..

loans.use: to buy four sacks of feed and vitamins for the pigs.

loans.name: Anelene

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Anelene works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs.  Anelene is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Anelene has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is 51 years old, married, and has six children. Five of her children are in school.

Melissa is in the agricultural business, farming rice and sugarcane in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Melissa has been farming rice and sugarcane for two years now and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain herself.

In the future, Melissa would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and chickens and from a general store. Rocelyn is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to  buy pork, beef, rice, spices, chicken, etc., for her restaurant business.

Rocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy pork, beef, rice, spices, chicken, etc

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 62 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, soap, coffee, drinks, noodles, etc.

Evelyn has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, soap, coffee, drinks, noodles, etc

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 52 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Fe works very hard to provide for her family.

Fe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages and groceries. Fe has been in this business for 19 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Fe would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages and groceries.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 54 years old and married with one child.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. 

Wilma is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional fertilizers and to pay laborers' salaries.  Wilma has been farming rice for six years, and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers and to pay laborers' salaries.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Haruna would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Haruna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked about his goals, Haruna expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home and, in the long run, ensure his children Aisha, Isiyaku and Hama are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Jennifer works hard to support her family.

She has a business farming vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Jennifer is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her business.

Jennifer has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. Helen is married and has a dried fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy assorted dried fish to sell.

Helen has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Helen would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy assorted dried fish to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 38 years old and married with four children, three of whom are still in school. Eva works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods, biscuits, candies, juice and soft drinks to sell. Eva has been in this business for five years.

She would like to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, biscuits, candies, juice and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in Kampong Speu province, Mom is 35 years old and a mother of two schoolchildren. 

She can earn income to support her family condition via rice cropping. Moreover, she can earn extra income via working for others for a fee. She has been involved this business for ages and earns her about 33,300 KHR per day. 

This is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. In a group of seven members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can update her family's condition to live in health.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Geydi Del Carmen

texts.es: Desde que Geydi tenía ocho años le ayudaba a su mama a preparar la masa y a realizar las tortillas que forman parte del alimento diario del nicaragüense. Hace tres años se independizo de su mama y decidió poner su propio negocio de tortilla, gracias a este negocio ha logrado salir adelante pero para incrementar sus ingresos decidió vender cosméticos, perfumes, pinturas labiales entre otros. Geydi siempre quiere mantener el negocio activo es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para comprar la materia prima de las tortillas así como perfumería. Dentro de sus planes futuros esta incrementar su negocio y tener más vendedores.
texts.en:
Since Geydi was eight years old, she has been helping her mother prepare flour and make the tortillas that form part of the daily diet of Nicaraguans. Three years ago she became independent from her mother and decided to start her own tortilla business. Thanks to this business she has been able to get ahead, but to increase her earnings she decided to sell cosmetics, perfumes, and lipsticks, among other items. 

Geydi always wants to keep the business active; this is why she is asking for a loan to buy the raw material for tortillas as well as perfume. Her future plans include growing her business and having more salespeople.

loans.use: to buy raw material for tortillas as well as perfume

loans.name: Rabbeca's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Rabbeca, often described as an extremely reliable person. She is 35 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.  She is married and has four children.

Rabbeca is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she will be able to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Rabbeca says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2012, she has been able to consistently feed her family, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Rabbeca will use the profits from this season to send her children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase a total of two solar lights as well as seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a business selling clothes, bags and accessories for women

loans.name: Hun's Group

texts.en: Hun is 57 years old and a father of three children living in Kampong Speu province. To overcome the family’s hardship, he grows rice as a single source of income. He has been involved in this business for ages and it earns him about 25,000 KHR per day. This is his first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He leads a group of eight members to get new loan. As the group leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to buy a water filter. He hopes his family will have enough clean water to use.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Philice's Group

texts.en:
Philice is a 43-year-old proud mother of five children. Often described as a very friendly person, Philice and is leading her group of 15 farmers in the Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Philice has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Philice described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Philice’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 14 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is  taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as chilis, plastic, and vegetables. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $100.  

She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy chilis, plastic, and vegetables

loans.name: Soklay's Group

texts.en:
Soklay, 34, lives in Kampong Speu province and is a mother of four children. For her family's living, she grows rice and works for others for a fee to earn more income. 

This is sixth cycle for Soklay with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loans wisely to improve her living condition at a gradual pace. 

She leads a group of three members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. 

She hopes that she can improve her family's living to be healthier than before.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom, 46, lives with family members in a rural village in the Takeo province. She is the mother of three children. To overcome her family’s hardship, she earns income by raising pigs and cows. She grows rice as well to earn more income. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan on paying tuition fees for her daughter who wants to complete a bachelors degree majoring in midwifery. She hopes that her daughter will get a good job after graduating.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her daughter to study a bachelors degree majoring in midwifery.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyunchimeg, 52 years old, lives with her husband, daughter and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They reside in a Mongolian traditional ger (a portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land.

She has been running a barbershop for 22 years. Her husband repairs broken automobiles for a living. Using her previous loan, she paid the tuition fee for her daughter. Now again she is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to pay the tuition fee for her daughter. If it wasn't for the economic recession in Mongolia, she could have paid the tuition fee herself with her returns from the barbershop.

loans.use: to pay tuition fee for her daughter

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall for her buy and sell of vegetables business.

Annabelle has been in this business for 10 years. Annabelle earns more income from farming rice.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Annabelle has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Edda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Edda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Edda is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to  buy more household goods to sell for her general store business.  She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Edda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more household goods to sell

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is 37 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Loida has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and earns additional income from farming rice.

Loida aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, and eggs

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es una señora muy optimista y con muchos sueños, trabaja muy duro todos los días para darle lo mejor a su familia; es soltera y tiene 3 hijos y su pareja. Ella tiene 26 años de edad.

Ella es ama de casa, se dedica a las labores del hogar; sin embargo ella con todo el deseo de aportar y darle una mejor vida a sus hijos se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos los cuales vende en la comunidad donde vive; ella con esta actividad genera algunos ingresos con los cuales contribuye al presupuesto de gastos de su familia. Esto le llena a ella de mucha satisfacción porque la hace sentir útil a sus hijos y a su comunidad.
 
Con la convicción de que su familia merece una vida digna, Gloria solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción para la remodelación de su vivienda.
 
Uno de sus principales sueños es terminar de construir su vivienda y arrendar parte de la misma para generar más ingresos.
texts.en:
Gloria, 26, is a very optimistic woman who has a lot of dreams.  She works very hard every day to give her family the best.  She's single and has three children and her companion.

She's a homemaker and she takes care of the household chores.  She very much wants to contribute and give her children a better life, however, so she weaves traditional textiles and sells them in her community.  She generates some income with this work and contributes to the family budget, which fills her with satisfaction because it makes her feel useful to her children and her community. 

Gloria's convinced that her family deserves a decent life, so she's requesting a loan to buy construction materials to remodel her home.

One of her main dreams is to finish building her house and rent part of it out to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es una señora muy optimista y con muchos sueños, trabaja muy duro todos los días para darle lo mejor a su familia; es casada, tiene 6 hijos y su esposo. Ella tiene 32 años de edad.

Ella es ama de casa, se dedica a las labores del hogar; sin embargo ella con todo el deseo de aportar y darle una mejor vida a sus hijos se dedica al trabajo doméstico en otras familias y también al cultivo de maíz; ella con estas actividades genera algunos ingresos con los cuales contribuye al presupuesto de gastos de su familia. Esto le llena a ella de mucha satisfacción porque desea lo mejor para sus hijos.
 
Con la firme idea que su familia merece una vida digna, Isabel solicita un préstamo para la compra de un terreno para poder cultivar más maíz
 
Uno de sus principales sueños es que sus hijos tengan una profesión para que tengan más oportunidades y así puedan mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Isabel, 32, is a very optimistic woman who has a lot of dreams.  She works very hard every day to give her family the best.  She's married and has six children and her husband.

She's a homemaker and she takes care of the household chores.  She very much wants to make a contribution and give her children a better life, however, so she does domestic work for other families and also grows corn.  She generates some income with these jobs, so she contributes to the family budget.  This gives her a lot of satisfaction because she wants the best for her children.

Isabel firmly believes that her family deserves a decent life, so she's requesting a loan to buy a plot of land to be able to grow more corn.
 
One of her main dreams is for her children to have professions so they have more opportunities and so they can improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Miguel Ernesto

texts.es: Miguel es un emprendedor hombre de 44 años de edad, habitante del municipio de Galapa en el departamento del Atlántico, está dedicado a su venta de cerdo, desde el año 1998, tiempo prudente para tener una clientela consolidada a quienes les ofrece facilidad de pago para la adquisición de los productos, alterno a esta actividad y en conjunto con su padre venden bebidas.   Su horario de atención es de 6 a.m. a 6 p.m. todos los días, él trabaja muy comprometido para cumplir con su meta a largo plazo de tener un local propio, así mismo tiene como meta familiar comprar una casa para mejorar su nivel de vida y su gran desafío en el negocio será incrementar sus ingresos, para ello está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual invertirá en la compra de cervezas y carne de cerdo, aprovechando las celebraciones que se están presentando en la temporada decembrina, una época del año en la que se incrementa el consumo de estos productos. Miguel es padre de 3 hijos de 21, 15 y 1 año de edad, quienes son su principal motivación para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Miguel is an enterprising man of 44. He lives in the municipality of Galapa, in the Department of Atlántico. He has worked since 1998 at his business selling pork. This has been plenty of time to build up an established customer base, and he offers his customers easy payment terms for the purchase of his products. He divides his time between this activity and selling beverages together with his father. His work hours are 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day. He works in a very committed way in order to achieve his long-term goal of having a shop of his own. He also has the goal for his family of buying a house in order to improve their standard of living. His great challenge in his business will be to increase his income. For that reason, he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. He will use the funds to invest in buying beer and pork, taking advantage of the December holiday season, a time of year when people consume more of these products. Miguel is the father of 3 children, aged 21, 15 and 1, who are his main motivation for improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beer and pork to sell.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a 45-year-old fisherman from Concepcion, Iloilo. He is married and has seven children. Jenny has been in the fishing business for more than 20 years. This is the source of his income. 

Jenny is asking to take a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and a new boat engine. This loan will help Jenny improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Jenny hopes of making his fishing business a success and sustainable. Moreover, he wants to save money for his children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and a new boat engine

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children from Concepcion, Iloilo. Merlinda helps and supports her husband in their fishing business. For more than 30 years now, fishing has provided them the income that they need for sustenance. Merlinda is requesting a loan to buy a new boat engine and to buy materials for the repair of the fishing boat like plywood, nails, epoxy adhesives and paints. This loan will help Merlinda and her husband in improving their fishing business as well as their income. Merlinda wants to improve their way of living and save money for her children’s schooling.

In the photo, Merlinda is standing next to a pile of crab cages.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine and materials for the repair of the fishing boat like plywood, nails, epoxy adhesives and paints

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is a 47-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ludivina has a pottery business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her business. Ludivina has been in this business for 25 years. 

In the future, Ludivina would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 37 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like chips, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

Ellen has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Ellen aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like chips, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 53 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. she has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from working in a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 54 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lolita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lolita has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 25 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Leonida has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 35 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like noodles, eggs, milk, canned goods, etc.

Vivian has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF in the past. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from raising chickens.

She aspires to build and expand her business.
