loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like noodles, eggs, milk, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell in her food stall for her buy and sell of vegetables business.

Leonora has been in this business for three years. Leonora earns more income from rice retailing.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Marta Alicia Nohemi

texts.es:
Marta es una señora muy optimista y con muchos sueños, trabaja muy duro todos los días para darle lo mejor a su familia; es casada, tiene 4 hijos y su esposo. Ella tiene 33 años de edad.

Ella se dedica los oficios domésticos en el municipio donde vive; se dedica a esta actividad porque según ella es una forma digna de generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia; ella está feliz de estar realizando esta labor porque es una manera de ser útil y productiva a la sociedad.
 
Con la seguridad que tiene la capacidad y el coraje para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, Marta está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la mejora de su vivienda.
 
El mayor de sus sueños es terminar de construir su vivienda y así darle una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Marta, 33, is a very optimistic woman with a lot of dreams.  She works very hard every day to give her family the best.  She's married and has four children and her husband.

She earns a living providing housekeeping services in the town where she lives.  She works in this job because for her it's a decent way to earn the income she needs to support her family.  She's happy to be doing this work because it's a way to be useful and productive in society. 

Marta's certain she has the ability and courage to give her family a better quality of life.  She's requesting a loan to buy materials to improve her home.

Her biggest dream is to finishing building her house to provide a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Ravy

texts.en: Ravy is a 20-year-old single student who is studying agriculture in his second year at university in a province. He is from Battambang province of Cambodia. He needs finances to pay his tuition fees for three years so Ravy has decided to request a loan. With the loan, he will be able to graduate successfully with skills to achieve his future goals. After graduation, he is going to run a farm and then save money to have his own house.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Osana

texts.en: Osana is a 43-year-old mother with five children. She runs a small plantation in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for over five years. Osana has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, knife, taro roots, banana tubes, hand gloves, water tank, chemicals, shovel, and safety boots to help her run the business. Osana will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2004.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, knife, taro roots, banana tubes, hand gloves, water tank, chemicals, shovel, and safety boots

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es una mujer de 48 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos de 16, 13 y 8 años, y su negocio es la producción de queso artesanal.
Élla es buena madre, emprendedora, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad de ‘Batallas’ distante a 60 kilómetros de la ciudad, caracterizado por su cercanía al lago sagrado Titicaca, de clima frío y seco donde los rayos solares golpean la superficie terrestre con mucha fuerza.
Francisca es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo trenzado, su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se encarga de la agricultura, ambos viven en una casa construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con los servicios de luz y agua de pozo, juntos realizan la producción artesanal de queso y derivados lácteos. En el lugar se respira tranquilidad. El olor a queso invade cada esquina de su casa.  El proceso que sigue es el siguiente; comienza certificando la leche para conocer el rendimiento que tendrá, Luego de certificar la leche, se comienza con el proceso de transformación con la cocción a una temperatura de 70 grados centígrados, durante 30 minutos aproximadamente. Después se deja enfriar y se le añade el cuajo y la sal. “Una vez que está el punto de temperatura, se extrae el suero y se pasa a un tiempo de escurrido, para que seque completamente…” comenta. Su sueño es producir en mayor cantidad y vender a mercados grandes. Ella desea realizar la compra de ganado lechero para aumentar su producción de Queso artesanal.  Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 30 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Francisca solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero para aumentar y mejorar su producción Quesera.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 48 year old woman, married, with 3 children of 16, 13, and 8 years of age. Her business is the production of artisan cheese.

She is a good mother, an entrepreneur, steady, responsible and hardworking. She transacts her work in the community of Batallas which is 60 kilometers from the city. Characterized by its proximity to the sacred Lake Titicaca, the climate is cold and dry where the sun’s rays hit the Earth’s surface with great force.

Francisca has a dark complexion, is short, and has long braided black hair. Her mother language is Aymara and she has general knowledge of Spanish using it for business. She shares her life with her husband who works in agriculture. They live together in an adobe house with a tin roof and have electric lights and well water. They have made artisanal cheese together and dairy products. The place exudes tranquility. The smell of cheese invades every corner of the house. 

The process they go through follows: it starts with the certification of milk to know the actual performance that they will have. After the milk certification is the process of transforming by cooking at a temperature of 70 degrees Celsius for about 30 minutes. Then it is left to cool and rennet and salt is added. “Once the temperature point is reached, the whey goes through a time of draining in order to dry completely,” she comments.

Her dream is to produce in larger amounts and to sell at larger markets. She wants to buy dairy cattle to increase her production of artisan cheese. This is the first loan sequence with the institution in the 30 years she has been doing this activity. It is for these reasons that Francisca is asking for a loan to buy dairy cattle to increase and improve their cheese production.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle to increase and improve her cheese production

loans.name: Samuel Arturo

texts.es:
Samuel es un habilidoso, trabajador y capacitado hombre de 23 años de edad, soltero y con un gran futuro por delante, tiene un negocio de reciclaje donde les da empleo a tres personas.
Su negocio es heredado por su padre y fue el quien lo entreno y ahora que es el dueño tiene una visión para el negocio y todo empezara a partir de un crédito que solicita para realizar reformas locativas pues tal y como se puede apreciar en la foto las necesita de urgencia. Estas reformas no solo serán para darle más seguridad al negocio y renovar esas viejas y oxidadas rejas, también servirán para ampliar y meter más mercancía.
texts.en:
Samuel is a skilled, hardworking, and well-trained 23-year-old man. He is single and has a bright future ahead of him. He has a recycling business where he employs three people.

He inherited his business from his father, and it was his father who trained him. Now that he is the owner, he has a vision for the business. Everything will start with a loan that he is requesting to do on-site repairs, because as one can see in the photo, they are urgently needed. This remodeling will not only provide more security to the business and renovate those old, rusty bars, but it also will serve to expand and add more merchandise.

loans.use: to refurbish his business, replace those old rusty bars, expand his warehouse, and buy more supplies

loans.name: Estrella Del Mar Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Estrella del Mar está integrado por tres microempresarias que solicitan por primera vez el financiamiento para sus negocios, quien lo coordina es Karla de 26 años de edad, casada, se dedica a la comercialización de ropa nueva y de segunda en su comunidad, este negocio lo impulsó hace cinco años con ayuda financiera de su esposo, con el crédito actual lo invertirá en blusas, camisetas, jean, paca mixta especial, etc., se ha propuesto como meta pagar las cuotas en el tiempo establecido y así gozar de los beneficios de tener un buen récord. El resto de las integrantes son, Jennifer de 23 años de edad comerciante de ropa de segunda en su comunidad desde hace cuatro años, y Gabriela quien tiene la edad de 25 años dedicada a la comercialización de ropa nueva y cosméticos desde hace siete años en su comunidad.
texts.en: The group Estrella del Mar consists of three members who through their microbusinesses seek their first financing for their businesses. The group's coordinator is 26 year old Karla. She is married and sells new and used clothing in her community. She started this business 5 years ago with financial help from her husband. With today's loan she will buy t-shirts, blouses, jeans, mixed bundles of clothing, etc. She has proposed as a goal to pay the payments on the established timeframe and in this way enjoy the benefits of a good credit record. The other group members are 23 year old Jennifer who has sold used clothing in her community for 4 years, and 25 year old Gabriela who has sold new clothing and cosmetics in her community for 7 years.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, blouses, jeans, mixed bundles of clothing in a way that will enable her to buy at wholesale, thus improving her income.

loans.name: Leutu

texts.en: Leutu is a 23-year-old lady, who runs a small business selling elei prints in her community. She has been doing this for more than a year. Leutu has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, and elei designs to run the business. She will expand her business by using her profit. Leutu joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, and elei designs.

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento SANTA MARIA está compuesta por nueve integrantes de las cuales todas son mujeres, todas ellas se dedican a distintas actividades como, personas venta de mandiles y lana, venta de jugos batidos, venta de cubiertas de celulares,  venta de jugo, venta de perfumes, venta de refrescos y venta de ropa, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios todas ellas se conocen entre sí ya que viven por la misma zona.
Margarita es una mujer de 53 años de edad, casada, tiene tres hijos varones de 26, 22 y 19 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Margarita es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al transporte como taxi, su familia vive en una casa propia construida de ladrillo, que cuenta con electricidad, agua potable y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional cruceña, platos como; majadito de charque (carne deshidratada, arroz, huevo frito y plátano frito), Sopa de Remojado (sopa de huesos), Cogote relleno (cuello de gallina criolla, relleno puede ser de papa y churiqui), Locro Carretero (incluye arroz, charque y plátano, papa, cebolla verde y huevo), Rapi al jugo (carne de res cocida y acompañada con arroz y yuca), y otros. Su labor la realiza durante todos los días de la semana en horario de almuerzo y cena. “el clima del lugar hace que tengamos variedad de vegetales y sabores exquisitos, la cocina que elaboro es variada y mis clientes son continuos y constantes…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un restaurante. Ella dese ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de muebles como; mesas y sillas y también insumos de cocina como; yuca, harina, arroz, charque, plátano, etc., por mayor, para cocinar en la época de las fiestas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que viene realizando esta actividad es por esos motivos que Margarita solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas como también insumos.
texts.en:
The Santa Maria communal bank is made up of nine members, all women, in a variety of businesses selling aprons, wool, smoothies, cell phone cases, juices, perfumes, soft drinks, and clothing. They are seeking a loan to grow their businesses.  They all know each other because they live in the same area.

Margarita is a 53-year-old woman who is married with three children, 26, 22, and 19.  She sells traditional food.  She's dark-skinned, small of stature, and has long pony-tailed black hair.  Her native language is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish to the general public and for business.  She shares her life with her partner, who earns his living as a taxi driver.  Her family lives in their own house, which is made of brick and has electricity, potable water and is on a sewer system.  The food she sells includes traditional Cruceña plates, including majadito de charque (dried beef, rice, fried egg and fried banana), sopa remojado (bone soup), cogote relleno (creole stuffed chicken necks, with potato and cured meat), locro carretero (rice, cured meat and banana, green onion, and egg), rapi al jugo (cooked beef with rice and yucca), and other dishes.  

Margarita works lunch and dinner every day of the week.  "With our weather we can have a variety of vegetables and exquisite flavorings. The dishes I make are varied and my clients are steady and continuous," she says.  Her dream is to have a restaurant.  She wants to expand her business by purchasing furniture like tables and chairs and ingredients like yucca, flour, rice, jerky, bananas, etc. wholesale so she can cook for the holiday season.  

This is her first loan cycle with this institution in the twenty years she's been in business; the business is her motivation for seeking the loan to buy the furniture and ingredients.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and ingredients.

loans.name: Rosabel

texts.es:
Rosabel tiene 55 años, viuda desde hace 01 año, vive en casa propia desde hace 35 años en el centro poblado de Saltur, distrito de Zaña, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. De familia unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Rosabel se dedica a la venta de alimentos preparados (cebiches, piqueos, polladas). El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de 01 refrigeradora para almacenar los alimentos, con ello tendrá una mejor conservación de alimentos, mayor venta y atención a clientes y así poder generar ingresos para una mejora en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosabel, 55, has been a widow for a year.  She has lived in her own home for 35 years in the community of Saltur in the district of Zaña in the province of Chiclayo in the department of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.  Her family's very close.  She lives in a commercial, agricultural, and ranching community.

Rosabel earns a living selling prepared food (ceviche, snacks, chicken).

She's going to use the loan to buy a refrigerator to store her food.  That way she'll better preserve her food and have better sales and customer service.  She'll earn income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es:
Luz Amparo tiene 55 años de edad, es casada, sin hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, distrito de Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Luz Amparo se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, como leche, aceite, arroz, azúcar, gaseosa, artículos de aseo, etc. Su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo, para compra de una cantidad mayor de mercadería como leche, arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc. Dicha inversión le servirá para incrementar sus ventas, con gran influencia en el negocio; con la finalidad de tener mayor stock de productos para poder atender las diversas necesidades, requerimientos y gustos de los clientes de la zona, con esto incrementar sus ventas y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz Amparo is 55 years old, married, does not have any children and she lives with her family in Oyotun district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque district on the northern coast of Peru. The inhabitants of the district work in farming, business, and cattle.

Luz Amparo sells groceries such as milk, oil, rice, sugar, soda pop, general groceries, etc. Her business is located in her home. She seeks a loan for working capital to buy a large quantity of merchandise such as milk, rice, sugar, oil, etc. This investment will enable her to increase her sales, have a great influence on the business, with the goal of have more stock of products to be able to meet various needs, requirements, and likes of her customers in the area. This will enable her to increase her sales and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of merchandise such as milk, rice, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Gerame

texts.en:
Gerame is 32 years old and has two children. Gerame is married and one of her children is currently in school.

Gerame is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Gerame requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed and vitamins to her pigs.

Gerame has been in this business for 10 years, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 60 years old and married with five children. With two children in school, Veronica works very hard to provide for them.

Veronica runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Veronica has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soft drinks, and other groceries. 

In the future, Veronica would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Zhyldyz

texts.en:
Zhyldyz is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Liberal Arts and Sciences. Here is her story:

“I am the happiest student in the world, because I entered AUCA, the best university for me. For the person who has big ambitions, it is important to choose the best university that has a modern education system, well-equipped lab and library. However, the most important issue now is tuition payment. That’s why I am requesting a Kiva loan.

"I have a big family of seven: my parents, my elder and younger sisters, two younger brothers and me. My father is the only breadwinner in our family. My two younger brothers go to the kindergarten, my younger sister goes to the school, and my elder sister is a student at one of the local universities. In addition to that, I am a freshman this year. It goes without saying that my family is having hard times, because my father has to pay for everything by himself. My mother used to work and help him, but after giving birth to my little brothers, she stays at home and maintains the household, as someone has to take care of them at home. My elder sister and I try to support my family and have a part-time job in summer, but for all that our earnings are enough just for our books and clothes. My family always saves money, but still seven members of my family are to live and spend money.

"I think that I can’t make much for my family now, but will be able in the future, if I get a degree, to find a good job and being financially independent. I can give advice to them and help my other siblings to be educated. The big achievements and victories begin from small steps, and I am ready to step now. I thank Kiva lenders for your generosity and await your support.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria has been offered a $600.00 loan to improve her business. She is married and living in a town with her family. She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own savings of $140.00. She has been generating a good income from selling things from the kiosk. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like cigarettes, beer, soft drinks, noodles, bread, coffee, sugar and salt. Additionally, she will purchase a refrigerator for the business. Her goal is to expand her business after more experience with running it.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, a refrigerator, beer, soft drinks, noodles, bread, coffee, sugar and salt

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 24 years old and has three children. Marivic is married and has children who are in school.

Marivic is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Marivic requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and farm supplies.

Marivic has been farming rice for three years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Marivic would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and farm supplies

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is 44 years old and has two children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Georgina has been farming rice for 8 years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

Georgina is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en: Suzette is a 41-year-old dried fish vendor from Ajuy, Iloilo. She is married and has three children. Suzette has been in the business for more than six years now. This is the source of her income. Suzette is asking for a loan to buy more dried fish to sell. With this loan, Suzette will be able to increase her stock thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Suzette hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save some of her earnings to pay for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dried fish and rice to sell

loans.name: Hector Benicio

texts.es:
Hector Benicio tiene 37 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Bolívar, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Hector Benicio se dedica a brindar servicios de carpintería, contando con herramientas propias, con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en su domicilio, él solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo, compra de material de carpintería (madera), dicha inversión le servirá para realizar trabajos de madera y poder tener en stock artículos, con gran influencia en el negocio; Hector Benicio piensa mejorar productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona, así como también poder captar a un número mayor de clientes. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Hector Benicio is 37 years old, is partnered, has 2 children, and lives in a rural zone in the Bolívar district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú. His community basically works in agriculture, animal husbandry and trade.

Hector Benicio works offering carpentry services. He has his own tools, with more than 10 years of experience in his business, which is located in his home. He asks for the loan for working capital. He will purchase carpentry material (wood). This investment will serve him to make wooden items and be able to have them in stock, with a big influence on his business. Hector Benicio plans to improve the productivity of his services and in this way be able to serve the diverse needs of his customers in the zone, and also be able to attract a larger number of customers, which will allow him in the short term to improve his income, increase his earnings, with the end of improving his quality of life, and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase carpentry material (wood).

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina tiene 53 años de edad, vive con sus hijos, en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural de Cayaltí , cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Catalina se dedica a la actividad de crianza de ganado vacuno, producción y venta de leche, además de venta de animales menores como carneros, pavos, patos y cuyes, desde hace más de 15 años de antiguedad en el negocio, el cual se encuentra ubicado en su propio domicilio. Catalina solicita préstamo para la compra de alimento de engorde balanceado para todo su ganado. De esta manera hacer crecer su negocio y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Catalina is 53 years old, she lives with her children in a small community in the rural zone of Cayaltí. She has good personal and work references from her neighbors. The population works in agriculture, trade and raising animals, and it is located in the province of Chiclayo which belongs to Lambayeque reggion, on the northern coast of Perú. 

Catalina works raising cattle, producing and selling milk, and in addition, she sells small animals such as rams, turkeys, ducks, and guinea pigs. Her business is more than 15 years old, and is located in her own home. Catalina asks for a loan to purchase balanced feed for fattening for all of her livestock. In this way, to grow her business and be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for fattening for all of her livestock.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Maria se encuentra muy feliz, muy satisfecha, muy contenta porque gracias al apoyo financiero por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de KIVA en alianza con la cooperativa COMIXMUL, ella pudo comprar los insumos que eran necesarios aplicar a sus cultivos de café, dando una mayor y mejor asistencia para que estos estuviesen protegidos de plagas, cambios de clima, etc. Gracias a su primer financiamiento su vida mejoro ya que en un principio no tenía los recursos económicos para poder comprar los insumos que necesitaba y gracias a la confianza que la cooperativa depósito en ella y tomándola en cuenta para dichos fondos compro los abonos, foliares, fertilizantes con los que dio asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café logrando obtener excelentes ganancias sobre su cosecha y pudiendo ponerse al día con su financiamiento. Doña Maria nuevamente pide ser apoyada con un segundo financiamiento el cual invertirá en poder dar asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café ya que después de la corta las plantas quedan maltratadas y deterioradas así como también la limpieza de la misma de maleza entre otras.
texts.en:
Maria is very happy, very satisfied, and very content because thanks to the financial support of various Kiva lenders in partnership with the Comixmul cooperative, she was able to buy the supplies that were necessary to apply to her coffee plants, giving more and better assistance so that they were protected from pests, climate changes, etc. 

Thanks to her first loan her life improved since at first she did not have the financial resources in order to buy the needed supplies. Thanks to the confidence the cooperative had in her she took the funds to buy manure, foliar, and fertilizers to give assistance and maintenance to her coffee plants, managing to get excellent income on the harvest and catching up financially. 

Maria is asking for help again with a second loan to invest so she can give assistance and maintenance to her coffee crops as after cutting the plants are damaged and worn and also the undergrowth needs to be weeded among others.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for new assistance to her coffee plants

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery es una mujer de 42 años de edad, casada, tiene una hija de la edad de 24 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, alegre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, comprometida con su trabajo y responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de Villa Fatima, Rosmery es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza, Su vida la comparte con su hija que es su razón de vivir, viven en una casa alquilada que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, como; Pescados, sábalo pejerrey Ispi, Plato paceño (carne de res, habas verdes, choclos y queso), Fricase de cerdo (sopa de cerdo con chuño, mote y papas), Sopa de Quinua (quinua y carne), anticucho (corazón de res y papa a la parrilla, con ají de maní), chairo paceño (sopa de chuño con carne) y otros. Oficio que aprendió desde muy niña cuando le ayudaba a su mamá. “la comida típica destaca la riqueza tradicional que aún está latente en nuestra gente…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un restaurante grande donde pueda vender comida con comodidad. Ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de insumos de cocina por mayor, como; carnes, fideos, arroz, papa, chuño y otros, para cocinar durante las fiestas de fin de año. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en sinco años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rosmery solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para estar abastecida durante las fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Rosmery is a 42-year-old married woman with a 24-year-old daughter.  Her business is selling traditional food.  She's a good mother, cheerful, optimistic, happy, has a good attitude, and is committed to her work and responsible.   She works in the Villa Fatima area.  She's dark-skinned, has long black pony-tailed hair, and is small of stature.  Her native language is aymara and she speaks Spanish culturally and for business.  She shares her life with her daughter, who is her reason for being, in a rented house with potable water, electricity, and a sewer system.  She sells traditional meals like fish (shad, pejerrey, ispi), La Paz lunch plate (beef, green beans, corn and cheese), pork fricassee (pork soup with freeze-dried potato, hominy, and potatoes), quinoa soup (with quinoa and meat), and anitcucho (beef heart with grilled potatoes and peanut sauce), chairo Paceño (dried potato soup with meat) and other dishes.  

Rosmery learned when she was very young by helping her mother.  "The typical food highlights the traditional richness that remains latent in our people," she says.  Her dream is to have a big restaurant where she can sell meals in comfort.  She wants to make an investment in her business by purchasing ingredients wholesale, such as meats, noodles, rice, potatoes, dried potatoes, and other items to make during the end-of-year holiday season.  This is her first loan cycle with this institution in the five years she's been in business.  It's for the business that she's seeking the loan to buy ingredients to stock up for the holidays.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to stock up for the end-of-year holidays.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
Simon tiene 69 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto a su esposa . El domicilio del cliente se ubica en el caserío Santa Teresa, distrito de Pucará en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra borte de Perú. La comunidad donde vive el cliente es una pequeña zona rural donde los habitantes se conocen y dan buenas referencias del señor Simon, la población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

La actividad que realiza el cliente es la de sembrar café variedad Catimor, desde hace tres años, junto a su esposa se han esforzado en el cultivo de café. El préstamo lo utilizará para invertir en mantenimiento del terreno cultivable, comprando abonos, insecticidas y pago de mano de obra de jornaleros para el mantenimiento de su cultivo. Esta inversión le permitirá ganancias para mejorar su condición económica y por ende mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Simon is 69 years old and lives in his own house made of rustic materials, alongside his wife. The client's house is located in the village of Santa Teresa, in Pucará district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Perú. The community where the client lives is a small rural zone where the inhabitants know each other and give good references for Simon. The population works in agriculture, trade, and animal husbandry. 

The work the client does is to plant Catimor coffee, for the past three years, along with his wife he has worked hard in cultivating the coffee. The loan will be used to invest in maintaining the arable land, purchasing manure, insecticides, and pay labor costs for the day laborers to maintain the crop. This investment will allow earnings to improve his economic situation, with the end of improving his living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in maintaining his arable land.

loans.name: Elyzabeth

texts.en:
Elyzabeth who is 50 years old is from Bungad, San Pablo, Isabela. She is married and blessed with five children. 

Elyzabeth's husband works as a watch repairer and that is their only source of income. Having little income, it is sometimes insufficient, especially since their daughter Charlene is attending college. Charlene is taking a BSc in Business Administration, majoring in financial management. She wants to finish college for she knows that it is a great advantage for someone who wants to have a stable job. 

Elyzabeth cannot provide all the school needs of her daughter, and that’s why she wants to avail an education loan of PHP 50,000. She will use the loan to sustain Charlene’s college education.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fee

loans.name: Annabelley

texts.en:
Annabelley is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Annabelley is 32 years old and all of her children are in school.

Annabelley has a general store business in the Philippines. Annabelley requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, rice, noodles and other groceries.

Annabelley has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Annabelley would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, rice, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Adma

texts.en:
Adma is 35 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Adma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling old tires in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase old tires to sell.

Adma has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Adma would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase old tires to sell

loans.name: Rin's Group

texts.en:
Rin, 35, lives in Kampong Speu province and is a mother of three children. For the sake of her family, she grows rice on a one-hectare area as the main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has been involved this business for several years and earns about 28,000 KHR per day.

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of four members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family’s living in good health.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es: Luis es un sorprendente joven soñador que se ve en un futuro estudiando, comprando una casa, un carro y que para ello no se queda esperando en la casa esperando al oportunidad, Luis afronta el futuro dándole la cara creando un negocio de confección directa, lo que se puede ver en la foto es lo que ha comprado con sus ahorros y ahora solicita un crédito para la compra de tela y tener para pagarle el primer mes a sus dos empleados.
texts.en: Luis is an amazing young dreamer.  In the future he will be studying and buying a house and a car.  In order to do so, he does not sit around at home waiting for an opportunity.  Luis faces the future full on by creating a sewing business.  What you see in the photo is what he has purchased with his savings.  He is now requesting a loan to buy fabric and to have enough to pay his two employees for the first month.

loans.use: to buy fabric and to have enough to pay his two employees for the first month.

loans.name: Mylyn

texts.en:
Mylyn is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. Mylyn has been in this business for 15 years. Mylyn earns additional income from buying and selling nipa roofing and charcoal.

Mylyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF). She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell for her business

loans.name: Eugenia Elizabeth

texts.es: A sus 33 años de edad Elizabeth es  madre soltera, ella vive con su hijo y su abuelito,  son 10 años desde que se dedica a la venta de ropa, ella se traslada los días jueves a una ciudad donde  consigue su mercadería a bajo precio comprando al por mayor  y después comercializa la ropa quedándole su ganancia y asi es la manera de trabajar diariamente, por esta razon necesita al dinero del credito para comprar mercadería en ropa y asi tener los ingresos para darle lo necesario para su hijo.
texts.en: At 33 years old, Elizabeth is a single mother and lives with her son and her grandfather. She has been working selling clothes for 10 years, she travels on Thursdays to a city where she gets her merchandise at a low price, purchasing it in bulk, and later sells the clothing leaving herself with earnings and in this way she works each day. For this reason, she needs the money from the loan to purchase merchandise in clothing and so to have the income to provide the necessary things for her son. thigns

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: La Honestidad Group

texts.es: La honestidad es un grupo solidario que solicita por primera vez el financiamiento en ADIM, es coordinado por la señora Nohemy quien tiene la edad de 28 años, acompañada y propietaria de una pulpería desde hace cuatro años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de granos básicos como es arroz, azúcar, papel higiénico, toallas sanitarias, pan, cebolla, chiltoma, etc., una de sus metas es crecer en el ámbito de los negocios para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y por ende la de su familia. El resto de las integrantes son las señoras, Cecia de 33 años de edad comerciante de ropa de segunda desde hace tres años en su comunidad y comarcas cercanas, Fátima quien tiene edad de 33 años comerciante de verduras en el mercado municipal desde hace cuatro años, y Yolanda de 47 años de edad propietaria de una pulpería, además se dedica a la hecha y venta de tortillas desde hace diez años en su domicilio.
texts.en:
La Honestidad is a close-knit group which asks for a loan from ADIM for the first time. It is coordinated by Nohemy who is 28 years old, partnered, and has owned a small corner store for the past four years. The loan that she requests is to purchase basic products such as rice, sugar, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, bread, onions, bell peppers, etc.  One of her goals is to grow in the area of her business to improve her life conditions and, in the end, that of her family. 

The rest of the members are Cecia, 33 years old, who has sold second-hand clothing for three years in her community and nearby areas, Fátima who is 33 years old, and has sold vegetables in the municipal market for the past four years, and Yolanda, 47 years old, who owns a small corner store, and in addition has worked making and selling tortillas for the past ten years in her home.

loans.use: to purchase basic products, which will allow her to offer a variety of products to her customers.

loans.name: Adelicio

texts.es:
Adelicio tiene 25 años de edad, él nació en el año Julio del año 1989; vive junto a su cónyuge y su menor hijo en casa de material rústico en el Caserío El Frayle, una comunidad de clima caluroso, con abundante vegetación, su población se dedica a la agricultura (café, yucas y maíz) y crianza de animales menores, ubicado a tres horas del Distrito de Santo Tomás, Provincia de Cutervo, Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Adelicio se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de cafeto desde hace 03 años, su esposa le apoya en esta labor preparando alimentos para ofrecer a jornaleros que dan mantenimiento a su cultivo, son una familia unida que se esfuerza por tener una mejor calidad de vida. Él ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2501 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos orgánicos para su cultivo y de esta manera tener una mejor producción y cosecha para ofrecer a los acopiadores de su Distrito.
texts.en:
Adelicio is 25 years old. He was born in July, 1989. He lives together with his spouse and their minor child in a home made out of rustic materials in the community of El Frayle, which has a warm climate and abundant vegetation. The people of the area dedicate themselves to agriculture (growing coffee, yuca and corn) and raising small farm animals. It is located three hours from Santo Tomás in the Province of Cutervo, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. 

Adelicio works in agriculture, especially growing coffee, which he has done for three years. His wife helps him in this work, and she prepares food for day laborers who work to maintain his crops. They are a united family, working hard to achieve a better quality of life. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2501 Peruvian new soles to buy organic fertilizers for his crops. In this way he will have better production and a better harvest to offer the wholesale buyers of his district.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers for his crops, in order to have better production and a better harvest.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Leah works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming rice. Leah is requesting a loan of PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loans, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. Leah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mach is a 47-year-old widowed rice farmer who lives in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia, with an only child, a 22-year-old garment worker. She has been cultivating rice for ten years. Both she and her child can earn $9 a day.

To help her in rice farming, Mach would like to request a loan to buy fertilizer and gas for water pumping. This loan will help her have better crops to sell, for her plan is to build a new proper house.

loans.use: to request a loan to buy fertilizer and gas for water pumping.

loans.name: Afiafi

texts.en:
Afiafi is a 45-year-old mother with eight children. She owns and operates a business of selling BBQ in her community to earn a living.

Afiafi has requested a loan to buy a box of chicken, a box of sausage, a bottle of mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, and tomato sauce to assist her in running the business.

She joined SPBD in 2014 and hopes to use her profit to build a small restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, a box of sausage, a bottle of mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, and tomato sauce.

loans.name: Irma Carolina

texts.es:
Irma Carolina 
Es propietaria de un mini café internet ubicado en la colonia Jerusalén 
Ella ha sido  ayudada con créditos para su negocio durante 3 años y menciona ella que le ha ayudado mucho porque cada crédito le ayuda para poder comprar una maquina nueva para poder ayudar y brindar un buen servicio a las personas que viven dentro de su comunidad ha mostrado ser una persona responsable y capaz de poder desenvolverse dentro de su comunidad  y espera en DIOS poder seguir adelante y con mucha responsabilidad poder llevar a cabo sus pagos…  actualmente  ella desea un nuevo crédito para la compra de una maquina y un mueble para colocarlo dentro de su negocio y con ello ayudar a su familia ya que tiene el tiempo necesario para poder estar con sus hijos sin necesidad de Salir de su casa  actualmente terminó un crédito y espera en DIOS trabajar de la misma manera con el que se le otorgue.
texts.en:
Irma Carolina is the owner of a mini internet café in Jerusalén colony.

She has been helped with loans for her business for 3 years and says that they have helped her a lot because each loan helps her to be able to purchase a new machine to be able to help and offer good services to the people who live in her community. She has shown herself to be a responsible person and capable of getting along in her community and she hopes with God to be able to continue onward and with a lot of responsibility be able to make her payments. 

Currently, she wants a new loan to purchase a machine and furniture to put it on in her business and, with it, help her family since she has the time necessary to be able to be with her children without needing to leave her house. She has just finished one loan and hopes in God to work in the same way with that which is offered to her.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Blanca Nube Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Nube Blanca lo integran tres socios laboriosos, es coordinado por Mario quien tiene la edad de 49 años, acompañado, su negocio es la venta de frutas en el mercado de León, este negocio lo impulsó hace tres años por medio de un préstamo que le hizo a su hermano, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de mango de rosa, papaya, banano, mamón chino, etc., esto le permitirá diversificar más los productos que ofrece d manera que podrá cubrir la demanda que tiene de estos productos. Las otras integrantes son las señoras, Ivania quien tiene la edad de 28 años  se dedica a la comercialización de frutas en el mercado de León desde hace tres años, y María de 67 años de edad comerciante de frutas en uno de los mercados de la capital desde hace dos años.
texts.en: The Nube Blanca group has three hard-working members, and is coordinated by Mario, who is 49 years old and partnered. His business is selling fruit in the market in León. He undertook this business three years ago with a loan that he took from his brother. He asks for the current loan to purchase pink mango, papaya, banana, rambutan, etc.  This will allow him to diversify the products he offers more, so that he will be able to meet the demand for these products. The other members are Ivania, who is 28 years old and has worked selling fruits in the market in León for the past three years, and María, 67 years old, who has sold fruit in one of the markets in the capital for the past two years.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of pink mangoes, bananas, rambutan, papaya, etc., to be able to offer his customers a wider variety of products.

loans.name: Dúo Bendicion De San Raymundo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Bendicion de San Raymundo
Este grupo está formado por doña Eva Madahi de 29 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, ella tiene una tienda desde hace 7 años, también vende licuados y almuerzos, y ropa típica, solicita este crédito porque necesita incrementar su negocio comprando, algunos artículos de consumo diarios, como frijoles, arroz, golosinas, aguas, pastas, jabones,  y el resto para comprar blusas y cortes para seguir vendiendo, ella espera poder algún dia tener un local propio en su casa para ya no seguir alquilando, por eso trabaja mucho para poder lograrlo.
texts.en:
Dúo Bendicion de San Raymundo

Eva Madahi, age 29, is a member of this group.  She is married and has four children.  She has had a store for seven years.  She also sells smoothies, lunches, and typical clothing.

She is requesting this loan because she needs to increase her business by purchasing some daily consumption items.  She will buy things like beans, rice, sweets, water, pasta, and soaps.  She will use the rest to buy blouses and skirts in order to continue selling them.  She hopes to one day be able to have her own place at her house so that she does not have to continue renting.  That is why she works so much in order to be able to reach that goal.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José tiene 58 años de edad, vive en casa alquilada, junto a su cónyuge y su hijo en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su automóvil, cuenta con más de 15 años de experiencia en el sector y tiene clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El destino del crédito será para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento a su vehículo con lo que espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
José, 58, lives in a rented house with his wife and his son in the rural part of the district of Pucará, located in the Cajamarca region of the province of Jaén in the northern highlands of Peru.  Life there is peaceful.  The residents work mainly in agriculture, ranching, and commerce.

He earns a living providing passenger transportation services in his car.  He has more than 15 years of experience in the field and steady customers who give him very good personal and professional references.

The loan is to perform necessary maintenance on his vehicle.  José hopes this allows him to give better customer service, increase his earnings, and improve his family's quality of life as a result.

loans.use: to perform necessary maintenance on his vehicle

loans.name: Aliaxsar Hermogenes

texts.es:
Aliaxsar Hermogenes tiene 30 años de edad, es casado, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Pomahuaca, ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de esta zona se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con 6 años de experiencia en el rubro y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, compra de abonos y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo y contratación de mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también a tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de productos, por lo cuál no tendrá problemas en vender su producto y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Aliaxsar Hermogenes is 30 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in a rural zone in Pomahuaca district, located in Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. The population in this zone works in agriculture, commerce, and animal husbandry. 

He works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee. He has 6 years of experience in the field and has very good personal and work references in the zone. The loan that will be granted to him will be used in agricultural work, purchasing manure and fertilizers to maintain his crop and hiring laborers for his harvest. In this way, it will help him with the physiological, morphological and productive improvements of his crop. It also will help him to have a timely harvest, and in the end he will have better production and a better quality product, so he won't have problems in selling his product in in this way generate more income for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer to maintain his crop and hire laborers.

loans.name: El Todo Poderoso Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario El todo Poderoso lo integran tres microempresarias exitosas que solicitan por tercera vez el financiamiento en ADIM, quien lo coordina es Ana de 27 años de edad, soltera y propietaria de un pulpería desde hace dos años, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de granos básicos como es arroz, azúcar, aceite, papel higiénico, toallas sanitarias, cajas de fósforos, cajas de jabón protex, tc., con los créditos anteriores ha logrado diversificar los productos ofrecidos. El resto de las integrantes son las señoras María de 67 años de edad comerciante de granos básicos principalmente maíz y frijol,  y Silvia quien tiene la edad de 32 años propietaria de una pulpería desde hace cuatro años.
texts.en: The solidarity group "El Todo Poderoso" ["The Almighty"] is made up of three successful microentrepreneurs who are requesting their third loan from ADIM. Their coordinator is Ana, age 27, who is single and has owned and operated a neighborhood store for two years. She is requesting the current loan to buy basic staple goods such as rice, sugar, oil, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, boxes of matches, cases of Protex soap. etc. With the previous loans, she successfully diversified the products she offered. The other members are María, age 67, who sells staple foods, chiefly corn and beans, and Silvia, who is 32 years old and has owned and operated a neighborhood store for four years.

loans.use: to buy basic staple goods in order to diversify the products she offers and attract new customers.

loans.name: Laylyn

texts.en:
Laylyn is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She is from Iloilo, Philippines. The eldest child is 17, and the youngest is 6.

Laylyn has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 14 years now. She also sells dried fish to the market. Laylyn is asking for a loan to buy more dried fish to sell. With a loan, she will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to the market.

In the future, Laylyn hopes to make her business stable and profitable. Moreover, she wants to save money to pay for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es:
Aristides tiene 27 años de edad, es casado, vive con su cónyuge y su menor hijo en casa de sus padres en la zona rural de la provincia de Callacyuc, que pertenece a la región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. Su población se dedica a la actividad agrícola, ganadería y turismo como actividades económicas principales.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café. Cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra café, una vez que realiza su cosecha ofrece su producto a los diferentes mercados de la zona donde vive y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos mensuales. Cuenta con 6 años de experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes y contratación de mano de obra para realizar el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, con esto Aristides espera mejorar la productividad de su negocio y ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Aristides is 27 years old, married, and lives with his spouse and small son in his parents' house in the rural zone of Callacyuc province, which is part of Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. Its population works in agriculture, animal husbandry, and tourism as its primary economic activities. 

He works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee. He has his own land for cultivation where he grows coffee. Once he completes his harvest, he offers his products to the different markets in the zone where he lives and in this way he can get income to cover the monthly expenses. He has 6 years of experience in the field and has very good personal and work references in his district.  He has asked for a loan to purchase manure, fertilizer and hire laborers to maintain his coffee crop. With this, Aristides hopes to improve his business's production and offer a better product to his customers, which will allow him to increase his level of income with the end of improving his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizer and hire laborers to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nenita is 47 years old, and all of her children are in school.

Nenita has a rice vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Nenita has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Merceline

texts.en:
Merceline is a married mother of four children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, Merceline has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuations in her business. Merceline dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the KES 50,000 Merceline wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. 

Maria is taking a loan of $800 (USD) to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as garlic, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, mliks, water and bread. 

Maria opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200. Maria is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy garlic, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, mliks, water and bread

loans.name: Itagia

texts.en: Itagia is a 42-year-old mother with 6 children who earns a living through a BBQ business in her community. Itagia has requested a loan to buy ingredients to help her supply her business and increase her profits. She became a member of SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy sausage, chicken, mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, and tomato sauce.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Jennifer works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.  Jennifer is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to  buy additional stocks to sell, like soap, spices, noodles, chips, and bread for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Jennifer has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, like soap, coffee, eggs, milk, and spices.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice farming business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase a new rice variety to plant. Beverly has been in this business for eleven years. She earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Beverly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new rice variety to plant.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is a married woman with one child, who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Belinda is 36 years old.

Belinda has a charcoal vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Belinda has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Erika Cristina

texts.es:
Erika una hermosa campesina de 23 años de edad, madre cabeza de familia de un hijo de 5 años de edad, es madre soltera porque se separó de su esposo algo increíble a tan corta edad.
Esta trabajadora y luchadora mujer se dedica al negocio de comercio de leche un negocio que ha ido decayendo por el bajo costo que tiene le litro de este delicioso líquido.
Erika tiene la dicha de trabajar en un hermoso paraíso verde, un territorio poco explorado y en donde junto con sus lejanos vecinos trabajan para mantenerlo en esas condiciones.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de dos vacas lecheras para aumentar su producción y poder mantener las cuentas de su hogar, a esta cliente vale la pena prestarle pues refleja el amor que tiene por los animales solo pro la foto viendo el estado de la vaca, limpia y gordita.
texts.en:
Erika is a beautiful 23-year-old farmer. She is a mother and the head of her family, which consists of one child who is 5 years old. She is a single mother because she is separated from her husband, which is hard to believe at such a young age. This hardworking and determined woman earns her living selling milk, a business that has been in decline because of the low price per liter of this delicious liquid. 

Erika has the good fortune to work in a beautiful green paradise, a little-explored territory where she and her distant neighbors work to keep it the way it is.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of two milk cows to increase her production in order to keep up with her household bills. This client is worth lending to; the love she has for these animals is apparent just buy seeing the clean, plump condition of the cow in the photo.

loans.use: to buy two milk cows to make up for the low price of milk that is being imposed on her

loans.name: Luu's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Lưu, born in 1963, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family consists of four members, including her husband, her elder daughter, her son and herself. Her family is in the Mai Sơn district, Sơn La province. Her daughter is married and lives separately, and the young son is studying at one university. Her family’s main income is from her meager monthly salary. It is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and save a little amount, but that amount is not enough to pay for her son’s education fees and invest in her son’s education. Therefore, she wants to borrow money for this purpose. She hopes the loan will help her son have good conditions for studying. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan to M7 Microfinance Institution on time.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s education fees

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira es una mujer de 48 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos de 25, 20 y 17 años, y su negocio es la pesca.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Llanquichapi’; caracterizado por su cercanía al lago sagrado Titicaca, área agrícola dónde se cría ganado; vacuno, ovino y camélido, se vive de la pesca y también de cereales y vegetales del lugar, como la quinua, el chuño, la haba, la papa, etc. caracterizada por el clima frío, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 1-12 grados centígrados y donde los rayos solares golpean con mucha fuerza la superficie.
Elvira es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo trenzado, su vestimenta es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se encarga de la agricultura, y su hijo menor que estudia en la escuela, los hijos mayores son independientes, viven en una casa construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con los servicios de electricidad y agua de pozo. Su negocio es la pesca en bote con red; La pesca del lago Titicaca es uno de los artes de pesca más bonitos, artesanos, y respetuosos con el lago y los fondos marinos que existen, ya que este arte de pesca consiste en arrojar al lago una línea de red, que suele ser desde 30 metros de largo. Al dejar caer la red en el fondo, y dejarla allí un día a modo de trampa, y luego simplemente recogerla, hace que no arrastre y destruya los fondos marinos, y solo queden atrapadas piezas del tamaño que se busca según grosor de red, y pescar solo las variedades que se quieren, “la pesca en el lago Titicaca es sumamente tranquila, el frío del lugar congela todo a su alrededor, debemos tener bastante paciencia en el trabajo diario…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una pescadería. Ella desea realizar la compra de un bote de pesca porque el que tiene esta viejo y no brinda las condiciones de seguridad necesarias. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 22 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Elvira solicita un préstamo para la compra de un bote de pesca para pescar con mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Elvira is a 48-year-old woman, married, who has three children, ages 25, 20 and 17, and her business is fishing.

She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, dependable, responsible, and hard-working. Her business is in the locality of ‘Llanquichapi,’ characterized by is closeness to the sacred Lake Titicaca, an agricultural region where they raise livestock -- cattle, sheep and camelid -- and make their living fishing and also with grains and vegetables from the place, such as quinoa, freeze-dried potatoes, broad beans, potatoes, etc. It is characterized by its cold climate, with a temperature that varies during the day between 1-12 degrees centigrade and where the sun's rays hit the surface with a lot of force. 

Elvira has tanned skin, is short, has long black hair she keeps braided, she dresses traditionally (hat, blanket and pollera [traditional Andean skirt]), her native language is Aymará and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the business she does. She shares her live with her husband, who works in agriculture, and her younger child, who goes to school -- the older children are independent, they live in an adobe house with a corrugated iron roof that has electricity and well water.  Her business is fishing in a boat with a net. Fishing in Lake Titicaca is one of ways of fishing that is the most beautiful, traditional, and respectful of the lake and the lake bed, since the method of fishing is tossing a net line, which tends to be from 30 meters in length, into the lake. After letting the net fall to the depths and leaving it there for a day as a trap, and later simply collecting it, means it doesn't drag and destroy the lake bed, and only traps things of the size that is sought, according to the size of the net, and only fish the varieties that are wanted. "The fish in Lake Titicaca are extremely tranquil, the coldness of the place freezes everything in its surroundings, we need to be fairly patient in our daily work..." she says. Her dream is to have a fish market. She wants to purchase a fishing boat because the one she has is old and it doesn't provide the safety conditions she needs. This is her second loan cycle with the institution in the 22 years that she has been doing this work.

It is for these reasons that Elvira asks for a loan to purchase a fishing boat to fish with more security.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat to fish with more security.

loans.name: Los Portales De Pariachi Group

texts.es: El grupo “Los Portales De Pariachi” está conformado por 06 socios comprometidos y solidarios. Este es el caso de Yolanda de 27 años de edad es casada con 01 hijo dependiente.  Ella  se dedica a la venta de golosinas. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su negocio. Su mayor anhelo es contar con su propio local de venta. El crédito lo destinará para la compra de caramelos, chupetines y chicles. El grupo “Los Portales De Pariachi” agradece el crédito solicitado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Yolanda es la segunda del lado derecho y lleva en brazo a su bebe.
texts.en: The “Los Portales De Pariachi” group is made up of 6 committed and supportive members. This is the case with Yolanda, 27 years old, married, with 1 dependent child. She works selling candies. With a lot of effort, she has managed to improve her business. Her greatest desire is to have her own retail space. The loan will be used to purchase caramels, lollipops and gum. The "Los Portales De Pariachi" group is grateful for the loan they request and promise to continue working well. Yolanda is the second from the right and has her baby in her arms.

loans.use: to purchase caramels, lollipops, and gum.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is a 29-year-old, married woman and a mother of three children from Iloilo, Philippines. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store, selling various goods to the people in her community. Janette has been in the business for more than five years.

Janette is requesting a loan to buy more inventory to sell canned goods, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries, soft drinks and beverages, condiments, bread and biscuits. This loan will enable Janette to sell more products to her customers.

In the future, Janette hopes to make her business more successful. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries, soft drinks and beverages, condiments, bread and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. Edna has been in this business for 15 years. Edna earns additional income from selling vegetables.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF). She is borrowing 20,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Genita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Genita works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines and also earns income from food vending. Genita is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall. Genita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Loan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Loan, born in 1976, is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. She currently lives with her husband and her two children, one daughter and one son, in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her daughter has completed a vocational course and has a job. Her son has just also completed a vocational course, but still hasn’t got any job, so he is staying at home to assist his parents in their work.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding. Each year, the income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover daily food and living expenses, but the remaining amount she saved is not enough to invest in expanding the breeding. So, she wants to borrow a loan to raise additional geese and chickens for breeding to get more income for her family.

So, she expects much from the loan amount, which will help her family expand the livestock well, and she will work hard to get money to repay the loan from M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to raise additional geese and chickens for breeding.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Musa joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Joel, Aminu, and Jamilu.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Musa would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Musa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Musa spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
As the married parent of two children, Violeta works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from coconut farming. 

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF). Violeta is borrowing 13,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc., for her general store business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Prosperidad Y Responsabilidad Group

texts.es: Esta es la Alcancía “Prosperidad Y Responsabilidad” la cual está conformada por 06 socios optimistas y dinámicos. Patricia de 51 años de edad es separada con 01 hijo independiente. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de manualidades. Gracias a su constancia a logrado mejorar su negocio lo cual le ha permitido tener una mejor calidad de vida. El crédito que solicitó lo invertirá para la compra de hilo, tijera y botón. El anhelo de Patricia es mejorar su local para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. El grupo “Prosperidad  y Responsabilidad” agradecen por la ayuda brindada. Patricia se encuentra de pie y es la segunda del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
This is Prosperidad y Responsabilidad Communal Bank, made up of six optimistic and dynamic members.

Patricia, 51, is separated and has an adult child.  She earns a living making handmade crafts.  Thanks to her persistence she has managed to improve her business, which has given her a better quality of life.

Patricia's going to invest the loan she requested in buying thread, scissors, and buttons.  She wants to improve her retail space so she can provide better customer service.

Prosperidad y Responsabilidad Group is grateful for the help offered.  Patricia is standing and is the second person on the left.

loans.use: to buy thread, scissors, and buttons

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 41 years old. She is married to George and together they have been blessed with three children of 21, 18, and 14 years respectively. George provides additional income for his family.

Joan is a small scale business lady, earning a monthly income of KES 25,000. She sells fruits and vegetables, a business she has done for the last 15 years.

Joan has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 30,000 which she will use to purchase additional fruits and vegetables as stock.

With the anticipated profits, Joan will be able to start another business in order to increase her source of income as well as repay her loan.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a better life.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits and vegetables as stock

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en: Marhabo is 40 years old. She is married and has two children. Marhabo’s working day usually begins early in the morning when she goes to the local market and opens her store. She has been busy with buying and selling candies and biscuits for more than 10 years. She began this business because she needed the source of income. Marhabo’s husband helps her with managing the business, and they work hard to earn a living. Marhabo is going to increase working capital in this way to maximize profit. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 Somoni to buy candies and biscuits. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy candies and biscuits for increasing working capital.
