loans.name: Antony Frank

texts.es:
Antony tiene 36 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su esposa e hijos en casa propia en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Las actividades económicas principales que se desarrollan en este distrito son la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como cuyes, gallinas y patos, cuenta con más de 5 años de antiguedad en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Solicita el presente préstamo para la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de sus animales y para realizar reparaciones y ampliar el lugar donde los cría. De esta manera Antony espera hacer crecer más su negocio, lo que le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos y podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Antony is 36 years old, partnered, and lives with his partner and children in his own house in a small community in the rural zone of Cayaltí district, located in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. The principal economic activities in this district are agriculture, animal husbandry and commerce.

He works raising and selling small animals such as guinea pigs, hens, and ducks, His business is more than 5 years old and he has very good personal and work references in the zone. He asks for this loan to purchase balanced feed to fatten his animals, and to do some repairs and expansion of the place where he raises them. In this way, Antony hopes to grow his business more, which will allow him to get more income and be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed to fatten his animals and to do some repairs and expansion to the place where he raises them.

loans.name: Luis Eliseo

texts.es: Luis tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida, dos hijos de 10 años, 16 años y una hija de 13 años de edad. Luis se dedica a la venta de refrescos y tortas de jamón desde hace mucho tiempo. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus ventas e ingresos ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio en la compra de insumos como: panes, verduras, frutas, azúcar, etc. Espera poder contar con este apoyo y de esta forma poder aumentar sus ventas e ingresos.
texts.en: Luis is 35 years old and lives in his own house with his life partner, two sons, ages 10 and 16, and a daughter, age 13. Luis has worked selling drinks and ham sandwiches for a long time. He makes his sales as a street vendor and it is in this way that he brings sustenance to his household.  With the desire to improve his sales and income, he has decided to ask FUSAI for this loan to invest in his business in the purchase of supplies such as bread, vegetables, fruit, sugar, etc. He hopes to be able to have this support and in this way be able to increase his sales and income.

loans.use: to purchase bread, vegetables, fruit, sugar, etc. to make and sell drinks and ham sandwiches.

loans.name: Nanet

texts.en:
Nanet is 45 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Nanet is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nanet has been farming rice for 14 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Marta

texts.es: Este es el tercer préstamo que Doña Rosa obtiene con MiCrédito-Kiva, los anteriores le han sido de mucha ayuda en la venta de quesillo ya que ha logrado comprar los insumos para realizar los quesillos en mayor cantidad. Solicita el nuevo crédito para comprar quesillo, vinagre, cebolla y una mesita de madera para colocar la venta. Además de ella le apoyan tres vendedoras más para surtir la amplia demanda de sus clientes. Después de cancelar el préstamo desea obtener otro préstamo para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: This is the third loan that Rosa has gotten with MiCrédito-Kiva. The previous ones have been a great help in her sale of farmer's cheese since she has managed to purchase the supplies to make the quesillo [farmer's cheese] in greater quantity. She asks for another loan to purchase quesillo [farmer's cheese], vinegar, onion, and a small wood table on which to place the items for sale. In addition to her, three other saleswomen support her to supply her customers'  wide demand. After paying off the loan, she hopes to get another loan to improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase quesillo [farmer's cheese], vinegar, onion, and a small wood table on which to place the items for sale.

loans.name: Enma

texts.es: Con la ayuda económica que fue financiada por la cooperativa COMIXMUL en alianza con los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de KIVA doña Enma pudo comprar los diferentes insumos como: nutricafe, abono 18-46-0 y abono foliar los cuales fueron aplicados a sus cultivos de café para obtener una excelente cosecha con la cual pudo cancelar su compromiso de manera satisfactoria. Doña Enma actualmente solicita su segundo financiamiento el cual invertirá en sus cultivos de café nuevamente comprando fertilizantes y otra parte para el pago de mano de obra calificada para asistir sus cultivos de café. Doña Enma espera en esta nueva ocasión ser apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de Kiva pues esta clase de financiamientos dan oportunidad al pequeño productor de crecer y salir adelante con sus planes, metas y esperanzas a alcanzar.
texts.en:
With the economic help that was financed through the COMIXMUL cooperative along with the KIVA investors, Enma could buy different supplies such as: Nutricafe fertilizer, fertilizer 18-46-0, and manure which were applied to her coffee crops in order to obtain an excellent harvest with which she could pay her debt in a satisfactory manner.

Today Enma seeks a second loan which will be invested again in her coffee crops, buying fertilizer and also to pay for the qualified labor to assist with the coffee crops. Enma hopes in this new occasion to be supported by various Kiva investors as this financing gives opportunity to the small producer to grow and be successful with her plans, goals, and hopes to achieve success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor to assist with the coffee crop in this new season.

loans.name: Loan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Loan was born in 1960 and is a Kinh ethnic woman, one of whom has been joining the program of M7-MFI since August 2013. She lives with her husband and her only daughter in Mai Son District, Son La Province, Vietnam. Her daughter is studying at a junior high school.

Her family lives mainly on her meager salary, and the income is just enough to buy foods for the whole family. Because she has to be responsible for covering all living costs, feeding her daughter, and paying for her daughter’s education fees at the same time, she doesn’t have enough money to invest in her daughter’s education. That is the reason why she wants to borrow a loan to pay and invest in her daughter’s education.

She will work hard to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes the amount of the loan can help her daughter have better conditions for studying in order to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay and invest in her daughter’s education

loans.name: Liliana Del Socorro

texts.es: Son pocas las tiendas de venta de productos de la canasta familiar que se observan en el sector rural, la razón es que normalmente un campesino cultiva su propio alimento, pero porque una tienda Liliana que es la poseedora de una de estas en el sector del Carmen de Vivoral argumenta que muchos de los productos como los de aseo personal, medicamentos, y ciertos alimentos no son producidos y para obtenerlos tienen que realizar largos recorridos por ello Liliana solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de la canasta familiar, productos de aseo y algunos medicamentos básicos para que sus vecinos tengan un acceso más fácil a ellos.
texts.en: Few shops selling everyday household products can be seen in the rural areas. The reason is that a farmer normally grows his own food, but Liliana—who is the owner of one of these shops in the Carmen de Vivoral area—argues that many personal hygiene products, medications, and some foods are not produced and so people have to make long trips to obtain them. For that reason, Liliana is requesting a loan for the purchase of an assortment of everyday household products so that her neighbors will have easier access to them.

loans.use: to stock her shop where she sells everyday household products that are scarce in the rural areas

loans.name: Saini

texts.en: Saini is a 34-year-old woman with one child. She owns and operates a small business of selling elei printing materials at the market, to earn a living. Saini has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine, to assist her in running the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. Saini hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Erdenetsetseg, 38 years old, lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband have been selling all kinds of fruit to local people since 2010. Their daughter goes to primary school. She is requesting a loan of 3,0000,00 MNT to buy fruit in large amounts for the New Year holiday. During the New Year, the demand for fruits increases drastically, so it is essential to stock up her store.

loans.use: to buy fruits in large amounts

loans.name: Fesouaina

texts.en:
Fesouaina is a 22-year-old mother with one child; she runs a small business of selling taro and bananas in her community to earn a living. 

Fesouaina has requested a loan to buy taro roots, banana tube, wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank and hand gloves to help her run the business. 

She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy taro roots, banana tube, wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank and hand gloves

loans.name: Antonio Samuel

texts.es: Antonio es un hombre de 29 años de edad que vive con su compañera de vida y su hija de 5 años de edad. Él es un hombre responsable que ante la falta de un trabajo formal decidió dedicarse a vender bebidas frías en una terminal de autobuses, por lo que su negocio es muy rentable. Antonio desea invertir en su negocio, ya que actualmente compra los productos en cantidades pequeñas y al comprar por mayor sus ganancias mejorarían, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: bebidas frías para continuar mejorando sus ventas y así darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Antonio is a 29-year-old man who lives with his life partner and their 5-year-old daughter. He is a responsible man who, confronted with the lack of formal employment, decided to work selling cold drinks in a bus station, since it is a very profitable business. Antonio wants to invest in his business, since he currently purchases his products in small quantities and purchasing them in bulk, his earnings would increase, so he asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in cold drinks to continue improving his sales and in this way give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in cold drinks to continue improving his sales and in this way provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.name: Jessica Elizabeth

texts.es: Jessica de 27 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su tía desde hace muchos años. Jessica es una joven que siempre busca la manera de salir adelante apoyada en la venta de diferentes producto ofrece a sus clientes, aunque actualmente solo cuenta con sandalias por no contar con liquidez económica, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: sandalias, zapatos, carteras y cosméticos para ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes y aprovechar esta época navideña en la que espera que las ventas sean mejores y obtener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Jessica is 27 years old and has lived in her own home with her aunt for many years. Jessica is a young woman who always seeks a way to be successful, supported with her sales of different products she offers her customers, even though today she only has sandals as she doesn't have enough cash. That is why she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to buy sandals, shoes, wallets, and cosmetics in order to offer a greater variety of products to her customers and take advantage of this Christmas season in the hope that her sales will be better and she will obtain greater income.

loans.use: to buy sandals, shoes, wallets, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a fish vendor from Iloilo, Philippines. She is 56 years old, married, and has five grown children. Ruth has sold fish for more than 5 years. This is the source of her income.

Ruth is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell. Ruth believes that this loan will help her improve her business as well as her income. In the future, Ruth hopes to make her fish vending business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel tiene 42 años de edad, vive en casa alquilada, separado de su cónyuge, cuenta con dos hijos los cuales cursan secundaria. Angel Cuenta con buenas referencias laborales y personales, contando con servicios de agua y luz. Él vive 32 años en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que realiza Angel es realizar trabajos como maestro de obra en construcción civil, sus actividades las realiza en el distrito y caserios aledaños. El destino del crédito será para invertir en compra de madera y compra de una mototaxi, lo que le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Angel is 42 years old, lives in a rented house, is separated from his spouse, and has two children who are in secondary school. Angel has good work and personal references, and has water and electricity services. He has lived for 32 years in Pucará district, Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Perú. His community works basically in agriculture, animal husbandry and trade. 

The work Angel does is working as a foreman in civil construction. He does his work in the district and nearby villages. The destination of the loan will be to purchase wood and to purchase a motorcycle taxi, which will generate more income and, in this way, will be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing wood and purchasing a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling oysters in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of seafood to sell to customers.

Ofelia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Ofelia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of seafood to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Esthela

texts.es: Blanca es una señora  trabajadora, ella tiene 4 hijos que ya son mayores de edad, Blanca se  dedica a la venta de productos de tienda, comenta que es asi como logra obtener sus ingresos para sus necesidades diarias,  Blanca va a invertir el crédito en la compra de toda clase de confites para ofrecerlos en su tienda, ella aspira de este negocio mejorarlo, readecuarlo  tener mas clientela para seguir trabajando para su bienestar.
texts.en:
Blanca is a hardworking lady with four grown children. Blanca has a general store, and she says that this is how she manages to obtain the income to  cover her daily necessities. 

Blanca is going to invest the loan in the purchase of all kinds of candies, in order to offer them in her store.  She aspires to improve and refurbish her business, and have more customers, in order to continue working for her wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase candy.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 59 years old and married with thirteen children. She works hard to provide for her family and has run a general store for 37 years, also earning income from food vending.

She requests a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like eggs, canned goods, beverages, etc.

Lilia has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF and aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Shitu

texts.en: Shitu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Shitu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Kenet, Wisdom and Salamatu.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Shitu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Shitu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Shitu  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Oliva Del Rosario

texts.es: Oliva es una señora de 36 años de edad, es madre soltera, se dedica a la ganadería ya que cuenta que tiene vacas lecheras y por medio del ordeño y venta de leche es como  obtiene sus ingresos para darles la educación a sus hijos, ella tiene 3 hijos menores de edad que se encuentran estudiando, Oliva  necesita el crédito para compra una vaca y asi lograr mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en: Oliva is 36 years old, a single mother, who works raising animals and says that she has dairy cows and milking them and selling the milk is how she gets income to provide an education for her children. She has three minor children who are students. Oliva needs the loan to purchase a cow and in this way managed to improve her children's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya works hard to support her family. Ligaya is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Ligaya has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Ligaya would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. Gloria is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Gloria requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her stall.

Gloria has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her stall

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 42-year-old man, divorced with three children, all of whom go to school. He is a first time borrower from Ugafode Microfinance Ltd and a resident of Zana, a city surburb. 

He intends to take a loan of UGX 5,000,000 to buy more stock of silver fish for the trade business located near the lake shores near Congo. Charles has been in this business for over ten years and it has paid off since he has a ready market for both consumers and traders. He is so grateful for the support given to him as a low income earner.  

His future plan is to venture into export trade as he already has market in southern Sudan and Congo. He is hard working.

loans.use: To buy silver fish for sell

loans.name: Kimpov

texts.en:
Kimpov is a 28-year-old married secondary school teacher with a child. He lives in Siem Reap province of Cambodia. So far he has been a teacher for over five years. He is also a third-year university student who is studying educational science. His wife is a 30-year-old teacher. Both of them can earn approximately $14 a day. 

Now Kimpov would like to request a loan to pay his tuition fees for two years. With this loan, he will be able to earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. 

In the future, he wants to be a lecturer and build a bigger house. He will also support his child to earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Junalyn

texts.en: Junalyn is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Iloilo, Philippines. She is engaged in retail sales of dried fish. This has been the source of her income for several years now. Junalyn is standing next to bamboo baskets, which she uses to store dried fish. Junalyn is asking for a loan to buy more dried fish to sell. In the future, Junalyn hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Sara María

texts.es: Sara es una microempresaria emprendedora que tiene la edad de 33 años, casada, y quien se dedica a la comercialización de tanques de gas y pollo por libra, esto en su domicilio desde hace tres años, es el segundo que solicita en ADIM el financiamiento para su negocio, e invertir en tanques de gas de 10 libras, de 25 libras, pechuga especial, piernas de pollo, pechuga con ala etc., esto le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y así seguir aportando a los gastos familiares.
texts.en: Sara is an enterprising microentrepreneur who is 33 years old, married, and who works selling gas tanks and chicken by the pound. She has done this from her home for three years. It is the second loan she has requested from ADIM for her business, she will invest in gas tanks of 10 pounds and 25 pounds, special breast meat, chicken legs, breasts with wings, etc. This will allow her to improve her income and in this way continue supporting the family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase gas tanks and chicken since these are the products that have daily demand.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Iloilo, Philippines. She has been engaged in dried fish vending for more than 16 years now. Jean is asking for a loan to buy more dried fish. This loan will enable her to improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Jean hopes to make her business a success and sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish

loans.name: Mafuli

texts.en:
Mafuli is 51 years old with 3 children.

She owns and operates a small business cooking and selling BBQ in her community to earn a living. She has requested a loan to buy a box of chicken, a box of sausage, mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, banana, and a sack of rice to help her run the business. 

She hopes to build a small restaurant in the near future using her business profit. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, a box of sausage, mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, banana, and a sack of rice

loans.name: Uanita

texts.en: Uanita is a 36-year-old mother with six children. To earn a living, she operates a small business of providing services to people by transportation. She has been doing this for two years. Uanita has requested a loan to buy a seat cover, painting, new windows, new wheels to help her maintain good services. Uanita hopes to use her profit to buy another taxi and provide for family needs. She joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a seat cover, painting, new windows, new wheels

loans.name: Ma. Brenda

texts.en:
Ma. Brenda is 35 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child in school.

Ma. Brenda is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Ma. Brenda has been farming rice for one year now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 40 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, coffee, soft drinks, etc.

Ailyn has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Ailyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, coffee, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 56 years old and has one child. She is a married woman.

Margarita is in the agricultural business raising goats in the Philippines. Margarita requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her goats.

She has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Margarita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her goats

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 59 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Marilyn has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Marilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell,  like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets. She has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Cristina would like to save money to expand her business and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en:
Shehu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Shehu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Zakariya and Nuhu.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Shehu would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Shehu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Shehu spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Saratu Habila

texts.en: Saratu Habila is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Saratu Habila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children Yakubu, Ayuba and Irimiya.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Saratu Habila would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Saratu Habila can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Saratu Habila spoke of her  ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Bovy

texts.en:
Bovy is a 30-year-old married mathematics teacher with a child who lives in Siem Reap province of Cambodia. She has taught mathematics since 2009. She is also a third-year university student who is studying educational science. Her husband is a 28-year-old teacher. Both of them can earn approximately $14 a day. 

Now, Bovy would like to request a loan to pay her tuition fees for two years. With the loan, she will earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. In the future, she wants to be a lecturer. She will also help her child to earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Rosa Morena

texts.es: Rosa de 39 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 3 hijos una niña de 13 años y dos varones de 15 y 11 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que ha logrado sostener a sus hijos con el apoyo de su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir para dama y caballero, actividad que realiza desde hace 14 años por lo que ya tiene una clientela que siempre busca de sus productos. Rosa desea tener mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecer a su clientela, ya que sabe que en época de navidad siempre las ventas son mejores, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: prendas de vestir para dama y caballero y ropa interior para tener una mayor variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: Rosa, 39 years old, is a single mother and lives in her own house with her 3 children, a 13-year-old girl and two boys ages 15 and 11. She is an enterprising woman who has managed to support her children with the help of her business selling clothing for women and men, work that she has been doing for 14 years, so she has a customer base which always looks for her products. Rosa wants to have a larger quantity of products to offer her customers, since she knows that in the Christmas season, sales are always better. For this reason, she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in clothing for women and men and lingerie to have a larger variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to invest in women's and men's clothing and lingerie.

loans.name: Volver A Empezar Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VOVER A EMPEZAR” iniciará el décimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julieta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de masitas, venta de maniquís, venta de ropa, venta de abarrotes, venta de fruta, venta de sombreros y gorras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julieta es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, aprendiendo el mismo de su madre quien tiene un negocio similar al suyo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de horno, fideo y papa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “VOVER A EMPEZAR” communal bank group will begin its fourteenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Collpani. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of which Julieta is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied and among them are food sales, pastry sales, mannequin sales, clothing sales, grocery sales, fruit sales, and hat sales. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small micro-businessowners of whom Julieta is one. She says that she began working with Pro Mujer two years ago, joining at the invitation of a worker from the institution who went to visit her in her home. Currently, she has a business selling food. She says that she undertook this business several years ago, learning it from her mother who has a business which is similar to hers. 

The loan that she is taking out is to increase her capital (purchase an oven, noodles, and potatoes in bulk) that she will get from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz and will then, after preparing them, sell them in her sales stall. This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family economically, since she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the loans that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase an oven, noodles and potatoes in bulk.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is a 61-year-old married woman and a mother of five grown children, from Iloilo, Philippines. Lorna has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 19 years now.  Fishing is their main source of living. Lorna is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like nets, hooks, lead weights and floaters. With a loan, Lorna and her husband will be able to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Lorna hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like nets, hooks, lead weights and floaters

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita is a dried fish vendor from Iloilo, Philippines. She is married and has two grown children. Juanita has been selling dried fish for more than four years now. Juanita is standing next to a basket full of dried fish. She also makes additional income through her hog raising business. Juanita is asking to take a loan to buy more dried fish to sell and additional piglets to raise. In the future, Juanita hopes to expand her business in order to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Erilyn

texts.en:
Erilyn is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Iloilo, Philippines. She earns a living through her retail sales of dried fish. Erilyn has been in the business for almost 10 years now. 

Erilyn is asking to take a loan to buy more dried fish. This loan will enable Erilyn to improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Erilyn has hopes of making her business more successful and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros is a 59-year-old widow from Ajuy, Iloilo. She has a 22-year-old daughter. Milagros runs a small sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. This has been the source of her income for more than 20 years now. Milagros is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, bread and snack foods. This loan will enable her to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Milagros hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, bread and snack foods

loans.name: Desideria

texts.en:
Desideria is managing her eatery business in Pagadian. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and will also accept catering for added income. 

Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be more than happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 38 years old and lives in Balangasan District, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with four children. Ivy has a bakery business and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase flour, margarine and baking soda for her bakery. Ivy has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase flour, margarine and baking soda for her bakery

location.town: Pagadian - Balangasan District,  Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Maikudi

texts.en:
Maikudi is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his daughter, Grace.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Maikudi would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest in order to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Maikudi can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Maikudi spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his daughter, as well as of his eventual hopes of becoming the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, and thus eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices right after harvest.

loans.name: Juena

texts.en:
Juena works hard to support her family. Juena is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Juena has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Juena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La señora Ana tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y tiene 6 hijos para solo 4 viven con ella y son 2 los que están estudiando, ella juntamente  con su esposo se dedican al trabajo del jornal y a sembrar pequeños huertos de  papas, habas, maíz y demás productos que son propios de su provincia, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono y fungicidas para sus cultivos, mismos de los que espera sacar unas buenas cosechas y asi tener para los gastos de su hogar  y seguir adelante con sus cultivos.
texts.en: Ana is 48, married, and has six children.  Only four of them live with her, and two are in school.  She and her husband earn their living as day laborers and planting a small garden of potatoes, beans, corn and other crops typical of their province.  Ana will invest her loan in the purchase of fertilizer and fungicides for her crops.  She hopes to get a good harvest so she can pay for household expenses and continue to succeed with her crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Darwin Hermogenes

texts.es: Darwin es un joven tranquilo, esta casado y tiene 34 años de edad, su hijos tiene 12 años y esta estudiando, Darwin comenta que la vida en el campo es dura ya que el diariamente se levanta  junto a su esposa  a las 4 de la mañana para ir a ordeñar sus vacas y de ahí a las 7 se traslada a trabajar al jornal y a las 4 de la tarde nuevamente se va a ordeñar a sus vacas terminando esta actividad a la 6 de tarde, esta es su rutina diaria, entonces el crédito lo necesita para compra una vaca y tenerla n un terrenito, de este negocio Darwin espera seguir siendo responsable con su familia.
texts.en: Darwin is a serene young man.  He's 34, married, and has a 12-year-old who is still in school.  He says that life on the farm is hard; every day he and his wife get up at 4 in the morning to milk the cows.  Then at 7 they're on to their day's work and at 4 in the afternoon they milk the cows again, finishing up at 6.  This is their daily routine.  The loan Darwin needs is to buy a cow and provide it a little piece of land.  He hopes that with the business he can keep looking after his family.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is 36 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising cattle in the Philippines, and she is borrowing PHP 7,500 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her cattle. She has been in this business for 2 years now, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her cattle

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer de 55 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos de 35 y 28 años, y su negocio es la agricultura.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Batallas’; caracterizado por su cercanía al lago sagrado Titicaca, área agrícola dónde se cría ganado; vacuno, ovino y camélido, se vive de la pesca y también de cereales y vegetales del lugar, como la quinua, el chuño, la haba, la papa, etc. caracterizada por el clima frío, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 1-12 grados centígrados y donde los rayos solares golpean con mucha fuerza la superficie.
Martha es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo trenzado, su vestimenta es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se encarga de la producción de queso, los hijos son independientes, viven en una casa construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con los servicios de electricidad y agua de pozo. Su negocio es la agricultura, siembra papa y hortalizas. “Además de sembrar todo tipo de hortalizas, me dedico a la producción de leche para la elaboración de queso…” comenta.  Su sueño es tener mayor cantidad de tierras para sembrar. Ella desea realizar la compra de semillas para sembrar papa y hortalizas. Esta es su 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 30 años que viene realizando esta actividad de manera independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Martha solicita un préstamo para la compra de semillas para sembrar papa y hortalizas.
texts.en:
Martha is 55 years old, married, has two children ages 35 and 28, and her business is agriculture. 

She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, dependable, responsible and hard-working. Her business is in the locality of "Batallas", characterized by its closeness to the sacred Lake Titicaca, an agricultural area where they raise livestock -- cattle, sheep and camelid, and make their living from fishing and also from grains and vegetables of the region, such as quinoa, freeze-dried potatoes, broad beans, potatoes, etc.  It is characterized by a cold climate, with a temperature that varies during the day from 1-12 degrees centigrade and where the sun's rays hit the surface with a lot of strength. 

Martha has tanned skin, is short, has long black hear she wears braided, dresses traditionally (hat, blanket and pollera [traditional Andean skirt]), her native language is Aymará, and she speaks Spanish from the general culture and for the business she does. She shares her life with her husband, who takes care of cheese production. Her children are independent. They live in an adobe house with a corrugated iron roof that has electricity and well water. Her business is agriculture, she grows potatoes and vegetables. "In addition to growing all sorts of vegetables, I work producing milk to make cheese..." she says. Her dream is to have a larger quantity of land to plant. She wishes to purchase seeds to plant potatoes and vegetables. She is in her first loan cycle with the institution in the 30 years that she has been doing this work independently. 

For these reasons, Martha asks for a loan to purchase seeds to plant potatoes and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to plant potatoes and vegetables.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo is a dried fish vendor from Ajuy, Iloilo, Philippines. He is 64 years old, married and has two dependents. Ricardo has been in the business for more than 22 years now. This is the source of his income. Ricardo is standing next to baskets and boxes of dried fish ready for delivery to his customers. Ricardo is asking for a loan to buy more dried fish. This loan will allow him to improve his stock, thus giving him the chance to sell more dried fish to his customers. In the future, Ricardo hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Maria works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell cultured pearl business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Maria is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her buy and sell cultured pearl business.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es: Gracias a su primer financiamiento Doña Cruz compro los insumos y abonos necesarios con los que pudo asistir su propiedad de café la cual pudo proteger de plagas, enfermedades entre otros que pudieron de no tratarse a tiempo dañar la planta y el grano. Ella agradece el apoyo brindado por los inversionistas en KIVA y la cooperativa COMIXMUL ya que gracias al apoyo financiero sus cultivos no se perdieron. Gracias a su primer financiamiento logro comprar 7 quintales de abono, 15 sacos de abono nitrato y el pago de mano de obra para poder asistir un poco más rápido su cultivo. En la actualidad Doña Cruz solicita un segundo financiamiento con el cual comprara nuevamente insumos agrícolas los cuales ayudaran a volver a dar protección a sus cultivos los cuales después de la corta quedaron un poco maltratados por lo que espera ser nuevamente apoyada con dichos fondos para poder estar más tranquila ya que es necesario para la temporada entrante.
texts.en:
Thanks to her first loan Cruz bought supplies and fertilizers necessary with which she could help her coffee crop, protecting it from plagues, infirmities, and other things that with treatment were not able to damage the plant or the grain. She is thankful to for the provided support form the Kiva investors and the COMIXMUL cooperative as thanks to their financial support she didn't lose her crops. Thanks to her first loan she was able to purchase 7 quintales of manure, 15 sacks of nitrate fertilizer, and pay for the labor to assist in speeding up the harvest.

Today Cruz seeks a second loan with which she will again buy farming supplies which will help her give protection to her crops which after cutting are left a bit damaged so she hopes again to be supported with funds to be able to be more tranquil because it is necessary to treat the plants for the upcoming season.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Nhóm 6 - Kim Định 01 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lanh, pictured first on the right in the first row, is 39 years old and working in agricultural production with a monthly income of VND 600,000. She has two children who are currently in high school. Her family does not have a hygienic toilet. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1997.  

With this loan, Lanh will build a sanitary toilet that will help to improve the living conditions and the health of family members.

Trong ảnh, chị Lành đứng giữa hàng đầu tiên.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Nhóm 2 - Kim Định 01 Group

texts.en:
Lan, pictured first on the left in the first row, is a 32-year-old farmer and makes VND 600,000 monthly, supporting her two children who are still in school. 

She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 2004. 

Currently, her family does not have a sanitary toilet. A portion of Group 2 - Kim Dinh 01's loan will help Lan, as well as other group members, to build a septic tank and a hand-washing device with soap to improve living conditions, improve the health of families throughout her community, and help protect the environment.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Jesenia Elizabeth

texts.es: Jesenia es una joven de 22 años de edad, le gusta mucho su negocio que es la venta de ropa, ya que es así como se apoya en los gastos para su educación  que en la actualidad esta en proceso de ingresar a la universidad, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería en ropa  para seguir ofreciendo a sus amigas y atraer mas clientela y que sus ganancias le  permitan pagar sus estudios.
texts.en: Jesenia is a young woman of 22.  She really likes her business selling clothing because it helps pay for her education.  She's currently in the process of getting in to the university.  She'll invest the loan in the purchase of clothing merchandise so she can continue to make sales to her friends and attract more clientele.  The profits will allow her to pay for school.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Nhóm 13 - Kim Định 01 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Tham, 48, works in agricultural production that earns VND 600,000 monthly. She is supporting three children who are still in school. Currently, her family does not have access to a hygienic and sanitary toilet facility. Like other group members of Group 13 - Kim Dinh 01, Tham will use the loan to build a sanitary toilet. This will help to improve her family living conditions and contribute to environmental protection. In the picture, she stands in the front row, first from the right.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap

loans.name: Esmeralda Del Carmen

texts.es: Esmeralda de 27 años de edad es una mujer admirable que se esfuerza cada día para sostener a economía de su familia apoyada en su venta de prendas de vestir como: faldas, blusas, pantalones, camisas, etc. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos una niña de 2 años y un varón de 6 años de edad. Esmeralda desea invertir en su negocio ya que sabe que en apoca de navidad las ventas de prendas de vestir son mayores, por lo que desea tener una mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecer a su clientela, para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: faldas, blusas, pantalones, camisetas, ropa interior, etc.
texts.en: Esmeralda, 27 years old, is an admirable woman who works hard every day to sustain her family economy supported by her sale of clothing such as skirts, blouses, pants, shirts, etc. She lives in her own house with her two children, a 2-year-old girl and a 6-year-old boy. Esmeralda wants to invest in her business since she knows that in the Christmas season, the sales of clothing are greater.  For this reason, she wants to have a greater quantity of products to offer her customers, so she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in skirts, blouses, pants, shirts, lingerie, etc.

loans.use: to invest in skirts, blouses, pants, shirts, lingerie, etc.

loans.name: Lupeolefilemu

texts.en: Lupeolefilemu is a 42-year-old mother with six children. She runs a business selling taro and banana in her village. She has been doing this for more than two years to earn a living. Lupeolefilemu has requested a loan to buy taro roots, banana tube, wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves to assist with the business. She will expand her business in the future using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy taro roots, banana tube, wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, hand gloves

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel continuously manages her direct selling business. She sells fragrances, cosmetics, and ready to wear products. Maricel's husband is a government employee. 

Due to the constantly increasing demands of their children to finish their education, Maricel wishes to earn more and help her husband sustain their children's expenditures in school. With this in mind, Maricel is looking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy lipstick, make-up, fragrances, roll-ons, and clothes. She believes that the loan will help her satisfy her costumers by responding quickly and delivering to her customers' orders on time. 

By doing this, she anticipates having more customers buying her products. This will lead her to gain a higher income for the future of her children.

loans.use: to buy lipstick, make-up, fragrances, roll-ons, and clothes.

loans.name: Jemuel

texts.en: Jemuel is a snack food vendor from Iloilo, Philippines. He is 29 years old, married and has two children. Jemuel earns a living through selling snack foods like peanuts and others. He also runs a small sari-sari or variety store business. Jemuel is asking for a loan to buy more peanuts and more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries and others. With this loan, Jemuel hopes to make his business more successful and productive.  Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy more peanuts and more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap, toiletries and others

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia is a 63 year old widow with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lucrecia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Lucrecia requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like rice powder, sugar, milk, etc.

In the future, Lucrecia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like rice powder, sugar, milk, etc

loans.name: Luis Fabian

texts.es: Luis es un señor de 39 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos que se encuentran estudiando, el es casado y junto a  su esposa se dedican al jornal y a la crianza de animales, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de 2 terneras ya que comenta que las cría adecuadamente  y después las vende obteniendo algo de ganancia, esta es la manera como se ayuda en los gastos de educación y alimentación de sus hijos, Luis espera comprar mas terneros y seguir adelante en su negocio y ser un esposo y padre responsable como hasta ahora y de ser posible comprar una casa.
texts.en: Luis is a 39-year-old man, has 4 children who are students, is married and, along with his wife, works as a day laborer and raising animals. He will invest the loan in the purchase of two calves since he says he raises them adequately and then sells them getting some earnings. This is the way he helps with the costs of educating and feeding his children. Luis wants to purchase more calves and continue onward with his business and be a responsible husband and father as he has been and, if possible, purchase a house.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 56 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school. Elena works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

Elena has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future, Elena would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Anderson Javier

texts.es: Javier es un joven de 20 años de edad, vive con sus padres y se dedica a  trabajar de vendedor en un local de un amigo, también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, comenta que vive arrendando  y que ahí no  le permiten tener chanchos y por este motivo los chachos los tiene un una chanchera que le presta su abuelita, el credito lo necesita para comprar chanchos y de este negocio espera seguir trabajando de las ganancias que tengo desea  terminar de pagar de una motocicleta que tiene para trasladarse a su trabajo.
texts.en: Javier is a young man of 20 years.  He lives with his parents and works as a salesman in a friend's shop.  He also raises young animals.  He says he rents and they won't let him have pigs so he keeps his pigs in a pen his grandmother lets him use.  He needs the loan to buy pigs and hopes to keep working in the business.  He wants to use the loan to finish paying for the motorcycle he uses to get to his job.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Tauva

texts.en:
Tauva is a 32-year-old woman with four children. She owns and operates a small business in her community to earn a living. 

Tauva has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, a shovel, a rake, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves and safety boots to assist the business. She has been doing this for more than two years. Tauva will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, a shovel, a rake, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves and safety boots

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.es: María es una mujer trabajadora que a sus 46 años y casada, se esfuerza para seguir mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia, se dedica a la comercialización de pollo en pulperías y en su domicilio, este negocio lo impulsó hace más de diez años con ayuda de su esposo, ya que él trabaja en la Tip-Top y le facilitan el producto para que ella lo comercialice, de esta manera ella genera un ingreso y aporta a los gastos familiares, es el vigésimo tercer ciclo que solicita el financiamiento para su negocio y ha demostrado ser una mujer responsable con las fechas de pago de sus cuotas, este crédito lo solicita para la compra de muslos de pollo, pierna, pechuga especial, pechuga con ala, etc., ya que en esta temporada ha aumentado la demanda de estos productos y de esta manera se le ayudará a cubrir esta demanda.
texts.en:
María is a 46 year old hard-working, married woman. She strives to continue improving her family's living conditions. She sells chicken in convenience stores and in her home. She started this business 10 years ago with help from her husband, as he works in the Tip-Top and they can get product that she sells. In this way she generates income and supports her household expenses.

This is the 23rd financing cycle for her business and she has demonstrated to be a very responsible woman with the loan payments. She seeks this loan to buy chicken thighs, legs, breasts, breasts with wings, etc. because in this season demand has increased for these products and in this way she will be able to meet this demand.

loans.use: to buy chicken meat as it is the season where demand for this product increases.

loans.name: Lavaniu

texts.en: Lavaniu is a 34-year-old woman with four children. To earn a living, she owns and operates a small business of selling elei printing materials at the market. Lavaniu has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei design, containers, and a printing machine, to assist her in running the business. She has been doing this for more than five years. Lavaniu hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2003.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei design, containers, and a printing machine

loans.name: Rubenie

texts.en: Rubenie is a 30-year-old merchant from Iloilo, Philippines. He is married and has two children. Rubenie is a rice retailer and has been in the business for more than 10 years now. Rubenie is asking for a loan to buy more rice. This loan will enable him to improve his rice stock, thus allowing him to sell more to his customers. In the future, Rubenie hopes to make his business more profitable and stable. He also wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy more rice

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 56, married and manages a farming business for income. Her family lives in Enrile. Gloria also hires laborers who help them in the farming activities such as sowing, planting and harvesting rice to sell. Her income goes to daily expenses for meals, bills at home and education purposes. Another part of her income serves as revolving capital in the farming business. 

Gloria is now asking for additional capital of 20,000 PHP to be used in buying pesticides and insecticides for use in farming. This will help maintain good growth of crops and will someday achieve a plentiful harvest for the family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en: Lanie is 34 years old, married and had two children. Her family lives in Enrile and they manage a farming business for income. She wanted to improve her crop production; that is why she is now asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. This will help maintain good growth of crops. Good income will help send her children to school and achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn is a vegetable and fruit vendor from Ajuy, Iloilo. She is married and has two children. Merlyn has been in the business for more than 10 years now. Merlyn is asking for a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell. This loan will allow Merlyn to improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Merlyn hopes to make her business more successful and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money to pay for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 61 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock of household goods to sell.

Loreta has been in this business for eight years. 

In the future Loreta would like to save money to expand her business and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Dios Con Nosotros Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Dios con nosotros lo integran cuatro socios emprendedores que solicitan por primera vez en ADIM el financiamiento para sus negocios, quien lo coordina es el señor Fernando de 37 años de edad, acompañado y propietario de un taller de electricidad automotriz. Este negocio lo impulsó hace dieciocho años después de trabajar en un taller de automotriz, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de juego de herramientas básicas, cuatiles, prensadora, etc., esto le permitirá ofrecer un mejor servicio. El resto de las integrantes son las señoras Alba de 24 años de edad comerciante de ropa de segunda desde hace tres años, Gema quien tiene la edad de 29 años y comercializa cosméticos y ropa desde hace cinco años, y Patricia de 33 años de edad comerciante de ropa nueva desde hace cuatro años.
texts.en: The Dios con Nosotros group has four enterprising members who ask ADIM for a loan, for the first time, for their businesses. Fernando is the coordinator. He is 37 years old, partnered, and owns an automotive electrical shop. He undertook this business eighteen years ago after working in an automotive shop. The loan that he requests is to purchase a set of basic tools, soldering irons, a pressing tool, etc.  This will allow him to provide better service. The rest of the members are Alba, 24 years old, who has sold second-hand clothing for three years, Gema, 29 years old, who has sold cosmetics and clothing for the past five years, and Patricia, 33 years old, who has sold new clothing for the past four years.

loans.use: to purchase tools with the goal of offering quality services.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a carenderia or restaurant owner from Ajuy, Iloilo. She is married and has three grown-up children. Edna sells home-cooked foods in her store. This has been the source of her income for more than 11 years now. 

Edna is requesting to take a loan to buy more ingredients like meat, vegetables, rice, salt and condiments, soft drinks and others. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more to her customers. In the future, Edna has hopes of making her business more profitable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like meat, vegetables, rice, salt and condiments, soft drinks and others

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es: A sus 47 años de edad Jose esta casado y tiene 4 hijos mismos de los cuales 2 aun le acompañan y también una nieta, Jose se dedica  atrabajar al jornal de martes a viernes y a la venta de verduras se dedica  los sabados domingos y lunes ya que estos días son las ferias en las ciudades mas cercanas, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de hortalizas y  verduras para realizar sus ventas sea en el mercado o en los recorridos, de este negocio aspira seguir trabajando y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en: 47 year old Jose is married and has 4 children, two of whom still live at home, and also a granddaughter.  Jose works as a day laborer Tuesday through Friday and sells vegetables on Saturdays, Sundays, and Mondays as on those days there are markets in nearby cities. The loan will be used to buy vegetables and leafy green vegetables to sell in the market as well as a street vendor. Jose hopes to continue working and help his family get ahead.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Nema

texts.en: Nema is a rice retailer from Iloilo, Philippines. She is  married and has four children. Nema has been in the business for more than seven years now. Nema is asking to take a loan to buy more rice to sell. This loan will allow Nema to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, Nema has hopes of  making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter es un hombre de 24 años, soltero, tiene 1 hijo de 3 años, y su negocio es la producción de Queso artesanal.
Él es independiente, constante, autónomo, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘Chacalleta’ caracterizado por su cercanía al lago sagrado Titicaca, área agrícola dónde se cría ganado; vacuno, ovino y camélido, se vive de la pesca y también de vegetales del lugar, como la quinua, el chuño, la haba, la papa, etc. caracterizada por el clima frío, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 1-12 grados centígrados y donde los rayos solares golpean con mucha fuerza la superficie.
Walter es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres, que está construida de adobe y techo de paja, cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo. Su negocio es la producción de Queso artesanal. la variedad de quesos más producida y consumida en la zona, es el queso fresco, el quesillo, el queso doble crema, y el chaqueño, “mi trabajo lleva mucha pasión, realizamos todo el proceso de elaboración con materiales del lugar eso le da un sabor característico de la zona…” comenta. Su sueño es producir en mayor cantidad, el desea realizar la compra de ganado lechero para contar con más leche para su negocio. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene realizando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Walter solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero para aumentar su producción de quesos.
texts.en:
Walter is a 24-year-old single man. He has one 3-year-old child, and his business is the production of artisanal cheese.

He is independent, perseverant, autonomous, responsible, and hard working. He runs his business in the Chacalleta community, which is known for its proximity to sacred Lake Titicaca. It's an agricultural area where they raise livestock: cattle, sheep, and camelids. People live on fishing as well as on local vegetables, like quinoa, potato flour, broad beans, etc. The region is known for its cold climate, with daily temperatures that vary from 1 to 12 degrees Celsius, and the intense sunlight striking the surface.

Walter has brown skin, short black hair, and short stature. His mother tongue is Aymara, which is spoken locally, and he speaks Spanish because of the general culture. He lives his life in his parents' house, which is built of adobe and has a straw roof. It has electricity and well water.

His business is the production of artisanal cheese. The most produced and consumed varieties of cheese in the region are "queso fresco" [a soft, crumbly fresh cheese], "quesillo" [a palm-sized fresh cheese], double cream cheese, and "chaqueño" [a semi-hard, ripened cheese]. "My work is full of passion. We carry out the whole production process with local materials. This gives it the characteristic flavor of the area," he says.

His dream is to produce larger quantities. He wants to make the purchase of dairy cattle in order to have more milk for his business. This is his third loan cycle with the institution in the six years that he has been doing this activity independently. 

That is why Walter is requesting a loan for the purchase of dairy cattle in order to increase his cheese production.

loans.use: to buy milk cattle to increase his cheese production

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en: Nellie is a 42 year old mother with 5 children. She had a small business sewing clothes and sells them in her community to earn a living. Nellie has requested for a loan to buy rolling materials, needles, sewing machine, tape measurement to help her with the business. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. She will use her profit to expand her business. Nellie became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a rolling materials, needles, sewing machine, tape measurement

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia es una mujer 31 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijas de 3 y 5 años, y su negocio es la venta de papa.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ una comunidad campesina que agrupa a restaurantes que se especializan en comida típica y donde se elabora la ‘chicha’ (bebida fermentada de maíz), de clima cálido semitropical.
Celia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, su vestimenta es tradicional (pollera, manta y sombrero), su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general. Su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y con sus hijas que estudian en la escuela. Viven en una casa alquilada construida de adobe con techo de calamina, y cuenta con agua de pozo, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de papa como; papa liza, papa imilla, kalila y otras. “existen más de 50 variedades de papa, trato de variar mi oferta y tener de todo tipo de papas…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una casa propia. Ella desea realizar el techado de un cuarto para utilizarlo como depósito. Esta es su 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Celia solicita un préstamo para techar un cuarto y utilizarlo como depósito de papas.
texts.en:
Celia is a 31-year-old woman who lives with her partner.  She has 2 children who are 3 and 5.  She sells potatoes.  She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, persevering, responsible, and hardworking.  She works in the town of Sacaba, a rural community with a collection of restaurants that specialize in typical dishes and where they make chicha (a drink made of fermented corn).  The climate is warm subtropical.

Celia is dark-skinned with long black braided hair.  Her dress is typical (pleated skirt with shawl and sombrero).  Her native language is Quechua, which she speaks at home and she speaks Spanish in general.  She lives with her partner, who is in construction, and her children, who go to school.  They live in a rented house made of adobe with a corrugated iron roof, potable water, electricity, and sewer system.  Celia sells potatoes: olluco, imilla, and kalila varieties.  "There are more than fifty varieties of potatoes and I try to vary my offerings and have every type of potato," she says.  Her dream is to have a house of her own.  She wants to roof over a room to use as a warehouse.  This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the five years she's been in business.  The business is what motivated her to seek a loan to put up the roof and use the room as a storehouse.

loans.use: para techar un cuarto y utilizarlo como depósito de papas.

loans.name: Las Lomas De San Juan Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Lomas De San Juan”  está conformado por 05 socios emprendedores y responsables que vienen desarrollándose en su negocio. Este es el caso de Eliza de 22 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta especerías. Hace más de 06 meses que inicio su negocio en su propio local y le va bien. Su deseo es incrementar sus productos con más variedades. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de ají, ajos, rocoto y huacatay. El grupo “Las Lomas De San Juan” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Eliza es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo rojo.
texts.en:
Las Lomas de San Juan Group is made up of five enterprising and responsible members who are building up their businesses.

That's Eliza's situation.  She's 22 years old and earns a living selling spices.  She started her own business more than six months ago in her own retail space and it's going well for her.

She wants to increase her products to have greater variety.  That's why she requested a loan to buy ají peppers, garlic, rocoto peppers, and huacatay [an herb].

Las Lomas de San Juan Group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their help.  Eliza's the first person on the left, wearing a red t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy ají peppers, garlic, rocoto peppers, and huacatay

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en: Barbara is 20 years old. She owns and operates a small business cooking and selling BBQ in her community to earn a living. Barbara has requested a loan to buy a box of chicken, a box of sausage, mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, bananas and a sack of rice to help her run the business. Barbara hopes to build a small restaurant in the near future using her business profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, a box of sausage, mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, bananas and a sack of rice.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita is 49 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children, four of whom are now at their adult age and one who is school age. Angelita earns a living from the fish vending business. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional fishing nets, floaters, zinc, nylons and other fishing accessories. She has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Angelita hopes to expand her fishing business by acquiring additional fishing boats and nets.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets, floaters, zinc, nylons and other fishing accessories.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en: Rosalia is from Mangidkid, Paridel. Rosalia has a buy and sell livestock business, she is focusing on piglets and earns approximately PHP 800 per week depending on how many piglets she delivers in a week. She has been doing this type of activity for 12 years. She also raises pigs on her own and takes in swine production for added income. The month of December is a peak season, so she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to pay for more piglets to sell in the local community. Rosalia has became an active member of PMPC for 5 years and she is thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to pay for more piglets to sell in the local community.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre que trabaja muy duro y con mucha responsabilidad para generar el sustento diario para su familia; que se compone de 4 hijos. Miguel tiene 47 años de edad.

Él se dedica a la venta de banano; esta actividad la ha heredado de sus padres porque ellos se dedicaban a lo mismo.  Esta labor la realiza en la aldea donde vive. Se dedicó a la venta de banano porque es muy rentable y le ayuda a genera los recursos económicos para sostener a su familia. Tiene más de 30 años de estar realizando esta actividad la cual realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos.
 
El uso respectivo que le dará al préstamo que solicita es la compra de terreno. 

Unos de sus principales anhelos o sueños es que en un futuro sus ganancias le ayuden a comprar más terreno para poder heredarle a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Miguel is a man who works very hard and with a lot of care and responsibility in order to provide daily sustenance for his family; he has four children. Miguel is 47 years old.

He makes a living selling bananas. He inherited this type of work from his parents, who were also involved in this trade. He carries out his work in the village where he lives. This type of business is very profitable and helps him to generate the economic resources he needs to take care of his family. He has been involved in this work for more than 30 years, and his children help him.

With this loan, he will buy land. 

One of his main dreams is that in the future, his profits will help him to buy more land so that he can then pass these lands onto his children.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es: Justina es madre soltera de tres hijos pertenece al grupo Corazón de Jesús,se dedica a la venta de especeria en el mercado, sus principales clientes son personas conocidas, atiende aproximadamente a 30 clientes diarios,Justina se siente feliz de haber logrado el préstamo ya que le ha permitido incrementar su negocio en la compra de mercadería como vinagre, aceituna, vino, ají y demás,su mayor sueño es crecer en el negocio y con el tiempo poder poner un stand mas grande,y así poder darles mejor calidad de vida a sus tres hijos ya que ha podido sacarlos adelante sola a pesar de los obstáculos que se les ha presentado,Justina agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el préstamo otorgado y promete sacar provecho de todo esto.
texts.en:
Justina is the single mother of three children and belongs to the Corazón de Jesús group. She sells spices in the market.
