Her main customers are people she knows, and she serves approximately 30 customers a day. Justina feels happy to have obtained the loan, as it has allowed her to expand her business through the purchase of merchandise such as vinegar, olives, wine, hot sauce and other items.

Her greatest dream is to see her business grow and in time be able to set up a larger stand. This will enable her to provide better quality of life for her three children, as she has been able to help them get ahead in life, on her own, in spite of the obstacles that have arisen. Justine is grateful to the Kiva investors for loan provided, and promises to make the most of it.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise such as soy sauce vinegar, spices, wine, olives and other items.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.en: Dilafruz was born in 1992. She is divorced and has a little child. She lives with her parents and brother. She is very hardworking woman. Dilafruz is the only provider for her child. Dilafruz is a beginning businesswoman. She has been busy buying and selling clothes in a local market for more than 7 years. She works hard every day to earn a living. Her life is very difficult. Dilafruz needs to financial support because her brother is ill and she must buy medicine to treat him. She is asking for a loan of 2000 TJS to buy this medicine. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for her brother.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
La socia Mary pertenece al banco comunal LOS ANGELES, el banco está ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia continua con su negocio de venta de pescados y pollos, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidos, la socia continua vendiendo en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos.
texts.en:
Mary's a member of Los Angeles Communal Bank, located in the department of Cusco.

She still has her business selling shellfish and chickens in one of the markets in Cusco, which is how she gets her family ahead.  She's grateful for the loan she received and promises to make her payments punctually.

Mary's requesting the loan to buy chickens.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is a 37-year-old man who has been buying and selling energy-saving jikos (cook stoves).  At the same time, he does crop farming where he earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his siblings.  

He has applied for his first loan of KES. 7,000 from Vision Fund Kenya and intends to use the entire loan amount to buy energy saving jikos for sale at a profit. Dickson hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy energy saving jikos (cook stoves)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add stock of fresh fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 59 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosalinda has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 46 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rowena has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lene

texts.en:
Lene works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Lene requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Lene has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 46 years old. She lives with her mother in Dedoplistskaro district, Kakheti region. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, Nino owns a small plot of agricultural land, where she grows onions and sells the harvested produce locally. Her mother is a pensioner. 

Nino decided to start a trading business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of GEL 600. With the received credit she will purchase clothes to resell. This will increase her income and she will be able to increase her trading business gradually in the future. 

Nino awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin clothes trading.

loans.name: Remely

texts.en: Remely is 43 years old from Lal-lo, Cagayan. She is married and blessed with three children. With hog raising as their only source of income, Remely and her husband finds it hard to provide for all the needs of their children, especially in sending them to school. That’s why Remely wants to avail an education loan of PHP5,000 from the KIVA lenders which will help in sending their son Gregorio to college. Gregorio is taking up BS in Criminology for he dreams of being a policeman.

loans.use: to pay for son's tuition fee.

loans.name: Florifel

texts.en: Florifel is 41 years old from Gattaran, Cagayan. She is married with four children. Her husband works as a driver while she raises hogs. Even though both of them are earning, sometimes it is not enough to provide  for all the needs of their children. That’s why Florifel wants to avail an education loan of PHP15,000 from the KIVA lenders. She will use the loan to aid in sending her son Billy to college who is taking up a BS in Computer Science. Billy wants to finish college and help his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to pay for son's tuition fee

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda is a vegetable and fruit vendor from Ajuy, Iloilo. She is married and has three grown children. Brenda has been in the business for more than 8 years now. This is the source of her income. Brenda is asking to take a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her store. With this, she will be able to improve her stocks thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Brenda hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her store

loans.name: Lucas

texts.es:
Lucas tiene 32 años de edad ,estado civil conviviente,reside en el caserío Piedra Herrada, distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú, desde hace más de 20 años. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican al comercio y crianza de ganado menor.

La actividad a la que se dedica Lucas es la crianza y venta de animales como gallinas, pollos, cerdos, entre otros, actividad que realiza desde hace más de 8 años, además de la siembra de granos. Lucas vende sus animales en el mismo caserío y alrededores, es conocido en la zona y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y crediticias. El destino del crédito será para la compra de materiales para el mejoramiento de su techo, él desea comprar calaminas, lo cual le permitirá asegurar su vivienda ya que se acercan la temporada de lluvias, de esta forma podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lucas is 32 years old, is in a relationship, and lives in the village of Piedra Herrado, which is located in the Buenos Aires district of the Morropón province in the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru. He has lived there for more than 20 years. Life in the community is calm, and the village residents make a living in trade and raising small livestock.

Lucas works raising and selling animals like hens, chickens, pigs, and others. He has been doing this work for more than eight years in addition to his work growing grain crops. Lucas sells his animals in his own village as well as in the neighboring communities. He is known in the area for his business and has many good personal and credit references. 

He will invest this loan in the purchase of materials to improve the roof of his home. He wants to buy metal roofing, which will allow him to make his home more secure in the upcoming rainy season; this will enhance the quality of life for both himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve his home.

loans.name: Saron Group

texts.en: Saron is a 60-year-old widowed rice farmer who lives with her brother’s family in Kampong Chhnang province of Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice for nearly 25 years, making $1.5 daily. Now Saron, a group leader, would like to request a group loan of three members and she will use her portion to build a latrine. This loan will provide her with hygienic living conditions. For her plan, she wants to run a grocery store at home.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is a married woman and mother of six children from Iloilo, Philippines. She is engaged in a fish vending business. She also makes additional income through her food vending business. Jennifer is asking to take a loan to buy more fish to sell and ingredients for her food vending like meat, vegetables, cooking oil and condiments. Jennifer believes that this loan will really her in improving her business as well as her income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell and ingredients for her food vending like meat, vegetables, cooking oil and condiments

loans.name: Taumaoe

texts.en: Taumaoe is 18 year old mother with 1 child, and has a business selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her village to earn a living. Taumaoe has requested for a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, bottle of vegetable oil, plastic bags, fry pan, and yeast, to assist her operating the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. Taumaoe hopes to build a small bakery store in the near future and provide for her family needs. She became a member of SPBD 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, bottle of vegetable oil, plastic bags, fry pan, and yeast.

loans.name: Mkombozi Mwenge Group

texts.en:
Aziza, who is in her early 20s, is married with two children, one of whom is in school and the other one is still small.  She has been running a library business where she also sells CDs and DVDs, for four years now.  She works from 8 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Aziza's third plus loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to open an office for her business, bought stationary stock and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy library stock. She dreams of growing her business.

Aziza will share this loan with her loan group "Mkombozi Mwenge", which consists of eight members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy library stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for daughter's tuition fee

loans.name: Dúo Esmeralda De San Miguel Group

texts.es: Dúo Esmeralda de San Miguel, este dúo esta formado por doña Miriam Alicia, ella tiene 46 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de chocolate elaborado por ella misma, y venta de verduras en el Mercado la Terminal de lunes a sábado, ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de un quintal de cacao, azúcar, canela, y papal y bolsas para empacar su chocolate, su deseo es invertir en esta temporada ya que actualmente ya cuenta con pedidos y necesita de mas capital para poder cubrir sus pedidos, su mayor anhelo es seguir incrementando su negocio y aprovechar la temporada de frio que es donde tiene más demanda.
texts.en:
Duo Esmeralda de San Miguel

This duo was formed by Miriam Alicia, who is 46 years old. She makes a living selling chocolate that she makes as well as selling vegetables in the bus terminal market from Monday through Saturday.

She is requesting a loan to buy a quintal of cocoa, sugar, and cinnamon as well as paper and bags to package her chocolate. Her wish is to invest in this season because she already has orders and needs more capital to fulfill them. Her greatest desire is to continue expanding her business and to take advantage of the cold season, which is when she has more demand.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make chocolate.

loans.name: Ac

texts.en: Ac is a 52-year-old married man from the community of Carles in Iloilo. He has four adult children. Ac has been raising hogs for five years now. The good thing about his business is that he owns a sow that produces piglets for a better income. He is asking for a loan to buy different types of feed such as hog grower and lactating mash. With the available feed, he can be assured of a healthy animal for four months before it will become ready to sell in the market. Ac hopes to continue to expand his business to make it more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy different feed like hog grower and lactating mash

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego es un señor que el amor que le tiene a su familia hace que trabaje sin descansar para brindarles el sustento a los 6 hijos que tiene. Él está casado y tiene 54 años de edad.
 
Él trabaja como jornalero en las tierras que tiene; además trabaja en el mantenimiento y cultivo de los terrenos de vecinos y amigos de su comunidad; de la actividad que realiza obtiene los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos de su familia; Él está muy satisfecho con el trabajo que realiza ya que es un trabajo digno y honesto con el cual sirve a su comunidad y a su familia. 

El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de más terreno.

Su principal anhelo es instalar en su comunidad un molino de nixtamal (grano de maíz cocido). Con esto pretende generar más ingresos para elevar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Diego is a man who because of love for his family works tirelessly to provide sustenance for his 6 children. He is married and is 54 years old. He works as a day laborer on land that he has; in addition he works maintaining and farming on land owned by neighbors and friends in his community. Through this work he obtains the necessary income to cover his family's expenses. He is very satisfied with the work that he does as it is dignified and honest work that serves his community and his family.

The loan he seeks is to buy more land. His main goal is to open a nixtamal (cook corn) mill in his community. With this he intendeds to generate more income in order to elevate the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a rolling materials, needles, sewing machine, tape measurement.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a 59 year old married woman from Ormoc City, Leyte. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place.

Lourdes is asking to take a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soft drinks and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, bread and snack foods. This loan will enable her to improve her stocks thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, Lourdes hopes of making her business successful and productive.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soft drinks and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, bread and snack foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, shovel, rake, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves and safety boots.

loans.name: Oscar De Jesús

texts.es:
Oscar es un hombre de experiencia, sabiduría y mucha paciencia.
Es padre de 1 hijo y ha trabajado prácticamente toda su vida para sacarlo adelante.
El tiene una pequeña chaza en la que vende frituras, golosinas y refrescos, con el cual se gana la vida e intenta salir adelante.

Trabaja todos los días de 5:00 Am  a 3:00 Pm para tener su producto listo y fresco para sus clientes que en su mayoría son los transeuntes del sector donde trabaja.

El desea capitalizar su negocio y tener un gran avance de inventario de productos, por eso acude a un préstamo para comprar surtido de bebidas y frituras.

Una de sus principales dificultades es la falta de dinero para invertir en su negocio pero confía en la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar y el buen corazón de los prestamistas de Kiva para sacar su actividad adelante.
texts.en:
Oscar is a man with a lot of experience, knowledge, and patience. He is the father of one child and has worked practically his entire life in order to move his family ahead. 

He has a small snack cart where he sells fried goods, snacks and drinks. With this business, he has been able to take control of his life and to move forward. He works every day from 5:00am until 3:00pm so that he has his products fresh and ready for his customers, who are mainly the commuters passing each day on their way to and from work.

He hopes to capitilize on his new business and to have a great inventory of goods and products; he is therefore requesting a loan so that he may stock his cart with drinks and fried snacks.

One of his main challenges is lack of money to invest in his business; however, he has faith in Interactuar and in the good hearts of the Kiva investors that will allow him to continue operating his snack cart.

loans.use: to buy drinks and fried snacks to stock his cart.

loans.name: Manulelei

texts.en: Manulelei is a 32 year old mother with 4 children, owns and operates a small business in her community to earn a living. Manulelei has requested for a loan to buy a vegetable seeds, shovel, rake, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves and safety boots to assist the business. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. Manulelei will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a vegetable seeds, shovel, rake, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves and safety boots

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is 36 and live in Lahore. She is married and a mother of three children. She is a growing entrepreneur. She does embroidery work. She makes intricate designs and is known for her good work. She uses different threads, beads and tussels to make the designs. Her contribution to the family is significant. She wants her kids to get higher education and excel in their fields.

In order to enhance her business she wants to buy more embroidery raw material but due to insufficient money she has requested for a loan for the purchase. She is pleased and thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more embroidery raw material to enhance her work.

loans.name: Ivan Dario

texts.es:
Ivan inicio la venta de variedades específicamente accesorios, hace meses atrás, actividad aprendida gracias a un amigo, buscó esta actividad como una alternativa de generar dinero y como hombre pujante y emprendedor busca desesperadamente el sustento para su hogar conformado por sus dos hijos.

Debido al costo de vida tan alto, Ivan se ve en la necesidad de generar un mayor volumen de ingresos, es por este motivo que necesita un apoyo económico que la ayude a mejorar la variedad de productos que exhibe y que diariamente ofrece a sus clientes y a personas puerta a puerta. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de accesorios y lociones para añadirlos a su portafolio de productos de uso personal.

Su principal sueño es poder convertirse en la propietario de un almacén con gran variedad de productos y sabe que está por buen camino de la mano de la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Ivan began a business selling accessories a few months ago. He learned this business from a friend. He was looking for a business as an alternative to generate income and as a driven and enterprising man he was desperately seeking a way to support his home which consists of his two children. Due to the high cost of living, Ivan saw the necessity to generate a greater volume of income, so for that reason he needs economic support to help improve the variety of products that he demonstrates and that he offers to his customers daily and in sales door to door.

He seeks a loan to buy accessories and lotions to add to his portfolio of personal use products. His main dream is to be able to become an owner of a store with a large variety of products and he knows that this is a good road that is at hand through Interactuar.

loans.use: to buy accessories and lotions to add to his portfolio of personal use products.

loans.name: Carlos Andres

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre muy trabajador y organizado, se gana la vida prestando el servicio de transporte de personas en su taxi a través del municipio de La Dorada posibilitando el desplazamiento de la comunidad hasta las distintitas áreas del municipio.
Es un hombre amable, servicial y muy emprendedor, es soltero y sostiene a su madre a la cual siempre ha procurado ofrecerle la mejor vida posible.
Solicita un préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento y reparación a su taxi ya que es su único medio de trabajo.
Con este crédito podrá mejorar las condiciones de su vehículo y podrá continuar prestando su servicio con total seguridad y sin poner en riesgo su vida ni la de sus clientes.
Apoya a Carlos con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Carlos is a very hard-working and organized man. He makes a living providing transportation services for people in his taxi through the city of La Dorada. He makes it possible for people to travel to different areas of the city. Carlos is a friendly, helpful, and very entrepreneurial man. He is single, and he supports his mother. He has always attempted to provide the best possible life for her.

He is requesting a loan to cover the costs of maintaining and repairing his taxi, since this is his only source of work. With this loan, he will be able to improve the condition of his vehicle so that he can continue providing his services safely and without putting his life or the lives of his customers at risk. Support Carlos with a loan today!

loans.use: to cover the costs of maintaining and repairing his taxi.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina tiene 32 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se caracteriza por su clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Luz Marina se dedica a la venta de productos de grano life que son productos medicinales, vitaminicos, además también vende productos de belleza cuenta con más de 04 años de experiencia en el negocio de venta por pedidos, por su experiencia y su buen servicio cuenta con buen número de clientela, además su cónyugue se desempeña como peón agrícola realizando sus labores en el distrito de Pucará, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales, solvencia moral y económica. Destino del crédito es para compra de productos para poder tener variedad y aumentar su stock, de esta forma poder atender loas diversas necesidades de sus clientes. Invirtiendo en su negocio y podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is 32 years old, and she lives with her two children in the district of Pucará. It is a community characterized by its warm climate, where the people devote themselves to agriculture, commerce, and livestock-raising.  It is located about two hours from the city of Jaén, which belongs to the Cajamarca Region of Peru’s northern sierra.

Luz Marina sells GanoLife products, which are medicinal products and vitamins, and she also sells beauty products.  She has more than four years’ experience in the business of selling on order, and she has a lot of customers because of her experience and good service. In addition, her spouse works as a field hand in the district of Pucará, and she has very good personal, moral, and financial references. 

The loan is for the purchase of products so that she can have more variety and expand her stock. In this way, she can meet the different needs of her customers.  By investing in her business, she will be able to make an adequate profit, so that she may improve the quality of life for her family and for herself.

loans.use: to purchase products so that she can have more variety and expand her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products for her business such as soft drinks and fruit drinks, among others.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia vive en unión libre y tiene 1 hijo a quien le garantiza una buena calidad de vida gracias a su negocio con el cual intenta generar ingresos para contribuir económicamente, junto con su compañero, para que en su hogar mejoren las condiciones económicas y puedan tener una vida plena. 

Desde hace más de 30 años comenzó con gran esfuerzo un negocio de papelería y venta de variedades en un local ubicado en el municipio de Envigado.

Debido a que sus clientes están aumentando y cada vez demandan más productos, Lucia busca un préstamo para comprar surtido de papelería y ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos en su negocio.

Con este préstamo la actividad de Lucia tendrá un gran impulso pues mejorara su inventario y sus ventas.
texts.en:
Lucia lives in a common-law marriage and has one son; thanks to her business, she is able to help provide her son with a good quality of life, along with her husband. Together, they work to improve the economic conditions of their home and to have a full life.

She began a paper business more than 30 years ago. She sells different types of paper products in her storefront located in the municipality of Envigado.

Because her customer base is growing and demanding more and more products, Lucia is requesting a loan to purchase paper supply stock. This will allow her to offer her customers a greater variety of products through her business.

With this loan, Lucia will be able to improve her inventory and consequently improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy paper supplies.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela es una señora luchadora, perseverante y amable; trabaja muy duro todos los días para ganarse la vida. Ella tiene 49 años de edad, es soltera. 

Ella se dedica con mucho entusiasmo y alegría a la compraventa de pollos; la venta de la realiza en la comunidad donde vive y en las comunidades cercanas; Tiene 7 años de estar realizando esta labor con la cual genera los ingresos necesarios para su sostenimiento. Ella se ha dado cuenta que esta actividad es muy rentable y tiene mucha demanda porque en su comunidad la gente consume mucho la carne de pollo.

Ella cuenta que solicitará un préstamo para comprar más pollos para incrementar sus ventas y atender la demanda existente.
 
Uno de sus principales sueños es que en un futuro su negocio y sus ganancias incrementen y le permitan comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Manuela is a hardworking, persevering, and friendly woman. She works very hard every day to make a living. She is 49 years old and is single. 

With a lot of enthusiasm and happiness, she makes a living by buying and selling chickens. She makes sales in the community where she lives and in the nearby communities. She has been in this line of work for 7 years, and through this work she generates the necessary income for her sustenance. She has realized that this occupation is very profitable and has a lot of demand because the people in her community eat a lot of chicken. 

She says that she will request a loan to buy more chicken to increase her sales and meet the existing demand.

One of her primary dreams is that in the future her business and earnings will increase, which will allow her to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy chicken.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy taro roots, banana tube, wheelbarrow, shovel, rake, water tank and hand gloves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy taro roots, banana tube, wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank and hand gloves

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en: Dinah is still single. In order to help her parents uplift their living, Dinah engaged herself in a photo copier and direct selling business. She also accepts bookbinding services. Dinah wants to grow her business and be able to extend her support to her parents and relatives. Thus, she is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy ink, bond paper and other materials needed in her photo copying and direct selling business. Dinah hopes to obtain the loan and be able to accept more bookbinding work. Dinah will look towards the development of her business as well as her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy ink, bond paper and other materials needed in her photo copying and direct selling business.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Sin mucho capital, Beatriz montó su taller de confección con el ánimo de generar ingresos con los cuales pueda sostener los gastos de su hogar donde convive con su madre.

La actividad la aprendió realizando algunos cursos y esto le ha permitido realizar trabajos que se caracterizan por su buena calidad y su puntualidad en la entrega. 

Con sus trabajos, Beatriz ha logrado captar un gran número de clientes que le han garantizado muy buenas ventas mensuales, por lo que espera que su negocio siga creciendo y posteriormente pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas. 

Con la finalidad de responder a la demanda sus clientes, Beatriz busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la Compra de insumos para confección como tela, hilos, agujas, encajes, botones, entre otros, para abastecer su taller.

Beatriz espera que así su familia pueda gozar de unos mejores ingresos los cuales les permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida. 

Además, Beatriz espera que si su negocio sigue ampliándose a un buen ritmo y que en su taller pueda generar como mínimo un empleo para una persona que lo requiera y no tenga oportunidades laborales.
texts.en:
Without much capital, Beatriz set up her sewing workshop with a lot of determination to generate profits so that she could cover expenses for the house where she lives with her mother. She learned this trade through a couple of courses, which allowed her to get some work and to be known for her good quality and punctuality in completing projects on time.

Through these jobs, Beatriz has been able to attract a large number of customers, which have provided her with good monthly sales. She hopes that her business continues growing so that she can eventually employ other people who are in great need of work.

In hoping to respond to her customers' needs, Beatriz is looking to secure a loan that will allow her to buy sewing supplies, like cloth, thread, needles, lace, buttons, etc. to stock her workshop.

Beatriz hopes that her family will be able to enjoy an increase in income and consequently, an enhanced quality of life. Beatriz also hopes that her business will continue growing and that her workshop can provide a job for at least one person who needs work but who does not have many employment opportunities.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies, like cloth, thread, needles, lace, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 51 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Elena has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Elena would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Ahde

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Ahde works hard to support her family.


She has a buy and sell cultured pearl business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Ahde is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of different cultured pearls.


Ahde has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of different cultured pearl to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with three children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mary operates a food making business, making consumables like beans and chapatti (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours. She mentioned the high cost of purchasing foodstuffs to be her major challenge. 

With the Kes 20,000, she wants to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Lanuola

texts.en: Lanuola is a 42 year old mother with 2 children, runs a business of selling taro and banana in her village. She has been doing this for more than a year to earn a living. Lanuola has requested for a loan to buy taro roots, banana tube, wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, hand gloves to assist the business. She will expand her business in the future using her profit. She became a member of SPBD 2012.

loans.use: to buy taro roots, banana tube, wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, hand gloves

loans.name: Mkongoni Group

texts.en:
Terethia, who is in her late 20s, is single with one child who is still small.  She has been selling charcoal for eight months only.  She works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Terethia's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal.  She dreams of owning a big charcoal store.

Terethia will share this loan with her loan group, Mkongoni, which has nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Muattar

texts.en:
Muattar is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1980 and lives in a rural area. She is married and has three children. Muattar has an agricultural business. Her husband and sons help her with the business. She is an honest, kind, cheerful and hardworking woman. She has worked in the agriculture and cattle breeding sphere for almost fifteen years. Their family works hard. 

They are planting cotton in a yard. Every season they try to make a good planting, and then sell in the market. Last year it was less rainy, and their plants did not grow. Muattar decided to widen her business. She is planning to buy more cattle, feed them and then sell them in the domestic market. She needs financial support in order to enlarge her business.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase working capital

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is 40 years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children.

She owns a beauty parlor and is an expert in makeover services. Most of her clients are from the neighborhood and appreciate her services. With the passage of time, her beauty products have been diminishing, and at this time she wants to buy more beauty products for her beauty salon. 

Therefore, Rani has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so she will be able to buy new cosmetic products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, lotion, etc.

She wants to establish a parlor in the main market of town because she wants to enhance her income. Rani thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new cosmetic products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, lotion, etc.

loans.name: Ruzigul

texts.en: Ruzigul is an honest woman who was born in 1962. She lives in a rural area, is married and has four children. She has a business planting agricultural products. She is hardworking woman. The annual income of her business partly covers everyday expenditures. She wants to enlarge her business. She is planning to fertilize the soil and get healthy plants. Ruzigul needs financial support for her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy repair tools and spare parts, tyres, break shoes, etc. for her husband's workshop.

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.es: La Sra. Anacleta, vive y trabaja en Colomi, económicamente es independiente, trabajadora y responsable; se dedica a la agricultura hace 40 años, siembra papa y haba en vaina verde como sus principales productos,en su terreno propio con una extensión de 3 hectáreas. Produce con rotación de cultivos tales como avena y cebada para consumo de su ganado vacuno, también cuenta con 3 cabezas de ganado vacuno - yuntas . La Sra. Anacleta requiere un crédito para la compra de una cabeza de ganado vacuno (yunta), herramientas agrícolas, productos agroquímicos y pago a los peones(personal eventual). De esta forma lograra mejorar su patrimonio e  incrementará su producción e ingresos.
texts.en:
Anacleta lives and works in Colomi. She is economically independent, hardworking, and responsible. For the past 40 years she has made a living in agriculture. She sows potatoes and green beans as her principal products. She has her own land, which is an extension of 3 hectares. She rotates crops such as oats and barley for her cattle to consume. She has 3 head of cart-pulling cattle.

Anacleta needs a loan to buy one head of cart-pulling cattle, agricultural tools, agrochemical products, and to pay for seasonal laborers. In this way, she will be able to improve her wealth and increase her production and income.

loans.use: to buy one head of cart-pulling cattle, agricultural tools, agrochemical products, and to pay for seasonal laborers.

loans.name: Juana Martha

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 63 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos varones de 28 y 22 años y su negocio es la venta de comida rápida.
Ella es dulce, cariñosa, sensible, sincera, generosa, comprensiva, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona de ‘villa Fátima’ un área caracterizada por el comercio mayorista; camiones cargados de frutas, verduras y carne llegan desde el norte para ser comercializados en el lugar y por mayor. De clima frío y seco con fuertes vientos que llegan de la cordillera.
Juana es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hijo menor que estudia a nivel técnico y trabaja, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida rápida como; hamburguesas, salchipapas, sándwiches, y otros, en un puesto de venta fijo. Debido al paso del tiempo, las constantes lluvias y la humedad, las paredes y techo se han deteriorado causando grietas y rajaduras en el techo de su negocio. Esto causa mal aspecto y pérdidas de ventas. “la comida rápida tiene gran demanda por aquellas personas que quieren un bocadillo al paso, saliendo de sus trabajos o que no cocinan en sus casas…” comenta. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales para que no tengan que vivir de un oficio. Ella desea refaccionar su negocio realizando la compra de pintura y otros para arreglar el techo y las paredes. Este es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Juana solicita un préstamo para arreglar su puesto de venta y mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Juana is a 63-year-old woman.  She is single, has two sons who are 28 and 22 years old and her business is the sale of fast food.

She is gentle, kind, sensitive, sincere, generous, understanding, responsible and a hard-worker.  Her business is carried out in “villa Fatima,” an area characterized by wholesale trade, trucks loaded with fruit, vegetables and meat arriving from the north to be sold in the place and in bulk.  The climate is cold and dry with strong winds that come from the mountains.

Juana is dark-complexioned, has long, black, tied-up hair and dark eyes.  Her mother tongue is Aymara and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and to the business that she carries out.  She shares her life with her younger son who is studying at the technical level and works.  They live in a rented brick house that has drinking water, electricity and a sewage system.

Her business is the sale of fast food such as hamburgers, fried potatoes with hotdogs, sandwiches and other things from a fixed food stall.  Due to the passage of time, the constant rain and the humidity, the walls and the roof have deteriorated causing cracks and chinks in the ceiling of her business. This has caused a poor appearance and a loss of sales.  

She says, “Fast food is in great demand by those people that wish a snack on the way, leaving their work or who don't cook in their houses.”

Her dream is that her sons be professionals so that they don't have to live from a trade.  She wishes to repair her business using the purchase of paint and other things to fix the roof and the walls.  This is her first loan with the institution in the 6 years that she has been carrying out this business.  It is for these reasons that Juana is asking for a loan to fix her food stall and to improve her sales.

loans.use: to fix her food stall and improve her sales

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
La socia Tomasa pertenece al banco comunal LOS ANGELES, el banco está ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia continua con su  negocio de cevicheria, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidos, la socia continua vendiendo a sus clientes que le solicitan cada día, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pescados, limón, sal, kion entre otros.
texts.en:
Tomasa is a member of Los Angeles Communal Bank, located in the department of Cusco.

She still has her ceviche business.  She's grateful for the loan she received and promises to make her payments punctually.  She still sells to her customers who buy from her every day because it's how she gets ahead with her family.

Tomasa's requesting the loan to buy fish, lime, salt, ginger, and other ingredients.

loans.use: to buy fish, limes, salt, ginger, and other products

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 22-year-old single man from Khan Younis. He lives with his family in a simple house in the city. Mohammad has a store for selling clothes. This is the only source of income to the family. Mohammad would like to improve his store and expand it. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of winter clothes. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to increase his sales and also his income. Mohammad appears in the photo in his store.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of winter clothes.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza owns and cultivates the land. She engages in the rice farming business. She grows and sells rice. She is a 37-year-old married woman with two children aged eight and four. Her husband earns a living by being a laborer.

She is asking for a loan to buy a tractor that is being used by farmers in tilling the farm. This equipment will make her farming work fast and easy. It will also be used in transporting her yield from the field to her home. She is trying her best to venture into any business opportunities that will help her augment her daily income.

 Analiza hopes that someday her farming livelihood will be successful and hopefully this will help her support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy a tractor that is being used by farmers in tilling the farm

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 32-year-old lady who is very poor and needy. Her husband provides sheltering services to generate income to feed his entire family. He has been doing this business for many years and has been using wooden planks and bamboo, which have been depreciating over time. 

Now he is unable to continue his business without wooden boards and bamboo. Therefore, Shehnaz has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy new wooden smooth boards and bamboo to continue his business again. She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her life and her husband will earn maximum profits with the help of this loan.

Shehnaz is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, because they empower her husband to buy new sheltering material.

loans.use: to buy new wooden smooth boards and bamboo for her husband's sheltering services.

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en: Yoeurn is a 56-year-old married woman with five children in her care. She lives in Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. Her husband is 56 years old. Yoeurn and her husband buy recyclable junk to resell. They have been in the business since 2013. For her children, one of them works as garment worker, two are construction workers and one is in school. Together, they can make about USD 27 a day. To improve her business, she would like to request a loan to buy more recyclable junk to resell. This loan will help her improve her family’s finances. For her plans are to build a new proper house and support her child to go through high school.

loans.use: to buy more recyclable junk to resell

loans.name: Fualilia

texts.en: Fualilia is a 37 year old mother with 3 children. She runs and operates a small business of selling taro and banana in her community to earn a living. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business in the near future. Fualilia has requested for a loan to buy taro roots, banana tube, wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and chemicals to assist her run the business. She became a member of SPBD in 2009.

loans.use: to buy taro roots, banana tube, wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal is a 30-year-old married man from Deir el-Balah. He lives with his wife and two kids, a son and a daughter, in a small house. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. He also bought a rickshaw five months ago to transfer goods in the local market. He buys the products from the wholesalers and redistributes them with higher prices.

Nidal took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products for his rickshaw and resell them to the local traders. This will help him to increase his sales and improve his income. Nidal appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more products for his rickshaw and resell them to the local traders.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.es:
Jonathan es un joven emprendedor y dinámico de 24 años de edad, estudiante universitario y comerciante independiente; ya que desde hace 4 meses comenzó a vender mercancía a sus familiares, amigos y compañeros de la universidad, con el fin de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar y para pagar sus estudios.

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, pues invertirá el dinero en la compra de surtido al por mayor como perfumes, cremas y productos de uso personal, brindando mayor variedad y un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que hará más rentable su negocio.

Jonathan tiene el firme propósito de sacar adelante su proyecto productivo, pues quiere convertirse en un empresario exitoso y garantizar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar para su grupo familiar y sabe que con los prestamistas de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar puede lograr todo eso y más.
texts.en:
Jonathan, 24, is an enterprising and dynamic young man, a university student, and an independent businessman. He began selling merchandise to his relatives, friends, and fellow university students four months ago, in order to contribute financially to his home and pay for his studies.

The loan that he is requesting is a support for strengthening his business, as he will invest the money in purchasing a variety of wholesale merchandise such as perfume, cream, and personal use products. Providing more variety and better service to his customers will make his business more profitable.

Jonathan is committed to moving forward with his productive project, as he wants to become a successful businessman, and guarantee better quality of life and well-being for his family.  He knows that with the Kiva lenders and Interactuar he can achieve all this and more.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of wholesale merchandise such as perfume, cream, and personal use products.

loans.name: Holbibi

texts.en: Holbibi is a strong woman who was born in 1969. She lives in a village, and is married with one child. Her husband is an emigrant. She works hard and is a retailer. She buys and sells clothes. She started her business with clothes for kids, and widened her business by degrees. Now she has shoes and women's clothes, beside clothes for kids. Holbibi is asking for financial support to buy a new collection of clothes.

loans.use: To buy a new collection of clothes

loans.name: Carmen Elmilia

texts.es:
Con la ilusión de salir adelante y superarse, Carmen desea montar un negocio de comidas rápidas en un carro de comidas ubicado al frente de su casa en el municipio de Itagüí.

Esta idea surge a partir de la motivación que le dio su hijo mayor que la impulsa para montar este negocio y así generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Aunque ella siempre ha querido ser independiente, nunca había tenido el valor de arriesgarse a iniciar con un negocio; pero ahora se siente con la fuerza y capacidad para hacerlo.

Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar todos los elementos necesarios para el montaje de su negocio tales como 1 congelador, nevera, 1 carrito de comidas con freidora, insumos e ingredientes para la preparación de comidas.

Con estos elementos podrá iniciar con este proyecto y podrá cumplir así su sueño de ser independiente.

Con el apoyo a este crédito estarás impulsando las ideas emprendedoras de una madre colombiana!
texts.en:
With the hope of getting ahead and bettering herself, Carmen wants to start a fast food business in a food cart located in front of her home in the municipality of Itagüí.

This idea arises from the motivation that her older son gave her, which pushes her to start this business and generate the necessary income to maintain her home. Although she has always wanted to be independent, she never had the courage to take a risk and start a business; but now she feels like she has the strength and the ability to do it. 

She asks for a loan to buy all the necessary items to open her business, such as 1 freezer, refrigerator, 1 food cart with a fryer, supplies and ingredients for food preparation. 

With these items she can start this project and achieve her dream of becoming independent. 
With the help of this loan you will be encouraging the entrepreneurial ideas of a Colombian mother!

loans.use: to purchase 1 freezer, refrigerator, 1 food cart with a fryer, supplies and ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband purchase a snooker table.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
La socia Marleni continua con su negocio de venta de productos naturales, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo sus productos naturales a sus clientes que cada día le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de productos naturales.
texts.en:
Marleni continues with her business selling natural products. She feels grateful for the loan that has been granted and pledges to make the established repayments. She continues selling natural products to her clients, who come to her every day. She hopes to continue working so she can keep supporting her family.

She requested the loan to buy natural products.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is 30 years old, a married woman and mother of five children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Fozia has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He wants to buy new wheels and do a little bit of engine maintenance on his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

Fozia gives thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new wheels for her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: La señora Emilia es un persona trabajadora, tiene cuatro hijos que dependen económicamente de ella y su esposo. Ambos trabajan de forma responsable y sacrificada. Su principal fuente de ingreso proviene del servicio de transporte de carga en las ciudades de Santa Cruz, La Paz y Oruro. Vive actualmente en un barrio de la ciudad de Cochabamba, su casa la compraron gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo diario. Emilia por diversas circunstancias de la vida solo llego a estudiar hasta el nivel primario, actualmente requiere un crédito para mejorar su herramienta de trabajo (camión volvo) realizar un mantenimiento y servicios de refacción como pintura y otros, así podrá brindarles mejores condiciones a sus hijos y ellos continuaran estudiando.
texts.en:
Emilia is a hard-working woman, she has four children who depend on her and her husband economically. They both work in a responsible and sacrificing manner. Her main source of income comes from cargo transportation services in the cities of Santa Cruz, La Paz, and Oruro. She currently lives in a neighborhood in the city of Cochabamba, they bought their house thanks to the effort of their daily work. Because of several life circumstances, Emilia was only able to study until primary school. 
Currently she needs a loan to improve her working tool (Volvo truck), to give it maintenance and repair services such as paint and others, and be able to provide better conditions for her children so they can keep studying.

loans.use: to improve her truck, to give it maintenance and repair services, and be able to provide better conditions for her children so they can keep studying.

loans.name: Jestonie

texts.en:
The son of a struggling food vendor, Jestonie dreams of graduating with a bachelor's degree in education, majoring in mathematics.

Jestonie, a 19-year-old hardworking student, understands the value of good education and a college degree. The limitations of his family's financial capacity drives him to aim high, having three siblings who also rely on their scarce income.

Jestonie envisions a brighter future for himself and his country, and a small amount of help can be a large step for him to become a productive citizen when he graduates.

loans.use: To pay for university tuition fees.

loans.name: Elineta

texts.en:
Elineta is a 19-year-old college student taking up a bachelor's degree in education. As the youngest daughter of a small business entrepreneur, she wants to help in her parents' struggle of paying for tuition fees as they become older.

She aspires to finish her studies and help relieve her family from poverty. Her dream of becoming a teacher one day will enable her to share her knowledge and help children become functionally literate, and socially and morally responsible.

loans.use: To pay for college tuition fees

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita, owner of a small store and mother of two, seeks to take out a loan to pay for her daughter's educational expenses, who is attending a university a few towns away from their residence.

Florita's average daily income is barely enough to make ends meet. A small amount of monetary assistance for her daughter's board and lodging, transportation, and school requirements, would be a great help in relieving the family's financial burden, and enable her daughter to finish her studies.

loans.use: To pay for college tuition fees

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en:
Celeste is a dedicated and hard-working mother of two children, whose eldest daughter, Kay Xennia, is a freshman at a university taking up a bachelor's degree in architecture.

Kay Xennia's dream is to exercise her artistic passion while helping to build sound dwellings for the members of her community. A loan for her educational expenses would help her to finish her studies, become an invaluable citizen, and make her family proud.

loans.use: To pay for college tuition fees

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a hard-working small-scale businesswoman. The breadwinner of a family with five children, she resides in a small town in the outskirts of a developing city in the Philippines.

She seeks financial aid for her daughter, Evan Joyce, a freshman college student, in order to pay for university tuition and matriculation expenses.

Evan Joyce, inspired by her mother's tireless efforts to provide for her and her siblings despite their scarce resources, aspires to become a successful businesswoman one day.

loans.use: To pay for college tuition fees

loans.name: Cora

texts.en:
Cora is a small-scale businesswoman, whose daughter is a college student taking up a bachelor's degree in criminology.

Kezzia Mae is a young aspiring businesswoman as well. She dreams of becoming a responsible citizen one day, actively upholding the law and defending the rights of the less privileged.

An educational loan would aid Kezzia in her college tuition expenses, enable her to finish her studies, and help her become a useful member of the community.

loans.use: To pay for college tuition fees

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita lives in the town of Dulag, Leyte. She is a 55-year-old married woman with eight dependents. Out of the eight, two are still attending school. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for five years now. To augment her income, she engages in a rice retailing business. She sells rice to the people in her community.

Benita has requested a loan in the amount 5,000 PHP to buy additional pigs and a sack of rice to resell. She can now start to sell rice and raise and sell hogs in the coming months. With these, her income will improve. She can now prepare healthy food for the whole family.

She is hoping that both of her businesses will prosper in order to finance the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and a sack of rice to resell

loans.name: Gulchiroy

texts.en:
Gulchiroy is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1993. She lives in rural area in region. She is married, and she has a baby. 

Gulchiroy is a goal-oriented woman. She is planning to open her own business. She wants to keep cattle in her yard. Unfortunately, she does not have enough capital to start up a business. Her husband works abroad, and for almost a month her husband did not send money. 

Gulchiroy tries to have everyday money for living. She works planting wheat, but it depends on the season. She likes to plant and keep livestock. She is needed in financial support to buy livestock to start a business.

loans.use: To buy livestock for organizing a new business

loans.name: Nagina

texts.en:
Nagina is a young and kind 35-year-old woman. She is married and has three children. Her husband is very hardworking and loves his family very much. He is involved in his own business to have a regular income for the family. He is involved in manufacturing and selling wooden furniture, such as single beds, tables and other types. He started this business over fifteen years ago. He had previously obtained loans for his business; he used two previous loans to add to his selection furniture. 

Today, Nagina's husband has many regular customers and also takes orders from other cities. This business yields a good income for him, but his family's needs are increasing day by day and he needs to earn more money. Now he wants to buy more raw materials for making furniture in order to cope with the increasing demand. Therefore, Nagina came to BRAC Pakistan. She wishes to obtain a loan for her husband so he can buy raw materials for making furniture. Nagina hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's furniture work

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is 50 years old and residing at Mamnga Daku, Plaridel, Mis. Occ. She is married and blessed with three children, who are all adults. She joined PMPC in October of this year in order to access programs and services of the said co-op. Recently, she's accessed her first loan in the amount of PHP 6,000 to add working capital to her existing business to buy a variety of commodities to sell in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities.

loans.name: Bahaa

texts.en:
Bahaa is a 21-year-old single man from Deir Al-Balah. He lives with his family in a small house. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he receives a low income. Bahaa bought a rickshaw one year ago to transfer goods in the local market. He buys the products from the wholesalers and redistributes them with a higher prices.

Bahaa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new engine for his rickshaw to replace the old one. This will help him to increase his sales and improve his income. 

Bahaa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his rickshaw to replace the old one.

loans.name: Nuevo Mundo Ii Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento NUEVO MUNDO II compuesta por ocho integrantes de las cuales seis son mujeres y dos varones, ellas se dedican a distintas actividades como; tapizado de vehículos, venta de jugos batidos, venta de celulares,  venta de jugo naturales, venta de cosméticos, venta de refrescos y venta de ropa, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios.
La Señora Elizabeth  es una mujer de 37 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene tres hijos de 16, 2 y 6 años y su negocio es la panadería.
Ella es una mujer independiente, trabajadora, Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ un lugar caracterizado por el comercio y la manufactura realizada por inmigrantes y mineros relocalizados de occidente. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura promedio de 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año. 
Elizabeth es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello color castaño largo, habla español por el comercio, su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica también a la panaderia, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Su negocio es el horneado de pan tradicional, variedades como; pan de arroz (a base de harina de arroz), Mollete (Es el pan corriente de harina, azúcar granulada y manteca), y otras variedades de pan. “la panadería es una actividad que aprendí de mi Mama …”. Su sueño es tener una panadería conocida y vender por mayor, ella desea realizar una inversión en la ampliación de su negocio mediante la compra de un horno industrial y harina, manteca por mayor, para abastecer a sus clientes por fin de año. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Elizabeth solicita un préstamo para la compra de un horno industrial y harina, manteca por mayor.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nuevo Mundo II is made up of eight members, six of which are women and two men, they have different occupations such as: vehicle carpeting, sale of blended juices, cellphone sales, natural juice sales, cosmetic sales, soda sales, and clothing sales, to ask for a loan and expand their businesses. 
Elizabeth is a 37-year-old woman, she lives with her partner, she has three children who are 16, 12 and 6 years old, and her business is baking.  
She is an independent, hard-working woman. She does her work in the area ‘plan 3000’, a place characterized by the sale and manufacture made by relocated immigrants and miners from the west. It has warm climate, tropical and humid, with an average temperature of 30 degrees centigrade during the whole year.
Elizabeth has a dark complexion, medium height, long brown hair and she speaks Spanish when selling. She shares her life with her partner, who also works with baked goods, they live in their own home made of brick, which has potable water and electricity. Her business is to bake traditional bread, varieties such as: rice bread (made with rice flour), Mollete (this is typical flour bread, with granulated sugar and butter), and other bread varieties. “Baking is an activity that I learned from my mother…” Her dream is to have a well-known bakery and sell at wholesale. She wishes to make an investment in the expansion of her business through the purchase of an industrial oven, and flour and butter at wholesale, to provide for her clients for the end of the year. In the 7 years that she has had this occupation, this is the first loan sequence with the institution.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven, and flour and butter at wholesale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, a repeat customer of three years, does retail trading in her local area. She sells different items ranging from soft drinks and foodstuffs to cosmetics, bulbs, torches, and hankies, among other items that are demanded by the local residents. 

She anticipates that will be higher during this season when many people have traveled to villages for Christmas. Therefore, she wants a loan to buy stock of items such as rice, sugar, soda, bread, biscuits, and sweets, among others, in order to increase her sales and profit. She is hardworking and thanks UGAFODE for helping her to boost the business.

loans.use: To buy inventory items to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 42 years old. She is married with four children between the ages of 7 and 20 years, all of whom go to school. She sells soft drinks and has been in a business for 15 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more drinks to resell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to resell.

loans.name: El Progreso De La Amistad Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “El Progreso De La Amistad” está conformada por 05 socios prósperos y emprendedores. Este es el caso de Ida de 50 años de edad es viuda. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir. Hace más de 07 años que se viene desempeñándose a dicho rubro donde tiene muy buena acogida por sus clientes. En esta oportunidad solicitó el crédito para la compra de polos camisas, pantalones y chaquetas. El deseo de Ida es formar su propio taller para confeccionar prendas de temporada. El grupo “El Progreso De La Amistad” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Ida se encuentra de pie, es la segunda del lado derecho y viste polo de color violeta.
texts.en: The "El Progreso De La Amistad" communal bank is made up of 5 prosperous and entrepreneurial members. This is the case of Ida, who is 50 years old and is a widow. She sells clothing items. She has been in this line of work for more than 7 years, and she is well received by her customers. At this time, she has requested the loan to buy shirts, t-shirts, pants, and jackets. Ida's wish is to start  her own workshop to make seasonal clothing. The "El Progreso De La Amistad" group thanks the Kiva lenders for the help provided. Ida is standing and is the second woman from the right, wearing a purple shirt.

loans.use: to buy shirts, t-shirts, pants, and jackets.

loans.name: Usman

texts.en: Usman is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Usman would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Usman can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Usman is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing  for his family, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Sua

texts.en: Sua is a 50-year-old mother with three children who runs a business selling taro and banana in her village. She has been doing this for more than five years to earn a living. Sua has requested for a loan to buy taro roots, banana tube, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves to assist her in the business. She will expand her business in the future using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2006.

loans.use: to buy taro roots, banana tube, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves

loans.name: Tabora Group

texts.en:
Halima, who is in her mid-thirties, is a widow with four children, and all of them are big. She has been running two projects: selling charcoal, and making and selling local snacks, like mandazi, donate, vitumbua, chapati, and bagiya. She has been in her business for eighteen years now. She works from 4:30 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Halima's ninth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her charcoal stock and to make more bites, and she has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal and to buy backing flour, cooking oil, sugar, salt, and rice for making vitumbua. She dreams of opening a mamalishe business.

Halima will share this loan with her loan group Tabora, which consists of seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and to buy backing flour, cooking oil, sugar, salt, and rice for making vitumbua.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a 60-year-old married woman and a mother of six grown children from Ajuy, Iloilo. She has engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now. Rosita is also engaged in selling dried fish. 

Rosita is asking to take a loan to buy more dried fish to sell. This loan will enable Rosita to improve her business as well as her income. Rosita dreams of making her dried fish sales more profitable and stable.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita has mastered her hog raising business to the point where she makes a living and is able to support her family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail credit to fully support her business. 

The same way she takes care of her hog raising business, she also takes care of her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always run to the cooperative for any financing needs. Currently, the loan of PHP 12,000 will help her to build concrete pig pens that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to build concrete pig pens

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 34 years old and has seven children. Rosalinda is a woman and five of her children are in school.

Rosalinda is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Rosalinda requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosalinda has been farming rice for four years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ile

texts.en:
Ile is a 78-year-old mother with seven children. She had a small business sewing clothes to sell in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years.

Ile has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, needles, a sewing machine and a tape measure to help her with the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, needles, a sewing machine, and a tape measure

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is a 38-year-old woman from Ajuy, Iloilo. She earns a living through her hog raising business. Analie has been in the business for more than three years now. 

Analie is asking to take a loan to buy more piglets to raise as well as animal feed. With a loan, Analie will be able to improve her hog raising business and makes it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for future reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and more piglets to raise

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie is a fish vendor from Iloilo, Philippines. She is 48 years old, married, and has three dependents. 

Girlie has engaged in the fish vending business for several years now. This is the source of her income. Girlie is asking to take a loan to buy more fish to sell. With a loan, Girlie will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more fish to her customers. 

In the future, Girlie hopes of making her fish vending business a success.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: La señora Emilia es una persona humilde, de estado civil casada, solo alcanzo a estudiar hasta el nivel primario, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo, ambos se dedican a la agricultura, su casa está ubicada en la provincia Tiraque del departamento de Cochabamba. Tiene cuatro hijos pequeños que asisten a la escuela para tener una mejor educación. Los productos que más cultiva son papa, arveja, haba y maíz. Emilia es una persona responsable y trabajadora al igual que su esposo solicita un crédito para ampliar su producción y comprar insumos agrícolas como abono y ganados, para así aumentar sus ingresos con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Emilia is a modest person, she is married, she was only able to study until the primary level. She lives in her own home with her husband, they both work in agriculture. Their house is located in the Tiraque province of the area of Cochabamba. They have four small children who go to school to have a better education. The products that she cultivates the most are potatoes, peas, beans, and maize. Emilia is a responsible and hard-working person, the same as her husband. She asks for a loan to expand production and buy agricultural insets, such as fertilizers and manure, to be able to increase her income with the goal of improving the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to expand production and buy agricultural insets, such as fertilizers and manure, to be able to increase her income with the goal of improving the living conditions of her family

loans.name: Sinaraha

texts.en:
Sinaraha runs a hotel (restaurant) business in Mombasa town and she has been working hard in her business for the past two years. She has been able to support her family. She is 21 years old, married and together with her spouse, has been blessed with two children. 

She has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy more stock of baking flour, sugar, cooking oil and cereals for use in her business. 

This will enable her to serve more customers and make more income, which she will use to expand her business. This is her first loan and her future hopes are to be successful and provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy more stock of baking flour, cooking oil and cereals.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 54 years old and has three children. Vicenta is married and one of her children is in school.

Vicenta is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Vicenta has been farming rice for four years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Vicenta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Cathyln

texts.en:
Cathyln is 31 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Cathyln is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cathyln has been raising pigs for three years and earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rev. Bitrus Fasto

texts.en:
Rev. Bitrus Fasto is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Rev. Bitrus Fasto joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Gaius, Yafta and Benjamin. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Rev. Bitrus Fasto would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rev. Bitrus Fasto can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Rev. Bitrus Fasto spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are fully educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, thus eliminating pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jovana

texts.es: Jovana tiene 36años y dos hijos, uno tiene dos años y su hija mayor (aparece en la foto) tiene 18 Jovana es casada pero su esposo tuvo que ir a trabajar al exterior y le envia dinero para los gastos.  Jovana se dedica al comercio de ropa de bebé y recibe pago por comisiones, trabaja en este negocio desde hace tres años Jovana quiere un credito para pagar las mensualidades de la universidad de su hija que empezará la carrera de Bioquímica Jovana quiere que sus hijos tengan una buena educación, puesto que Jovana no pudo ingresar a la universidad, de esta manera los hijos podrán ser más competitivos y no tendrán que migrar como lo hizo el esposo
texts.en: Jovana is 36 years old and has two children, one is two years old and her older daughter (who appears in the photo) is 18. Jovana is married, but her husband had to go work abroad and sends her money for expenses. Jovana works in retail with baby clothing and receives pay by commission. She has worked in this business for three years. Jovana wants a loan to pay the monthly university payments of her daughter, who will start a degree in Biochemistry. Jovana wants her children to have a good education, because Jovana could not attend university. In this way, her children can be more competitive and they will not have to migrate in the same way her husband did.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s monthly university payments.

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.en: Saturnino is a businessman from Cebulin, Plaridel. He is 41 years old, married and has expertise in selling. He runs a sari-sari store and earns a good income that sufficiently supports his family. Saturnino is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. He maintains his membership in good standing without records of default. Now, he applied for a loan to restock his store with basic commodities and other assorted items to sell, to meet his customers' demand. Saturnino continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that he has the passion and the determination to make ends meet for his family.

loans.use: to restock his store with basic commodities and other assorted items to sell, to meet his customers' demands
